As a misfit goth teenager who grew up watching 18+ shows on Showcase TV with the volume turned low, I was told by grown-ups that when I escape my small town, I need to find a way to live on Queen West, where the weirdos are. And now I do! I do my writing and magic-making from my bachelorex apartment on the traditional territory of the Haudenosaunee and the Métis, also known as the city of Toronto (from the Haudenosaunee word Tkaronto), Ontario. I've lived here for four and a half years, and plan to stay until my building crumbles in on me.I’m a capital-C Crazy writer, zinester, witch, identical twin, high school dropout, cane-user, recovering alcoholic with 6+ years sober, cripple-goth, and white non-binary amethyst-femme. My pronoun is they. I write about recovery with borderline personality disorder, complex-trauma, and fibromyalgia; writing, creativity, & friendship; politicizing recovery; magic & witchcraft & Tarot; self-care, support, & $upport; and surviving poverty. I’ve been writing zines for fifteen years. In 2012, I published an anthology, Telegram: A Collection of 27 Issues, and in 2013, I published my first novel, Ragdoll House. As well as We Are the Weirdos, I’m also working on a book of non-fiction, To Be True to My Own Weirdnesses. I also offer Tarot readings for misfits & outcasts, and I publish a fortnightly column on LittleRedTarot.com, See the Cripple Dance. You can read more of my work at marandaelizabeth.com, schoolformaps.etsy.com, and @MarandaDearest on Twitter.While We Are the Weirdos is a work (and it’s taken many years of work!) of fiction, much of it is influenced by my own experiences with growing up in poverty, devastating and excruciating forms of body and gender dysmorphia and dysphoria (before I knew those words, or the differences between those words), emotional neglect and physical violence, bullying, and not-being-believed. Being arrested, charged, and incarcerated multiple times in my early-teens contributed to my later diagnoses of complex-(p)TSD, borderline personality disorder, and fibromyalgia, as well as chronic feelings of alienation and isolation. Working on this novel has been a necessary and illuminating process in my ongoing recovery, as well as a major project that has sustained me through the last few years of a chronic illness which left me housebound, hungry, and alone.When I was thirteen, I started reading zines, and in my mid-teens, I started making my own. My twin and I made a few zines together before we started making them on our own. Telegram is a zine I’ve been making for fifteen years. Early issues told personal stories on coping with loneliness in a small town, living inside books, and seeking magical friendships. Eventually, I wrote about mental illnesses, psych wards, chronic pain, disability, social assistance, and witchcraft, and in later issues, I wrote more about politicizing these experiences and re-imagining my writing as not only personal, but as spiritual and political contributions to mad and crip communities and lineages. I’ve been maintaining and Etsy shop with zines, books, and Tarot readings for eleven years. You can support my work at schoolformaps.etsy.com!Along with my zines, I've also written e a blog on themes of madness, accessibility, disability, friendship, creativity, and self-care for many years. I recently wrote, What is Art About Social Assistance?, and talked about (re-)conceptualizing my writing as a contribution to this form of art, as well as reciprocity, inaccessibility, and high school dropout feelings. The piece includes a link to my Wishlist, with notes on texts about disability and poverty being too fucking expensive.Other examples of my work are:♥ Beyond Borderline and The Protest Psychosis: Black & White Protest Diseases & Politicizing Madness (Part One of An Ongoing Series)♥ Bruises Self-Heal: the Body in Retrograde♥ Won't You Celebrate with Femme Cripples & Other Storybooks♥ Further Notes on Reclaiming Borderline and Resisting the Sane Gaze♥ Making Spaces Accessible & Scent-Free to Create Opportunities for Friendship, Connection, & Support♥ How to Support the Writer &/Or Artist In Your Life♥ Creativity & Jealousy♥ Self-Care for Zinesters♥ How to Be A Good Friend to CrazyfolkI also wrote a three-part series on Exploring Trauma, Madness, Chronic Illness, and Disability with Tarot. In Part One, I wrote about the Five of Pentacles and Three of Swords, in Part Two, I wrote about the Two of Pentacles and Eight of Cups, and in Part Three, I wrote about the Nine of Wands and Three of Pentacles.While this work is very much continuing, my boundaries are changing, and I prefer to focus on fiction right now. Last March, I published an excerpt of an unnamed novella I’m working on, a near-future imagining of queer and trans crips and mad folks taking up space in a city where gentrification is slowly being unspelled by crazy and disabled witches, which you can read here:  The Horizon Condos Experiment: excerpt from an untitled novella.♥ About the Illustrator ♥♥ Cee Lavery ♥I'm a self-taught (still teaching, still learning) illustrator and artist raised on Treaty 6 territory, on the traditional land of Cree peoples as well as the homeland of the Métis Nation (also known as Saskatoon). A first-and-a-half generation immigrant settler, I grew up in a white middle class two-parent home surrounded by books, music, and access to myriad forms and modes of art - I share these privileges for the sake of transparency, and because I believe they inform my work, as well as my perception of, and collaboration with Maranda's words, which have a history much different than my own.My experiences as a genderqueer transmasculine-ish scamp-menace-big-kid-adventurer, a childcare worker, and an amateur plant enthusiast are, I think, evident in my drawings - there is a curiosity and delight in detail, a flagrant disregard for rules, and a deep love of instinct, vulnerability, and play in the work I create.Currently, I am writing + drawing a graphic memoir in addition to my usual graphic design + editorial illustration work for small businesses and web + print media. I do this from my home studio in Montréal, traditional and unceded territory of the Kanien’keha:ka (Mohawk). You can find examples of my work at CeeLavery.com. I am honoured and overjoyed to collaborate with one of my dearest and oldest friends on this beautiful, uncategorizable, rebellious, and magical book.♥ About Our Friendship & Collaborations ♥Cee Lavery and I have been friends for nearly a decade. We met in a line-up at Union Station waiting for a Go bus. Cee complimented my plastic barrettes, and we realized we were both on our way to the same place: the Hamilton Anarchist Zine Fair. We became fast friends and pen pals, and we’ve collaborated multiple times since then, including designing zine covers and comics. Most recently, they’ve illustrated multiple personal essays I’ve published with TheEstablishment.co, which you can read here:How Magic Helps Me Live with Pain and TraumaDreaming New Meanings into Borderline Personality DisorderWhy I've Learned to Embrace JOMO: The Joy of Missing OutHow to Support Your Disabled Friends in Winter and Beyond♥ PERKS ♥$6 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos!$13 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos, and you'll receive a copy of the e-book.$33 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos, and you'll receive a copy of the e-book as well as a paperback copy of We Are the Weirdos!$44 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos, and you'll receive a copy of the e-book as well as a paperback copy of We Are the Weirdos, and a personalized postcard from Maranda Elizabeth.$66 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos, and you'll receive a copy of the e-book as well as two paperback copies of We Are the Weirdos - one for you & one for your local library - and a personalized postcard from Maranda Elizabeth.$99 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos, and you'll receive a copy of the e-book as well as two paperback copies of We Are the Weirdos - one for you & one for your local library - as well as a personalized postcard from Maranda Elizabeth, and a single-card Tarot reading from them, too! (Please read the description of Tarot readings & delivery methods at schoolformaps.etsy.com.)$113 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos, and you'll receive a copy of the e-book as well as two paperback copies of We Are the Weirdos - one for you & one for your local library - as well as a personalized postcard from Maranda Elizabeth, a custom illustration by Cee Lavery of you as your favourite Tarot card!$133 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos, and you'll receive a copy of the e-book as well as two paperback copies of We Are the Weirdos - one for you & one for your local library - as well as a personalized postcard from Maranda Elizabeth, a custom illustration by Cee Lavery of you as your favourite Tarot card, and a single-card Tarot reading from Maranda Elizabeth! (Please read the description of Tarot readings & delivery methods at schoolformaps.etsy.com.)$166 - Your name will be printed on a list of contributors inside the e-book & paperback versions of We Are the Weirdos, and you'll receive a copy of the e-book as well as two paperback copies of We Are the Weirdos - one for you & one for your local library - as well as a personalized postcard from Maranda Elizabeth, a custom illustration by Cee Lavery of you as your favourite Tarot card, and a three-card Tarot reading from Maranda Elizabeth!   (Please read the description of Tarot readings & delivery methods at schoolformaps.etsy.com.)♥ How to Support Us ♥Whether or not you're able to contribute today, we hope you'll share our work and encourage your pals to get involved! Please share our campaign on your social media, and tell your friends about it. To read more of Maranda Elizabeth's work, including zines & books, check out schoolformaps.etsy.com, and consider supporting Maranda & Cee by offering donations to PayPal.me/MarandaElizabeth & PayPal.me/CeeLavery. Stay witchy!

story:
My name is Kittana. I’m a single mother. I am a survivor of both childhood sexual abuse and of domestic abuse as an adult. I live with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder.  I was diagnosed at age 24. I had always had symptoms but at that time in my life I had gone through a particularly rough time and as a result of the stress I was triggered into a depression. I was sent to my family doctor who referred me to a psychologist. It took several weeks to get in with the psychologist. During this time no other form of help was offered to me. When I finally saw the psychologist I advised him that I was interested in exploring non medicinal methods for help first. He sent me home advising me to talk about what happened to me and that I would be called at a later date to refer me to treatment. I never received that call.

Years later I found myself in an abusive marriage with a newborn who nearly died at birth, and naturally I was triggered quite seriously. Luckily I recognized the trigger and went straight to my doctor. He wasted no time referring me to a psychologist and this time I accepted medical treatment. I was prescribed anti-depressants and placed on a wait list for both a psychologist and for survivor groups. The wait for a psychologist was 2 years. The wait for the groups was 9 months to a year.

Andy Borrowitz once tweeted: “If only mental health care were as easy to get as say..a gun.”

The anti-depressants helped, but they had many side effects that only served to displace my symptoms. What I really needed was therapy. There was nothing I could do. No one told me what other options were available. I was just sent on my way. The only person who checked in on me was my doctor. I’m fortunate that I had him at the time.

So I was left on my own to try and find ways to cope and feeling very alone. A new mom in an abusive marriage with no one available to talk to. I used the internet to research my condition and stumbled (luckily) unto a chat group. It was heavily moderated by persons who had no experience in helping and had no clue how to deal with people who suffered from PTSD, however the chat group was probably the best thing for me at the time. The simple act of reading others experiences and sharing my own was what got me through.

I eventually left my husband and the shelter I was in moved me to a new city, as a result I was removed from the wait list without being offered any alternatives or options in my area. I still have never received treatment for my condition, but I am better prepared to handle my situation and this came from reading others experiences.  I opened up publicly and received many emails from people who suffer from PTSD and other conditions thanking me, telling me that reading my story helped them. It was very hard to write. There are many triggers in reliving what happened to me. But the emails got me through it!

If a simple blog helped so many, imagine what a book could do?  Because of this, I want to write my story and share it in hopes that it might help anyone, even one person. I'm not writing a "woe is me" story. I'm writing a "this happened and I got through it, and continue to do so..and so can you!" story. But I don't want to stop there. There are others who have survival stories contributing to this. It's a compilation of survival stories so that others can see that this is possible! You don't choose to become a victim, but you can choose to be a survivor. No one can take that from you. This book will be proof!

Writing a book takes a lot of time and dedication. It also costs a lot of money to edit and publish. As a result, I need help to make this happen.  I am asking for donations to help me make this book possible. If you can contribute financially, that is a very big help! If you or someone you know is a survivor and would like to donate their story to this cause, that is an even bigger help! If you can spread the word about this campaign to help, you are amazing!

story:
Traduction française ci-dessous

Mali has a unique opportunity to take a step towards more transparent and credible governance, but it will not happen without active citizen participation.

When Mali's elected President Amadou Toumani Toure was deposed in a coup in March of last year, many in the West and in the Malian diaspora quickly called for a return to democracy. But many Malians living in the country have long been disenchanted with Mali's democracy. Weak institutions, entrenched corruption, and political parties acting largely in their own interests have led to poor governance and to a lack of confidence among voters.

Mali's relatively young democracy has never seen voter turnout crack 40%. What's more, many voters have cast ballots for the wrong reasons. Political parties have in the past openly distributed foodstuffs, fabrics, and sometimes cash, to win favor with voters.

Objectives

As Mali prepares to hold elections for the first time in 6 years, an organization of Malians has been formed to ensure that Mali's democracy does not exist in name only. SOS Démocratie has two objectives:

  1. To raise voter turnout in Mali 

  2. To ensure transparency, liberty, and credibility with respect to voters' choices 

Projects

To achieve these objectives, SOS Démocratie is undertaking several projects:

  • Town hall meetings to raise voter turnout and identify issues. This is an outreach program that sends volunteer members of the group to Mali's various communes and districts to engage citizens through a “day of action and awareness.” This program involves meeting with local leadership and inviting residents to attend a town hall style event hosted by SOS Démocratie. This event is interactive, with questions like “How has democracy in Mali functioned so far? How has Mali arrived at its current situation? What needs to change?” The ultimate goal with this program is to catalog issues that are important to the voters in that locality and to show to voters why their active participation in Mali's democracy is imperative.
  • Advocacy with respect to issues raised in town hall meetings. Another component of SOS Démocratie involves pressuring the government and candidates themselves to respond to concerns raised by voters in these town halls. The group will lobby for public exchanges between candidates that can be broadcast on television and radio. SOS Démocratie will also pressure candidates to be forthright and transparent with respect to their political platform.
  • A short comedy film that shows how Mali's political culture has been flawed while explaining how things can be better. To complement these activities, SOS Démocratie is working with a local theater troupe to release a sketch comedy film that will underscore the group's political message. The script is complete and the sketch was recently performed live to an audience in Bamako. The next step is to film the sketch and to distribute it far and wide via DVD, USB key, and cellphone p2p transfers.
  • Election monitoring through Ushahidi, an open source mapping platform. Finally, SOS Démocratie plans to create a citizens network for monitoring elections (whenever they happen) using the http://www.ushahidi.com/ platform.

Funding needs

The group has already held the first “day of action and awareness” in the Bamako neighborhood of Fadjiguila and now plans to launch its national campaign. While we have streamlined costs as much as possible (all members are volunteers and lodging and food, when not offered, will be sought at an inexpensive level), we have the following needs that require funding:

  • Production and distribution costs for the film

  • Logistics costs for traveling volunteers (transport, food, lodging)

  • Purchased airtime on TV and radio

  • Audio equipment (for recording town hall meetings)

  • Miscellaneous expenses (phone credit, printing materials etc.)

Transforming Mali's political culture will not be easy, but the country's current situation provides a unique opportunity to take a step towards better governance. Mali cannot afford another government that is not representative of its people. Consider supporting SOS Démocratie in their efforts to help Mali build a credible democracy.  

Skeptical? 

There is good reason to be skeptical when it comes to Mali's 2013 Presidential elections. The northern town of Kidal is still held by the rebel group MNLA, there are lingering security concerns in other northern cities, and much of Mali's public administration has not returned to the region. In addition, many Malians are internally displaced and hundreds of thousands of refugees remain in neighborhing countries. Many have called Mali's July elections premature and there are legitimate doubts about the country's ability to properly organize polling.

All of that said, it appears that elections will move forward on their current scheduled timeline, which makes the grassroots work of SOS Democracy all the more important. While international organizations and the Malian government try to coordinate the large machinery of bureaucracy to sensitize people ahead of the elections, here is a group of Malian activists that are putting in their own time, explaining to people not just how to vote, but why to vote, because the future of their country matters to them. Any money you contribute will go directly to a very streamlined and efficient effort to transform Mali's poltical culture, an effort that has been initiated by concerned Malians. 

Not a one time effort

While we are asking for funding that will assist SOS Democracy's efforts ahead of the presidential elections, the work does not end there. The same plan of action will be implemented before Mali's legislative and municipal elections, which in many ways have a more tangible impact on local communities. This project is not about one presidential election, it is about redefining democracy and changing Mali's political culture over the long-term. 

If you want to see what a SOS Democracy town hall meeting looks like, please have a look at this post (http://philintheblank.net/2013/05/28/why-this-can-work/).

For additional information please visit sosdemocratiemali.org

------

En mars 2012, aussi bien la communauté internationale que la diaspora malienne ont condamné le coup d’Etat qui a renversé le président malien Amadou Toumani Touré. Tous ont exigé un retour à l’ordre constitutionnel normal. Or, pour beaucoup de Maliens vivant dans le pays, le contrat de confiance avec la République avait été rompu. Pour ces Maliens déçus par la démocratie, les nombreux maux socio-économiques viennent de la mauvaise pratique de la démocratie, qui n’était en fait à leurs yeux qu’une façade. La faiblesse des institutions, l’enracinement de la corruption, le manque d’opposition malgré la pléthore de partis politiques – mais sans aucun projet de société concret – figurent parmi les raisons de la mauvaise gouvernance, qui a, elle, conduit à un manque de confiance généralisé.


En vingt (20) ans de pratique dite démocratique par l’opinion internationale, le Mali n'a pourtant jamais connu plus de 40% de participation aux différents suffrages électoraux. Et dans la plupart des cas, ceux qui ont voté l’ont fait pour de mauvaises raisons, sans vraiment comprendre le sens de leur vote ou simplement en ‘monnayant’ leur voix contre de l’argent ou d’autres biens matériels. Ce n’est un secret pour personne que la pratique courante des partis politiques était de distribuer des billets de mille (1000F) francs CFA, du thé, du sucre, des t-shirts, des pagnes, des marmites, etc. pour ‘acheter’ les voix des électeurs. 

Objectifs


A l’approche des prochaines échéances électorales, prévues pour juillet 2013, notre organisation citoyenne SOS Démocratie compte contribuer à la correction du système démocratique malien : s’assurer que la démocratie au Mali ne soit pas simplement de façade mais bien la vraie application d’un pouvoir choisi par la majorité du peuple conformément à ses idéaux et en toute indépendance. Pour ce faire, SOS Démocratie vise deux objectifs : 

  1. L’augmentation du taux de participation des électeurs
  2. Assurer la transparence, la liberté, l’indépendance et la crédibilité du choix des électeurs 

Projets

Pour atteindre ses objectifs, SOS Démocratie compte sur plusieurs projets :

 

  • Un programme de sensibilisation, couvrant l’ensemble du territoire ainsi que la diaspora, vise à envoyer des volontaires auprès des communautés locales pour démarcher les citoyens à travers des "journées d'action et de sensibilisation." Ce programme s’appuie sur une collaboration avec les dignitaires locaux dans le but de toucher le maximum d’habitants au sein des différentes communes. Les modules développés au cours de ces journées de sensibilisation seront interactifs. Des discussions autour de questions telle que : comment fonctionnait la démocratie au Mali de 1991 à nos jours? Qu'est-ce qui a marché ? Que devrait t-on changer ? L’objectif ultime de ce programme est de recenser les questions importantes aux yeux des électeurs et de les convaincre que la démocratie ne saurait fonctionner sans leur participation active tant individuelle que collective. 
  • L’organisation de groupes de lobbying auprès des candidats eux-mêmes afin d’organiser des débats répondant aux préoccupations des populations recensées lors des journées de sensibilisation. SOS Démocratie entend ainsi mettre la pression sur les candidats pour plus d’information et de transparence sur leur plateforme politique, leur mode de gouvernance et leur projet de société. 
  • En plus de ces activités, SOS Démocratie a également élaboré en collaboration avec une troupe de théâtre (Groupe Yérèdon) un sketch pour mieux sensibiliser les populations à propos des différents enjeux démocratiques et des modalités de vote lors des prochaines élections. Le sketch ainsi que l’ensemble du module de sensibilisation ont été testés auprès de la population de Fadjiguila dans la commune I du district de Bamako le 27 avril 2013 lors de la Journée de sensibilisation organisée dans le Foyer des jeunes de cette localité. L'étape suivante consistera à filmer cette pièce comique pour la distribuer de façon massive en DVD, sur clé USB et via les réseaux P2P sur téléphones portables.
  • Enfin, SOS Démocratie envisage de créer un réseau de citoyens engagés pour surveiller la bonne marche des élections au Mali chaque fois qu’elles auront lieu à l'aide de la plateforme Ushahidi http://www.ushahidi.com/. Les prochaines élections en juillet devraient déjà pouvoir bénéficier d’un tel système de monitoring.

Besoins

Après la première sortie sur Fadjiguila et le bon accueil fait par la population, particulièrement de la part des notables et des chefs traditionnels, SOS Démocratie doit désormais démarrer sa campagne nationale conformément au calendrier établi. Même si toutes les activités ont été élaborées dans un esprit citoyen et bénévole (tous les membres sont des volontaires, les prestations de la troupe de théâtre ne sont pas non plus rémunérées), SOS Démocratie aura à faire face à certaines dépenses pour s’assurer que les objectifs soient atteints avec les résultats escomptés :

  • Les coûts associés à l’achat de matériel audio (pour les comédiens et la tenue des journées de sensibilisation) 
  • Les frais de production et de reproduction du sketch sur les différents supports
  • Les coûts associés à la diffusion sur les ondes radio et télé du sketch – frais des temps d’antenne
  • Les frais pour le transport et la logistique (alimentation, hébergement) pour les volontaires dans le cadre de la tenue des différentes journées de sensibilisation aux niveaux des communes.
  • Autres frais divers pour les besoins administratifs (téléphones, impressions, coursiers, connexion internet, etc.) 

SOS Démocratie est conscient des enjeux : transformer la culture politique du Mali ne sera pas facile. Cependant la situation actuelle du pays offre une occasion unique de faire un pas vers une meilleure gouvernance. L’opinion nationale aussi bien qu’internationale sont unanimes quant au besoin d’un changement de comportement, la nécessité d’une participation active de la population au « jeu démocratique ». Il est clair pour tous que le Mali ne peut se permettre un autre gouvernement non représentatif ou une nouvelle démocratie de façade. Pour la survie de la nation et un développement social et économique durable, les prochains élus de la République devront réellement être les représentants légitimes de la majorité du peuple et exercer le pouvoir en toute transparence, en respectant l’opposition comme le contre pouvoir qu’elle est dans l’intérêt de la nation.


Merci de soutenir SOS Démocratie dans ses efforts pour reconstruire une vraie démocratie forte et crédible au Mali.

story_txt:
Traduction française ci-dessous
Mali has a unique opportunity to take a step towards more transparent and credible governance, but it will not happen without active citizen participation.
When Mali's elected President Amadou Toumani Toure was deposed in a coup in March of last year, many in the West and in the Malian diaspora quickly called for a return to democracy. But many Malians living in the country have long been disenchanted with Mali's democracy. Weak institutions, entrenched corruption, and political parties acting largely in their own interests have led to poor governance and to a lack of confidence among voters.
Mali's relatively young democracy has never seen voter turnout crack 40%. What's more, many voters have cast ballots for the wrong reasons. Political parties have in the past openly distributed foodstuffs, fabrics, and sometimes cash, to win favor with voters.
Objectives
As Mali prepares to hold elections for the first time in 6 years, an organization of Malians has been formed to ensure that Mali's democracy does not exist in name only. SOS Démocratie has two objectives:

To raise voter turnout in Mali 

To ensure transparency, liberty, and credibility with respect to voters' choices 

Projects
To achieve these objectives, SOS Démocratie is undertaking several projects:


Town hall meetings to raise voter turnout and identify issues. This is an outreach program that sends volunteer members of the group to Mali's various communes and districts to engage citizens through a “day of action and awareness.” This program involves meeting with local leadership and inviting residents to attend a town hall style event hosted by SOS Démocratie. This event is interactive, with questions like “How has democracy in Mali functioned so far? How has Mali arrived at its current situation? What needs to change?” The ultimate goal with this program is to catalog issues that are important to the voters in that locality and to show to voters why their active participation in Mali's democracy is imperative.

Advocacy with respect to issues raised in town hall meetings. Another component of SOS Démocratie involves pressuring the government and candidates themselves to respond to concerns raised by voters in these town halls. The group will lobby for public exchanges between candidates that can be broadcast on television and radio. SOS Démocratie will also pressure candidates to be forthright and transparent with respect to their political platform.

A short comedy film that shows how Mali's political culture has been flawed while explaining how things can be better. To complement these activities, SOS Démocratie is working with a local theater troupe to release a sketch comedy film that will underscore the group's political message. The script is complete and the sketch was recently performed live to an audience in Bamako. The next step is to film the sketch and to distribute it far and wide via DVD, USB key, and cellphone p2p transfers.

Election monitoring through Ushahidi, an open source mapping platform. Finally, SOS Démocratie plans to create a citizens network for monitoring elections (whenever they happen) using the http://www.ushahidi.com/ platform.
Funding needs
The group has already held the first “day of action and awareness” in the Bamako neighborhood of Fadjiguila and now plans to launch its national campaign. While we have streamlined costs as much as possible (all members are volunteers and lodging and food, when not offered, will be sought at an inexpensive level), we have the following needs that require funding:


Production and distribution costs for the film


Logistics costs for traveling volunteers (transport, food, lodging)


Purchased airtime on TV and radio


Audio equipment (for recording town hall meetings)


Miscellaneous expenses (phone credit, printing materials etc.)

Transforming Mali's political culture will not be easy, but the country's current situation provides a unique opportunity to take a step towards better governance. Mali cannot afford another government that is not representative of its people. Consider supporting SOS Démocratie in their efforts to help Mali build a credible democracy.  
Skeptical? 
There is good reason to be skeptical when it comes to Mali's 2013 Presidential elections. The northern town of Kidal is still held by the rebel group MNLA, there are lingering security concerns in other northern cities, and much of Mali's public administration has not returned to the region. In addition, many Malians are internally displaced and hundreds of thousands of refugees remain in neighborhing countries. Many have called Mali's July elections premature and there are legitimate doubts about the country's ability to properly organize polling.
All of that said, it appears that elections will move forward on their current scheduled timeline, which makes the grassroots work of SOS Democracy all the more important. While international organizations and the Malian government try to coordinate the large machinery of bureaucracy to sensitize people ahead of the elections, here is a group of Malian activists that are putting in their own time, explaining to people not just how to vote, but why to vote, because the future of their country matters to them. Any money you contribute will go directly to a very streamlined and efficient effort to transform Mali's poltical culture, an effort that has been initiated by concerned Malians. 
Not a one time effort
While we are asking for funding that will assist SOS Democracy's efforts ahead of the presidential elections, the work does not end there. The same plan of action will be implemented before Mali's legislative and municipal elections, which in many ways have a more tangible impact on local communities. This project is not about one presidential election, it is about redefining democracy and changing Mali's political culture over the long-term. 
If you want to see what a SOS Democracy town hall meeting looks like, please have a look at this post (http://philintheblank.net/2013/05/28/why-this-can-work/).
For additional information please visit sosdemocratiemali.org
------
En mars 2012, aussi bien la communauté internationale que la diaspora malienne ont condamné le coup d’Etat qui a renversé le président malien Amadou Toumani Touré. Tous ont exigé un retour à l’ordre constitutionnel normal. Or, pour beaucoup de Maliens vivant dans le pays, le contrat de confiance avec la République avait été rompu. Pour ces Maliens déçus par la démocratie, les nombreux maux socio-économiques viennent de la mauvaise pratique de la démocratie, qui n’était en fait à leurs yeux qu’une façade. La faiblesse des institutions, l’enracinement de la corruption, le manque d’opposition malgré la pléthore de partis politiques – mais sans aucun projet de société concret – figurent parmi les raisons de la mauvaise gouvernance, qui a, elle, conduit à un manque de confiance généralisé.
En vingt (20) ans de pratique dite démocratique par l’opinion internationale, le Mali n'a pourtant jamais connu plus de 40% de participation aux différents suffrages électoraux. Et dans la plupart des cas, ceux qui ont voté l’ont fait pour de mauvaises raisons, sans vraiment comprendre le sens de leur vote ou simplement en ‘monnayant’ leur voix contre de l’argent ou d’autres biens matériels. Ce n’est un secret pour personne que la pratique courante des partis politiques était de distribuer des billets de mille (1000F) francs CFA, du thé, du sucre, des t-shirts, des pagnes, des marmites, etc. pour ‘acheter’ les voix des électeurs. 
Objectifs
A l’approche des prochaines échéances électorales, prévues pour juillet 2013, notre organisation citoyenne SOS Démocratie compte contribuer à la correction du système démocratique malien : s’assurer que la démocratie au Mali ne soit pas simplement de façade mais bien la vraie application d’un pouvoir choisi par la majorité du peuple conformément à ses idéaux et en toute indépendance. Pour ce faire, SOS Démocratie vise deux objectifs : 

L’augmentation du taux de participation des électeurs
Assurer la transparence, la liberté, l’indépendance et la crédibilité du choix des électeurs 
Projets
Pour atteindre ses objectifs, SOS Démocratie compte sur plusieurs projets :
 

Un programme de sensibilisation, couvrant l’ensemble du territoire ainsi que la diaspora, vise à envoyer des volontaires auprès des communautés locales pour démarcher les citoyens à travers des "journées d'action et de sensibilisation." Ce programme s’appuie sur une collaboration avec les dignitaires locaux dans le but de toucher le maximum d’habitants au sein des différentes communes. Les modules développés au cours de ces journées de sensibilisation seront interactifs. Des discussions autour de questions telle que : comment fonctionnait la démocratie au Mali de 1991 à nos jours? Qu'est-ce qui a marché ? Que devrait t-on changer ? L’objectif ultime de ce programme est de recenser les questions importantes aux yeux des électeurs et de les convaincre que la démocratie ne saurait fonctionner sans leur participation active tant individuelle que collective. 
L’organisation de groupes de lobbying auprès des candidats eux-mêmes afin d’organiser des débats répondant aux préoccupations des populations recensées lors des journées de sensibilisation. SOS Démocratie entend ainsi mettre la pression sur les candidats pour plus d’information et de transparence sur leur plateforme politique, leur mode de gouvernance et leur projet de société. 
En plus de ces activités, SOS Démocratie a également élaboré en collaboration avec une troupe de théâtre (Groupe Yérèdon) un sketch pour mieux sensibiliser les populations à propos des différents enjeux démocratiques et des modalités de vote lors des prochaines élections. Le sketch ainsi que l’ensemble du module de sensibilisation ont été testés auprès de la population de Fadjiguila dans la commune I du district de Bamako le 27 avril 2013 lors de la Journée de sensibilisation organisée dans le Foyer des jeunes de cette localité. L'étape suivante consistera à filmer cette pièce comique pour la distribuer de façon massive en DVD, sur clé USB et via les réseaux P2P sur téléphones portables.
Enfin, SOS Démocratie envisage de créer un réseau de citoyens engagés pour surveiller la bonne marche des élections au Mali chaque fois qu’elles auront lieu à l'aide de la plateforme Ushahidi http://www.ushahidi.com/. Les prochaines élections en juillet devraient déjà pouvoir bénéficier d’un tel système de monitoring.
Besoins
Après la première sortie sur Fadjiguila et le bon accueil fait par la population, particulièrement de la part des notables et des chefs traditionnels, SOS Démocratie doit désormais démarrer sa campagne nationale conformément au calendrier établi. Même si toutes les activités ont été élaborées dans un esprit citoyen et bénévole (tous les membres sont des volontaires, les prestations de la troupe de théâtre ne sont pas non plus rémunérées), SOS Démocratie aura à faire face à certaines dépenses pour s’assurer que les objectifs soient atteints avec les résultats escomptés :

Les coûts associés à l’achat de matériel audio (pour les comédiens et la tenue des journées de sensibilisation) 
Les frais de production et de reproduction du sketch sur les différents supports
Les coûts associés à la diffusion sur les ondes radio et télé du sketch – frais des temps d’antenne
Les frais pour le transport et la logistique (alimentation, hébergement) pour les volontaires dans le cadre de la tenue des différentes journées de sensibilisation aux niveaux des communes.
Autres frais divers pour les besoins administratifs (téléphones, impressions, coursiers, connexion internet, etc.) 
SOS Démocratie est conscient des enjeux : transformer la culture politique du Mali ne sera pas facile. Cependant la situation actuelle du pays offre une occasion unique de faire un pas vers une meilleure gouvernance. L’opinion nationale aussi bien qu’internationale sont unanimes quant au besoin d’un changement de comportement, la nécessité d’une participation active de la population au « jeu démocratique ». Il est clair pour tous que le Mali ne peut se permettre un autre gouvernement non représentatif ou une nouvelle démocratie de façade. Pour la survie de la nation et un développement social et économique durable, les prochains élus de la République devront réellement être les représentants légitimes de la majorité du peuple et exercer le pouvoir en toute transparence, en respectant l’opposition comme le contre pouvoir qu’elle est dans l’intérêt de la nation.
Merci de soutenir SOS Démocratie dans ses efforts pour reconstruire une vraie démocratie forte et crédible au Mali.
Pour plus d'infos, visitez le site sosdemocratiemali.org

story:
Fort d'une expérience de 15 années dans le milieu de la mode et de la photo de mode en tant que styliste de plateau, directeur artistique et journaliste spécialisé en mode et joaillerie, j'ai fondé le magazine "Blake" en novembre 2007 qui fût le 1er magazine masculin online en France. Ce magazine est un magazine mode et lifestyle s'adressant à des lecteurs entre 30 et 45 ans. Loin des diktats des magazines habituels qui vous disent ce qu'il faut ou ne faut pas porter, "Blake" adopte une liberté de tons et un principe simple: si cela nous plait, nous en parlons, mais nous n'êtes pas obligé d'être d'accord avec nous!

Le rapport avec nos lecteurs est très important: vos avis, vos commentaires et votre fidélité nous ont permis d'exister et continue de diriger nos choix pour faire de "Blake" VOTRE magazine masculin.

Aujourd'hui, "Blake" c'est une moyenne de 34 000 lecteurs par numéro online et une moyenne de 26 000 visiteurs uniques par mois sur le blog de Blake.

"Blake" veut innover avec une nouvelle périodicité de deux numéros papier "collector" par an. Le 1er de ces numéros exceptionnels paraîtra à l'occasion du 6eme anniversaire du magazine fin novembre 2013. Un numéro qui reprendra les covers et séries photos les plus populaires depuis le début du magazine, des interviews et des portraits exclusifs de photographes et de créateurs qui nous ont fait confiance, et bien sur de nos "Blake Men", incarnation parfaite de l'homme d'aujourd'hui et reflet de nos lecteurs.

C'est grâce à vous et à votre soutien que ce projet verra le jour. J'espère qu'il saura vous séduire et que vous prendrez part à ce nouveau chapitre de l'histoire de "Blake".

Nous ne faisons pas une quête. Votre participation est un échange de visibilité et un investissement sur le long terme.

Vous êtes une marque, un professionnel? Nos espaces publicitaires sont à vous!

Les 15 premiers investisseurs qui miseront 500€ sur le projet bénéfieront d'une double page dans le magazine ainsi qu'une bannière sur le blog de "Blake".

Les 10 premiers investisseurs qui miseront 350€ pourront prétendre à une page simple dans le magazine et une bannière sur le blog.

Vous pouvez également investir dans les bannières du blog ou nos quart de page pour 100€.

 

Vous êtes un lecteur fidèle ou nouvellement acquis? Votre soutien à concurrence de 75€ se verra récompensé par une séance photo avec nos Blake Men, ainsi qu'un entretien pour la création d'une rubrique spéciale dans ce premier numéro.

Ainsi nous ne vous traitons pas seulement comme un investisseur mais comme un membre à part entière de notre équipe au même titre que nos contributeurs.

Nous avons besoin de 25 000€. Il nous manque aujourd'hui 15 000€ pour boucler le budget permettant la réalisation, l'impression (en France, à Toulouse) et la distribution de ce numéro exceptionnel. Si vous nous faîtes confiance, nous pourrons présenter un numéro en dos carré collé de 120 pages minimum au format 225 x 300 sur papier satiné. 

Ce 1er numéro sera présenté lors de notre désormais traditionnelle "Blake Birthday Party" qui réunie chaque année les lecteurs, les mannequins, les photographes et tous les intervenants qui font que "Blake" existent.

La presse traditionnelle telle que nous l'avons connue est désormais derrière nous. L'avenir est à un média multi directionnel qui réuni le papier et le web en incluant la vidéo. "Blake" l'a compris et vous le montre chaque jour avec le blog de Blake, ses articles, ses séries photos originales, ses vidéos exclusives...L'edition papier semestriel que nous voulons produire sera un plus. Un "collector" que vous aimerez conserver et que vous voudrez collectionner.

"Blake" est indépendant et ne dépend pas d'un groupe. Pas de compromis ni d'articles de complaisance dans nos pages. Si nous parlons d'un produit, c'est qu'il nous a plu et qu'il a été testé par la rédaction.

Tous les membres de la rédaction mettent leurs talents et leur savoir-faire à vous proposer des articles et des rubriques de qualités. 

Nous comprenons que vous ne puissiez pas tous investir sur ce projet mais chaque euros compte car comme le dit le dicton populaire "les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières".

Nous comptons également sur votre soutien logistique en parlant de ce projet sur les réseau sociaux a vos amis, aux amis de vos amis, et en publiant et en partageant le lien de notre campagne.

Plus vous serez actifs et plus nous aurons de chance d'atteindre notre objectif et de vous offrir en novembre prochain le premier numéro collector de "Blake"magazine.


With an experience of 15 years in the world of fashion and fashion photo as a stylist, an art director and a journalist specialized in fashion and jewelry, I created "Blake" magazine in November, 2007 which is the 1st on-line male magazine in France.

This magazine is a lifestyle and fashion magazine addressing readers between 30 and 45. Far from the diktats of the usual magazines which tell you what is to wear or not to wear, "Blake" adopts a freedom of speech and a simple principle: if it pleases us, we talk about it, but you are not obliged to agree with us! The relationship with our readers is very important.

Your notices, your comments and your loyalty allowed us to exist and continues to drive our choices to make "Blake" YOUR male magazine.

Today, "Blake" has an average of 34 000 readers per on-line issue and an average of 26 000 unique visitors on the Blake blog.

"Blake" wants to innovate with a new periodicity of two "collector's" paper issues a year.

The 1st of these exceptional issue will appear to celebrate the 6th anniversary of the magazine, at the end of November, 2013. An issue which will review covers and some of the most popular photos since the birth of the magazine, as will as exclusive interviews and portraits of photographers and creators who relied on us, and of course of our "Blake Men", perfect embodiment of the man of today's man and the image of our readers.

It is thanks to you and to your support that this project will be born. I hope that it will succeed in to seducing you and that you will take part in this new chapter in the Blake's history.

We're not asking for charity. Your participation is an exchange of visibility and an investment on the long term.

You are a brand, a professional? Our advertising spaces belong to you!

The first 15 investors who will invest 500€ in the project will take advantage of a double spread in the magazine as well as a banner on " Blake " blog.

The first 10 investors investing 350€ can expect to a simple page in the magazine and a banner on the blog.

You are a faithful reader or a recent one? Your support up to 75€ will see itself rewarded by a photography session with our Blake Men, as well as an interview for the creation of a special page in this first issue.

So we treat you not only as an investor but as a full member of our team in the same way as our contributors.

We need 25 000€. We miss 15 000€ today to close the budget allowing the realization, the printing (in France) and the distribution of this exceptional number. If you trust us, we can present a number in square back stuck by 120 pages minimum in the size(format) 225 x 300 on calendered paper.

This 1st issue will be presented during our traditional " Blake Birthday Party " who combines every year the readers, the models, the photographers and all the participants who make "Blake" possible.

The "traditionnal" press such as we knew her is now behind us. The future is for a multi-directional media, combining paper and Web, including video. "Blake" understands it and shows it to you every day with the Blake blog, its articles, its original editorial series, its exclusive videos... The biannual paper edition which we want to produce will be another one. A "collector's" issue which you will like keeping and which you will want to collect.

"Blake" is independent and does not depend on a group. No compromise nor sponsored articles in our pages. If we speak about a product, it's because we liked it after it was tested by the editorial staff.

All the members of Blake team put their talents and their know-how to propose you quality articles and columns.

We understand that you cannot all invest on this project but every euro counts because, as the popular saying has it, "little brooks make great rivers".

We also count on your logistic support by speaking about this project to your friends, the friends of your friends, and by publishing and by sharing the link of our campaign on all social network.The more you will be active and the more we shall have the opportunity to reach our goal and to offer you next November " Blake's " first collector's issue.


Hervé Godard - rédacteur en chef

sponsored articles in our pages. If we speak about a product, it's
because we liked it after it was tested by the editorial staff.
All
the members of Blake team put their talents and their know-how to
propose you quality articles and columns. 

We
understand that you cannot all invest on this project but every euro
counts because, as the popular saying has it, "little brooks
make great rivers".


We
also count on your logistic support by speaking about this project to
your friends, the friends of your friends, and by publishing and by
sharing the link of our campaign on all social network.The
more you will be active and the more we shall have the opportunity to
reach our goal and to offer you next November " Blake's "
first collector's issue.

Hervé Godard - rédacteur en chef

story:
Short Summary

After years of contemplation, on a new moon I began this crowd funding campaign for my book "A Sucker Born Every Session: My Misadventures in $cientology" that discusses two decades of off-and-on involvement including crazy fun times, celebrities, most of the well-known people in the cult including the Hubbard family, imprisonment as a staff member, homelessnes as a result of being involved, and finding what I was looking for - a wife from a former life. It's an amazing story. DONATION NOTE: In addition to the products, any size donation can be deducted from the price of any of my writing services or courses at www.skippress.com .

What I Need & What You Get

Here's how I figured out what I need in more detail:

  • I have certain monthly expenses. The book will take me three months to complete. After that, another six week to two months for the script. And when the book is complete even in e-form, I'll be promoting it and traveling, speaking out and helping people.
  • This project is the most important that I've ever done because of what was accomplished. It involves amazing spiritual events that occurred before I got into the cult, what I was told I'd find in it, and how I was convinced for a long time, only to finally achieve what I intended with none of it coming from Scientology.
  • I've sold a lot of scripts, published a lot more books (most of my books sell at least 25,000 copies). When this story is finally written out in full, people will understand a lot more about life, not just about how weird Scientology is - they'll realize how spiritual traps work, though. You will find this story as uplifting as any you've ever read, I promise.

The Impact

I'm going to write this book and screenplay even if no one helps. It's highly risky for me to do so. When they learn about the details of the past life they will scoff. It could highly damage my career. But I can prove it. There's never been a story like this one. You may think there has been, but not really. Also there is what happens to Scientology, which is going down hard:

  • I'll tell you how Hubbard paid a Los Angeles celebrity hypnotist to make up "auditing processes" for him, while he called himself "Source."
  • I'll show you how TONS more people who left $cientology became successful (I certainly did), despite being continually told they would fall apart outside the cult.
  • I have contributed to other books and written articles for free for years, never made a dime from it. My profit margin on this might not be much, but it would be nice to get a little help. Plus, YOU GET A GREAT STORY!
  • Plus, when a movie gets made, I might invite you to a free screening!

Other Ways You Can Help

I'll send a postcard to anyone who gives me their address and helps. I know times are tight. If you just can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please help me get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Indiegogo share tools are very useful - please use them!
  • I don't forget anyone who helps me. I can help you in return, just ask.

That's my pitch. If you give me a boost, you'll love the books after this one, too!

story:
(Watch our original stop motion animation pitch video here.)

 

Hello,

My name is Gili Estlin Hirsch. I’m 26, and I am a queer writer and a poet. I've been writing my whole life and words are the very core of who I am. Growing up, it was difficult to find representations of myself in art, especially literature. So I decided to create a queer story, my story, in poems, to provide a fair and accurate representation of LGBTQ* folk in literary art.

What I hope to accomplish with this campaign is to self-publish this queer story as a collection of poems in my first book, titled ANNA, and in the process help establish a stronger representation of queer and LGBT folk in literature. I believe queer and LGBT folk are severely underrepresented in art, especially in literary art, and I believe it is time to change that.

ANNA contains 50 original poems written by me, Gili Estlin Hirsch, and 25 original illustrations hand-drawn by Alex Ogden. Through these words and images combined, ANNA depicts a complex queer love story between two women, a story that I believe queer and LGBT folk will feel represented by. A story we can ALL relate to.

ANNA is the first book in a series of projects within a larger movement called Apples Etc. Two years ago, I started Apples, Etc., as an art collective that set out to achieve two main goals: one, to create immediate, relevant, live poetry, that can be as relevant and as comforting as any other medium of art; and two, to strive to create, in the short and long run, a better, more accurate, less stereotypical and safer representation in all art—but especially literary art—of LGBTQ* folk, folks like me. To end the terrible slicing of the population in at least one way: to create full, multi-faceted art that will represent everyone, that will give queer and LGBT folk an opportunity to see themselves reflected, that holy right I yearned for so many times as a child and as an adult, that I yearn for still. Basically, I couldn’t find a living, breathing, queer love story. So I decided to write one.

In addition to ANNA, Alex Ogden and I have already completed another project for Apples, Etc. Our first project, "Body of Work," is a unique visual representation of my poetry written on the human body and photographed by Alex.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The book is gathered and edited, but we still need funds to print paperback and e-book copies of ANNA. Our goal is to print paperback copies through our publishing company, Fox & Owl Press, for distribution and review by late fall 2013.

Regardless of whether or not we meet our funding goal, ALL claimed perks will be created and distributed to funders.

What's most important for us is that ANNA is shared and enjoyed by as many people as possible.

This campaign includes original material you won't find elsewhere. Poetry written by Gili Estlin Hirsch and illustrations by Alex Ogden, meticulously collected throughout months, is now available for the first time as a bound collection. The illustrations are tied with the words and produce a new kind of poetry; immediate, relevant, and fresh. ANNA aspires to offer queer and LGBT folk a more accurate representation in art. In essence, it is a queer love story, so this campaign is for better representation of queer and LGBT folk in art.

There are options to acquire items which won't be released to the public after this campaign closes, such as: limited hardcover editions of ANNA; hand-drawn, personalized illustrations; a fine art quality photo book of the first Apples, Etc. project, “Body of Work;” and even a personalized poem written especially for you by Gili Estlin Hirsch.

 

The Core Philosophy

I believe I am here to change the way we see poetry, to help others be touched by poetry and to make a difference in the world. The experience of seeing yourself reflected in any form of media is a transcendental one. There is something holy and magical about reading a book or listening to a song and relating to it from the deepest part of yourself. Members of the LGBTQ* community are constantly having to bridge gender differences in their minds in order to enjoy art, and we constantly scour pages to find our so desperately needed reflection in literature. That is why I created ANNA -- because I believe we as LGBTQ* folk deserve to have better and more profound representation in art. The poems as well as the illustrations in ANNA depict genderqueer, trans, butch, boi and LGBT folk, and create a deep sense of empathy which we hope will resonate with readers from the LGBTQ* community. ANNA is a book meant to give a response to the stark underrepresentation of LGBTQ* folk in art.

This combination of verbal art and visual art is unique and new. Together, the illustrations and the poems create the story as one, making the words, as it were, come alive.

When you support our campaign, you become a member of the Apples, Etc., movement, coming together with artists, poets and lovers of art and words to create a world that is better by the words we leave in it. You are also supporting better representation of LGBTQ* folk in literary art.


The Ocean in Every Drop

We will use whatever funding we receive to print ANNA and promote Apples, Etc. as a movement in order to achieve better representation of LGBTQ* folk in the literary arts. We will reinvest in the movement so that we can reach out to even more people, and work even harder to create multi-faceted poetry that touches each and everyone of us.

You are not just a drop in the ocean.
You are the entire ocean in a drop.

-Rumi

 

A Selection of Poems from ANNA:

MORE OR LESS

Maybe because of the heat,
Everything looks dusty and railed today
Like a healed scratch down the back
Of someone I never knew.
Made with passion,
But embedded in the skin
For good.
You and I were like that
Little archways that never let us rest
And now when I look at your photos,
I think,
What was it
Was it
Just a dream? I can't
Remember a thing you said
Only the taste of your mouth
And the touch of your hands.

The hallway looks suddenly
Like a perfect place for a wake.
We'll put a table there
And there'll be citrus and meat on it
And everyone will talk about
How beautiful and rich and thick it was
And talented and hooked
And no one will mention all the wars
And all the stupid slaps to the face
And apex of our
Conjoined hands.

I told them,
Look,
It was what it was.
And I don't know her anymore
But can you really peel a scratch
Off your skin like that?
Not even with rubbing alcohol,
My love
100% proof won't help you,
Or should I say me
or maybe us
Here

Leaning at bus stops with your goddamn cigarette,
I don't think I've ever
Loved you
More
Or
Less

 

MICAH THE PROPHET

I found you
Walking barefoot
On the hinges of your wisdom
At Massachusetts Ave:
A clerk,
For all intents and purposes,
Of the apocalypse
That is biting
At the heels
Of us all.
You spoke softly,
Ambling hushed,
Head
Bowed,
At one personification of commerce
Where Bates and Raleigh meet.
You explained that you had no children,
And she saw that you had no shoes.
Your creased hand curled
Disturbed her.
She walked away,
Defiant.
Your dry skin at the cement made a cracking sound
Like a bobby pin falling from the head
Of a gauche dark child
At a ballet recital full of white mothers,
Hitting the floor thundering
Once,
Then
N e v e r a g a i n.

 

SCHULTZ

there is a small silken graveyard pressed
between my ribs, and sounding there is
a muted hush of all the breaths of the walking-things we tried to save
he and i
and kept in boxes in his room, contracting
all manners of diseases;
and more loudly all those we could not save
and never knew to try.
you stir there quietly sometimes among them,
flush against my spine
flinching from the lines in the path even in your sleep,
so afraid there is a curse there,
in the space between one tile
and the next.

 

***

To read more of Gili Estlin's poetry, please visit her website.

story:
Wisdom’s Daughters: How Women Can Change the World is grounded in the theories of C. G. Jung, Goddess spirituality and astrology, tools that help us access the Feminine Spirit within us.  The products of our right-brain, “feminine” thinking - stories, dreams, symbols, myths and fairy tales - speak to our hearts, delivering Wisdom’s messages. 

The idea for this book came from a dream I had while training at the C. G. Jung Institute in Zurich, Switzerland in the early 80s.  At the time, I had four young children, a foundering marriage, and a burning need for self-discovery, and to find my life’s purpose.

“I dreamed there was a wounded lion loose in our town and I had to protect my children.  Suddenly (in the way of dreams), I found myself sitting in a buckboard wagon at a three-way crossroads, waiting while people around me went searching for the lion.  Suddenly I saw a waning moon in the sky and a giant tidal wave looming overhead.  I thought ‘This is it’ as the wave came down on me.  Suddenly I looked up into a clear sky with a waxing crescent moon above me and a voice said, “You will be the mother of a savior.” 

Quite a mission statement!  Not only overwhelming, but magical!   And because I was there in Zurich, studying the Unconscious and how dreams connect us to our soul, I had to listen.   The wounded lion was symbolic of my own lack of self-confidence as a woman, as well as my generation’s wounded sense of grown-up responsibility.  Parents are responsible for saving our world for our children’s sake.  The second part of the dream is clearly an indication that it is Feminine Spirit which will guide this change.  The archetypal nature of this dream made me realize it was not just for me but for all women.  (This dream is interpreted in the book.)

This dream set me on the road to discovering not only who I am but also my life’s purpose.  As I worked with the images from this dream, they led me to an image of the Divine Feminine who gives birth to the new age we are fast approaching.  And I learned that the Divine Feminine is returning at this time as Wisdom, so sorely needed in our troubled world. The dream also led me to a tale that explains how women can leave the 'father's house' and find our own unique feminine standpoint.

In living what I learned and following the different threads that were woven through the dream, Wisdom’s Daughters was born.   I believe that this life’s work will not only help other women re-discover their own connection to Feminine Wisdom,  but will enable women to birth a new world guided by wisdom instead of ignorance, love instead of hatred, peace instead of war, and cooperation instead of selfish individualism.   

I have counseled and taught women what I’ve learned, and I can see the good it does them.  Women find freedom once we leave the ‘father’s house ‘ of patriarchal rules.  What we do with our freedom is up to us, but I believe that it leads us to using our Feminine Wisdom - the great gift of our female body and psyche - so that this divine gift can heal our lives and our world.

Through the years as I raised my children, helped women find their freedom, and continued to learn Lady Wisdom’s lessons, I submitted this manuscript for publication.  While many editors praised my writing, I saw there was little interest in works on feminine spirituality.  So now I want to self-publish it, especially in light of what is going on with women’s issues here in America and around the world.  It is time for all women to be free and equal, which also means allowing for our differences.   It is time we honor and use our right-brained, feminine consciousness to balance our masculine rational left-brain.

I have chosen to publish Wisdom’s Daughters through Balboa House, the self-publishing division of a new age publisher, Hay House.  My hope is that if Wisdom’s Daughters does well, Hay House will pick it up.  Balboa Press will market the book, turn it into an e-book, and distribute it to over 25,000 sellers and more.  I have chosen to go with their Master Package at $7,999.00 because it covers everything.

I am trying to raise at least $13,000.00.  After the initial $8,000.00 cost for publishing, I will also owe money to:

  1.  Indigogo’s commission is either 9% or 4% - anywhere from $500 - $1,500 depending on how much I raise.
  2.  I’d like to pay a fee to the wonderful artist, Kerstin Zettmar, whose beautiful mixed media painting, ‘Aphrodite Arising’, will be my book cover.
  3. I have over 25 poems or stories in the book that I need to get permission to use, which could require licensing fees up to $2500.00.
  4. I need money to buy and ship my book to those of you who donate $100.00 +.
  5. If your generous donations go over what I need, I plan to use the money to publish a separate workbook that goes along with Wisdom’s Daughters, with more information and exercises.
  6.  I’d love to pay my good friend, Valerie P, who volunteered to put my video together and spent 6 hours doing it.  Thanks V!

Since I want to express my thanks to those of you who help me get this project off the ground, I have some gifts to give you.  Please take advantage of them if you want to.  Know that I appreciate everyone pitching in to help.  Think of it as a barn-raising!

I believe that women can change the world if we know ourselves and connect to the inner mystery of being female.  Men can also learn how to connect to their inner Wisdom, but having a wise woman in your life can speed up the process.  Wisdom’s Daughters will hopefully be read by women of all ages and even passed down from mother to daughter, until all women are free and comfortable with this blessed gift.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help get the word out:

  • email this information to friends and family
  • share through social media:  Facebook, twitter, Google +, LinkedIn and more
  • don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your support.

I have chosen to publish Wisdom’s Daughters through Balboa House, the self-publishing division of a new age publisher, Hay House.  My hope is that if Wisdom’s Daughters does well, Hay House will pick it up.  Balboa Press will market the book, turn it into an e-book, and distribute it to over 25,000 sellers and more.  I have chosen to go with their Master Package at $7,999.00 because it covers everything.
I am trying to raise at least $13,000.00.  After the initial $8,000.00 cost for publishing, I will also owe money to:

 Indigogo’s commission is either 9% or 4% - anywhere from $500 - $1,500 depending on how much I raise.
 I’d like to pay a fee to the wonderful artist, Kerstin Zettmar, whose beautiful mixed media painting, ‘Aphrodite Arising’, will be my book cover.
I have over 25 poems or stories in the book that I need to get permission to use, which could require licensing fees up to $2500.00.
I need money to buy and ship my book to those of you who donate $100.00 +.
If your generous donations go over what I need, I plan to use the money to publish a separate workbook that goes along with Wisdom’s Daughters, with more information and exercises.
 I’d love to pay my good friend, Valerie P, who volunteered to put my video together and spent 6 hours doing it.  Thanks V!
Since I want to express my thanks to those of you who help me get this project off the ground, I have some gifts to give you.  Please take advantage of them if you want to.  Know that I appreciate everyone pitching in to help.  Think of it as a barn-raising!
I believe that women can change the world if we know ourselves and connect to the inner mystery of being female.  Men can also learn how to connect to their inner Wisdom, but having a wise woman in your life can speed up the process.  Wisdom’s Daughters will hopefully be read by women of all ages and even passed down from mother to daughter, until all women are free and comfortable with this blessed gift.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please help get the word out:

email this information to friends and family
share through social media:  Facebook, twitter, Google +, LinkedIn and more
don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you for your support.

story:
Introducing ADAP- Advertising for Authors and Publishers

ADAP is Advertising for Authors and Publishers – a marketing platform that balances the needs of both readers and authors.ADAP will give self-publishing authors new opportunities to create revenue from their hard work. In short, ADAP helps Authors earn money writing.

Most readers of ebooks enjoy a good free ebook novel and after all; who doesn’t want something free? Unfortunately, that’s a not very sustainable model for publishers and self-publishing authors. Piracy is rampant and odious copy protection and DRM schemes have become the norm among large publishers and ebook retailers. So how do we reconcile the two conflicting needs for monetizing ebooks by publishers and authors versus keeping ebooks low cost or for free for potential fans? (ADAP en Español)

Well, to answer that question let’s go back nine years ago to my own personal journey. At that time I my professional career included several opportunities as an Internet Marketer and software application product manager at two different Fortune 1000 companies.  However; I always had a keen interest in writing fiction and found my inspiration in a chance archaeological discovery on a small Indonesian island in 2003. That year archaeologist Mike Morwood discovered in a cave on Flores Island the remains of a small hominid named Homo floresiensis, an ancestral relative of ours that as an adult stood only three feet and were almost hobbit-like in appearance with comically large feet. More shockingly the remains he found were only 13,000 years old making them contemporaries with modern human beings. Even more surprising, a few scientists even wondered if some of these diminutive people could still be alive deep in the shelter of some primordial forest!

Having formally trained as a biologist I began entertaining the idea about how their re-discovery could have the makings of a grand science fiction adventure story. As I wrote, the novel evolved and grew from a simple rousing adventure story to a much deeper examination of the human condition. The novel began with your prototypical protagonist named Richard Staller, an American scientist with a predisposition towards alcoholism and womanizing. There was to be the obligatory love interest in Richard’s associate, the attractive but somewhat bitter Sarah. However; as the novel evolved it was Sarah that became the focus of the hero’s journey; partly because of her complex and sometimes brittle personality but more importantly because of her extraordinary powers of empathy for all sentient creatures. To paraphrase John Irving, I had become obsessed and I was staying obsessed with my writing. Through time, the novel evolved from a simple adventure novel to a complex novel with a unique heroine.

 Authors Face Money Challenges

Now to be honest with you writing my first novel was a bit bumpy in the beginning but as I resolved the issues of writing my first novel that had now morphed into a full trilogy, I faced the biggest challenge confronting all authors: the book publishing industry. It was always a tough industry to compete in, moreover; technical convergence wasn’t making it any easier to navigate for new authors. Frankly, the statistics for most writers are fairly grim considering there are far more lottery winners than there are successful authors. And even self-publishing authors need money for the marketing and editing of their novels. Yet, the only thing scarier than facing a blank page or no money for an author is the eminent danger of facing total obscurity and having no readers altogether.

My Internet marketing background made me realize that book promotion was all about collecting eyeballs; reader’s eyeballs that is. Get enough eyeballs and the money will come; it was a basic monetizing concept that drove much of the Internet’s growth. Furthermore; free works and in fact; my first free Flores Girl novel has been downloaded a staggering 350,000 times. That's a significant audience and that's very appealing to potential advertisers; after all, most book readers are better educated and more likely to have more disposable incomes than your typical television or radio audience member.

I wanted to address this monetizing challenge for all authors and using my contacts within the industry I have developed a new ebook marketing program called ADAP, Advertising for Authors and Publishers. This new advertising platform allows authors and independent publishers an opportunity to create new revenue streams in a manner that is unobtrusive to the reader. When I say publishers I am referring to the independent publishers who work with self-publishing authors to give them their start in the business.

ADAP creates a win-win for authors and readers by placing a series of tasteful interstitials that are relevant to the reader strategically throughout the novel, as for example at the end of a chapter. The experience is very much in line with what is seen with traditional periodic publishing and actually harkens back to the early days of novel serialization within magazines. If something catches your interest you can choose to read the ad copy and perhaps select the hyperlink; if not, you can simply move on to the next page in the novel and continue with your reading uninterrupted. In short, ADAP allows authors and small independent publishers the opportunity to monetize their efforts in a manner that is unobtrusive and in harmony with the ebook reader.

Publishers Colluding at the Expense of Readers

I know many of you are reading this campaign and are saying, “Oh no, I don’t want ads in my ebooks!” But like it or not ebook advertising is coming with Amazon already adding advertisements to their latest ebook readers and with Microsoft filing an ebook advertisement patent and investing over $300 million with Barnes and Noble. Worse; you know none of this advertising money is going to go to the authors and forget about the money benefiting the reader! In fact, the Justice Department has sued some of the largest book publishers in the industry for ebook price fixing. Now wouldn’t it be great if authors could discount or give away their ebooks altogether to readers with this new advertising revenue from the ADAP program?

The goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to raise funds to set the specifications and for developing the beta version of the ADAP Cloud Technology Server platform necessary to implement the ADAP program. This infrastructure will handle the reader preferences and the downloading of the customized ebooks.

Moving forward; the ADAP program will bring leading members in the self-publishing and advertising world together in a joint effort towards making ADAP a viable new funding option for all authors. As ADAP grows additional authors and publishers will be added to the roster so that they too can share in the revenue benefits of the program.

Ebook Readers How You Can Help!

Well, to start you can participate in this Indiegogo campaign and to encourage you there are a number of different perk incentives to motivate you! There are the traditional offerings such as signed copies of the sequel by the author. Additionally, there is a new album of original music for Flores Girl that was produced and recorded by Georgia Harrigan that is now available.

However; if you own a business or are marketing your own book we encourage you to take advantage of the special ADAP advertising incentive. The ADAP incentive allows you to place interstitials within the Sacred and the Profane with your own personalized advertisement. We estimate that the ads have a value of $50 cost per thousand impressions in line with traditional print media, though the value could vary based on market conditions. If you don’t have an ad you can also do a tasteful personal shout-out using the existing templates we will offer shortly after the completion of the Indiegogo campaign. In the very near future additional authors and novels will also be added to the ADAP program as well. Monies raised beyond the initial goal will be used towards the actual application development and to hosting the cloud technology. More details about this important ADAP program and incentives are available in a separate ADAP video.

Even if you can’t contribute you can help by becoming a Flores Girl Fan by liking Flores Girl and downloading a free copy of the first ebook novel at www.facebook.com/FloresGirlNovel.

Authors How You Can Help Yourself!

As an author you can; of course, contribute to this campaign and advertise your own ebook novel within ADAP. Additionally; you can also join the ADAP program and start earning money for yourself.  If you are an author feel free to contact myself at ebertel@bookim.org or call me at 631-751-5116 to enlist your own ebook novel in the ADAP program.

Why Join Me?

Why join me in this ambitious adventure? As an author I understand the challenges of the book industry plus I have years of software and project development experience so I understand the challenges of new software application development. To meet this challenge I have put together key advertising partners along with a development team to move forward with this important project. More importantly; as an author I feel passionately about this project and I want, with your help, to change the direction of book publishing industry for the better for both authors and their readers. I want to thank you again for your consideration and please don’t forget to download your free copy of “Flores Girl: The Children God Forgot” at FloresGirl.com.

Learn More about ADAP at Youtube!

 http://youtu.be/ZXi09cVszcY
