story:
Hi,
 
My name is Christopher and I used to belong to the Church of Scientology. I am from England and became a permanent resident of Canada in 1999.
 
I first became involved in the Church in January 1998 and had some impressive results in dealing with a situation that had been hanging around me for about 20 years. When I experienced the relief of being helped in this area I went to Toronto, Canada, to do 5 weeks of courses and auditing sessions. I went to Toronto because the person who had helped me over the months between 1997 and 1998 lived there.
 
I eventually moved to Canada and married the woman who got me into Scientology in November 1998. Soon after I began to find out that there was something not quite right about the Church of Scientology.
 
The above video explains some of what happened to me and the campaign is all to do with raising awareness about this very corrupt and fraudulent Church, which is actually a business and has no religious standing in Canada, by placing full page display ads in three of the largest newspapers in Canada.
 
The number of $$$s I need is about $211,000 to place these display ads in these three papers on a Saturday. I am placing them in the Saturday edition because this day is when the papers are the most read by everyone.
 
Here is the breakdown of the costs:
 
Saturday editions b/w full page display ads:
 
Globe and Mail (National paper) - $89,763 inc hst
Toronto Star (National Edition) - $113,780.67 inc hst (in a prominent position)
Toronto Sun (Toronto) - $7,232 inc hst
 
This campaign is very important me and especially those who are thinking of going into the Church because of the fact that the Church defrauds people of the services that they get.
 
When people go and get services in the Church 99.99% of people think they are getting courses and auditing sessions with technology that has been created by L Ron Hubbard directly. This is actually not the case. If you look at any of the books which the basic courses are based on, the copyright page says "Based on the works of L Ron Hubbard". This is how the Chuch gets away with providing services which do more harm than good, though at the basic level you do get some wins due to the fact that the basic courses are pretty much as L Ron Hubbard intended them to be and so are very effective. When people experience this effectiveness they want more naturally. This is where the con is - the hook is the effectiveness of these courses at the bottom but the further you go in buying services the more changed the services are from the originals. So much so, that one ends up spending thousands of $$s before one knows it without there being as much gain in one's well-being as at the lower levels, and in some cases being worse off than before one got involved with this organization.
 
There are many of you who would like to stirke back at the Church but are afraid to do so. Well here is your opportunity to strike back Anonymously!

This is not your run of the mill campaign so there are very little in perks that you will receive. Mostly just thank yous. But if you ACTUALLY want your full name to appear on a page somewhere (NOT advisable!) then I can do that for you. I will also run a sort of competition to see which country will contribute the most (because this Church is in many countries around the world) if you would like.

I am not sure how many people will respond to this campaign so am asking that you send it far and wide even if you can't contribute any funds just by passing it on to your friends via email will do wonders for the betterment of the Planet.


By all means don't forget to use the Share tools provided by Indiegogo itself.

Thanking you ALL in advance!


All the best

Christopher

story:
I am womb-man; natural things I'm a fan

 of

plus, there is another love:

literature in various genres.

Reading peace invoking mantras, once-though- I sauntered

in a lane of those who had none to gain.

Could you believe it? Reading caused me pains.

I struggled double…toiled….sputtered, stuttered, muttered, foiled

Placed in remedial class, reading aloud made others laugh.

teachers said, “You’re not well read, spread your efforts to art instead.”

Daily I faced the dread, read until my eyes bled, nearly

ALL THANKS TO FREE BOOKS FROM THE LIBRARY.

defeat was not admitted, to the Library….I committed

myself and gain a world of wealth.

nowadays, I often books on health, keeps the stress level at zilch


ANYONE can learn as much as much as the sages all they need is free book pages.


We know you love your tablet but books don't need electric magic.

                     During a blackout and your Mac’s out

Don't get upset ! 

         A good book is the best bet. 

If you have nil, barter it from the bookmobile.

BOOKS FOR THE PEOPLE, not for posture        

sustainable life traits on which to foster

Hey! You are what you ate.

Be what you eat, wheat and gluten free, wild herbs and Reishi tea.

You are what you be....cleanse your energy, 

     shea butter in a bin, you are what you put on your skin.

The message: share it with your kin.

I'll drive it ‘cross the country , updating genres monthly. 

                 No money, that is fine

come and donate energy and time.

Books for the people, tea, and healing,               

 yoga, drumming keep the feeling.

"The body has the ability to maintain wellness

The planet has the medicine to alleviate illness"

story:
The Pitch...

In the Midlands of England stands the Wentworth Academy for Young Ladies of Distinction, a respected establishment for the schooling of wealthy young women. Yet it has another, secret side. Separate from the main school is the Bloodgood House – a place where girls with “special” requirements are housed. Now, as spring deepens into summer in 1875, there are five girls in residence:

Diana Silverthorn – Bookish, shy Diana has an addiction to penny dreadful tales of airship pirates and swashbuckling adventure – especially the stories of the fearsome Captain Hawk — and spends her time writing torrid pirate adventures she never lets anyone see. It is an unusual pursuit for a young woman, yet not as unusual as the heavy bracelets she must wear to control her magnetic affliction, which can cause every metallic object in a room to be attracted to her.

Rebecca Baltimore – An American girl of a new-money family, Rebecca has been sent to the Academy to try and educate her in spite of her forceful and wayward nature. Rebecca is athletic, adventurous, and very, very strong — so strong she is given a special drink every day at bedtime to make her weak and docile.

Vittra Valdenheld – A quick, intelligent girl with an inquisitive mind and a fierce sense of loyalty, Vittra is very fond of animals of all kinds – especially dangerous ones. She is not allowed any meat, and is given an injection whenever she becomes agitated.

Echo Killwinter – A pale, distracted girl who sings, stays up late, and covets fancy clothes, Echo might seem the least odd of the group. And yet she cannot abide the sunlight, and is allowed to eat only a specially-formulated gruel.

Ayesha a’ Jharra – The new girl, Ayesha is of an unknown lineage, but has a wealthy uncle for a benefactor. This would be to her advantage, except that she suffers from a belief that she will burst into flames if she loses control of herself, and so she is often sedated, and kept away from things that might burn.

Chafing under the rule of their headmistress, Miss Hench, they long for the chance to get away on holiday, like the other girls. They get their chance one night when airship pirates raid the school, and rather than be kidnapped by the menacing Captain Blackstone, the girls manage to steal a ship themselves and fly away.

With their own ship, Rebecca tells them they could escape Wentworth forever and become pirates themselves. But while Wentworth might have prepared them to be young ladies of distinction, it has not taught them to be pirates. They need a teacher, and Diana knows that the famous Captain Hawk has just been captured in London. If they could only break him out of jail, he could teach them everything they might need to know...

So What Makes This Story So Great?

  • A rollicking steampunk Airship Adventure with five female leads!
  • Five girls on the run, becoming friends – and more than friends – as they discover who they are and what they can do with their powers!
  • Action! This is a story about airship pirates, after all. I guarantee swordfights, gunfights, super-powers, and all manner of diversions.

  • Sex! Sex of all kinds! I have not written any porn for almost a year and I am psyched to get back at it.

  • I have been excited about this story ever since I thought it up. I love sky pirates, and whenever I see English Boarding School drama I always wish some pirates would come and shake things up. Now they will!

What I Need & What You Get

  • Funds go to pay my rent, bills, etc.  This is it, this is my livelihood.  I don't have a day job, so this is what I do.
  • All perks are fulfilled by me, by hand.  You will get to see the book written almost in real time, as it posts on www.adventurotica.com chapter by chapter.  Once it is done, the ebook will follow almost immediately, and then the print book.
  • Even if I don't reach goal, everyone gets what they paid for, no matter what.

The Impact

Here's where I'm supposed to talk about how this project is important to the world.  Which probably seems silly, only I think this project - and others like it - are very important.  This is the cutting edge of the publishing business, and here I am trying to prove by example that a writer can make a living at what they want to do.  And I don't mean be one of the one-in-a-million longshots we all read about.  I mean being able to be good at what I do and with that carve out a career that can support my modest life.

  • Here I am dismantling the gatekeepers and the idea of the arts as a lottery.
  • I have run 16 campaigns to success before this one.
  • You help keep me alive, and I entertain you.  That's what I do here.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, the most important thing you can do is share.  The hardest thing about these campaigns is making my voice heard above the tumult of the internet and standing out.  Signal boost!  Reblogs, Facebook posts, Tweets - everything helps!

story:
Project Overview

My Name is Jeremy Johnson and I am the author of the upcoming book, Unbroken- "Discovering Wholeness through the Shattered Pieces of Life".  This book will be my first book and I am very excited that you have the chance to partner with me to give people the message of hope. 


The reason I wrote this book was to share my story with transparency. I wanted to share some of my struggles and to tell you others that if they still have a pulse, there is certain hope for them. 

This book is for the broken people in the world, which includes all of us. Whether you have been broken by tragedy, divorce, loss, bad relationships or maybe even disappointment, this book is for you. 

What unfolds in the pages of this book is a testimony that God can heal the most broken pieces of your life. The things that have been burned down in the chapters of your soul, can be resurrected, just as Jesus himself rolled the stone away and conquered the tomb.  God can take what was broken and make it UNBROKEN.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising the proper funding for this message to be heard by the masses.  $3000.00 is the total amount we are raising.  In comparison to other projects of this kind, this amount is extremely affordable and attainable.  This is how we will use this funding.  

  • Professional copy and content editing which will provide the book with the excellence that it needs.  
  • Professional Book cover design- This will allow the book to be appealing to the target audience of this project.  
  • Outreach and Marketing- We are passionate about the message of this book and we want to make sure as many people hear the message as possible.  
  • Other Creative Resources- We will be creating other helpful resources such as small group discussion content and video elements that coincide with the book.  This is just another way to enhance the message.  

The Impact

This is an opportunity for you to be a part of the journey with me as we complete this book, Unbroken!  I am using Indiegogo as the platform for you to partner with me. Please consider praying for this project and investing in the message of Unbroken.  Together we can have a tremendous impact on the Kingdom of God.  Throughout this process, we will communicate to you the many lives restored to Christ.  

I firmly believe that God can gently use this book to wake people up from a slumber in life.  Marriages can be saved, lives can be restored from a spiritually dry season, accountability can be put into place, healing can take place in lives that experienced loss and above else, the Hope of Christ can be realized in a person's life.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • First and foremost you can pray for this project and this campaign.  We want God to get the glory for this book. 
  • Once the book is out you can help us by getting the word out on social media and by word of mouth. 
  • You will also be able to purchase a book when they are released through amazon.com.
  • You and your church can invite Jeremy to speak.  email us at j2ministries@gmail.com for more details about the "Unbroken Experience", an evangelistic message of hope that will change lives.  Tour dates begin in August!

About the Author

Jeremy Johnson’s passion became evident at the early age of two when he stood behind a ceramic owl statue and pretended to preach in his relatives’ living room. At nine, he accepted Christ as his personal Savior and by 17 sought out opportunities to lead worship and speak in various services throughout the southeast, where he was raised. To this day, his creativity encourages people who are far from the truth to learn about and know God‘s grace is sufficient for them. He develops leaders by inspiring them to pursue their callings and has a deep desire to see and be involved with successful church planting.

His personal ministry started in 2000 when he served as pastor of students and college ministries – seeing a growth in weekly attendance from 12 to 75 students. In 2001, he established his own evangelical organization, J2 Ministries travelling throughout the country impacting thousands for Christ. 2007 was the year God directed Jeremy Johnson to invest in community and build relationships starting as an Associate Pastor at the local church level and then as Founder and Lead Pastor for a new church plant in Orlando, Florida. Similar to the preaching he did at two, Element church’s humble beginnings were in a living room, but grew from six dedicated believers to a congregation of 140 regular worshipers in the span of a year.

Father of two beautiful children, Jeremy’s world was turned upside down when his wife of 13 years left him in late 2012 and four months later filed for divorce. Though there was no moral failure involved, Jeremy was confronted with the reality of his focus and readily harnessed the blame for his failed marriage. Through God’s miraculous grace and mercy the months following became a time of incredible spiritual growth. Jeremy garnered the support of a new community including two counselors proficient in the process of healing pastors, a team of 80+ prayer warriors and six men who are his personal board of Directors that have kept him accountable and encouraged. 

Jeremy wrote his first book, which is based on his journey of restoration. His passion to be the leader God has created him to be continues through the healing of scars and the connecting with those who are far from God on a deep level. The scripture that has been his anchor of hope is Galatians 6:9. Let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due time the harvest will come – if we refuse to give up.

story:
Our families are struggling.

Study after study tells us that we are losing our kids to the culture. Families are falling apart. Marriages are struggling. We've forgotten that we were made in the image of God. Our kids don't know God's Word. Let's admit it: most Christian parents don't know God's Word, either.

At Firmly Planted, we're on a mission to change that. We're on a mission to help families become "firmly planted" in the rich soil of God's Word.

We need a change.

We believe that studying God's Word together can enrich and strengthen families in every way. The Bible is like a roadmap for life. In it, we find answers to the questions that kids and their parents are asking such as

  • Why am I here?
  • Is there a God?
  • How can we know that God's promises are true?
  • How can we know that we are loved by God?
  • Does life matter to God?

We have created a one-of-a-kind Bible study series that can be used by entire families and kids of all ages, from "diapers to diploma!" 

We've also taken the time to help kids who are already familiar with the Bible learn "how" and "why" of studying it for themselves. It's a little bit of "upper class" study for those who need it, and some beginning and intermediate for others.

(The above picture is a page from Firmly Planted that features our character, "THEOlogy." Theo helps guide students through some of the deeper studies of the Bible, including Bibliology, Christology and Theology.  He especially likes that last one.)

The idea is that in just a few minutes each day, families can begin to really know and understand the message of hope that's found in the Bible and can defend their faith in the culture.

We've written the books. 

Will you help us print them?

  • Each book set costs just under $32,000 (with taxes and fees) to print 5000 copies. This campaign is for book 3, which covers the first part of the Gospels.
  • You can help us send a message that our hope is found in being "Firmly Planted"  in the Word of God by helping us get these books to press.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will print a partial number of books.

The books you see below are the two volumes we have already printed. Each volume includes a workbook with activities for all ages, and a study guide.

               

                


Studying the Bible changes people. 

Knowing God's Word gives people hope.

Since 2000, Jay and Heidi St. John have been encouraging families through their ministry of starting homeschool cooperatives. Now, they have branched out to reach an even broader sphere of influence, believing that the Gospel message is vital to this generation of parents and their children

Your donation will help us get the message of hope in Jesus to a new generation of families. Most of these families go to church—but they do not know God or His word. We want to change that by making the Bible easier and more exciting to study as a family. 

  • Your financial support will really help us reach a new generation of families with the truth of the Bible and encourage our staff to keep writing books 4-8! (Yes, there are four more books in the works if we can get these to press.) 
  • Each donation helps us print books.
  • We have already printed books 1 and 2, but our capital has run out. We need your help to get the rest of the series in circulation..

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, we can still use your help!

  • Help us get the word out to pastors and home study groups. 
  • Share the Firmly Planted website with your friends
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Help us get our message out and raise the necessary funds to publish and distribute Firmly Planted materials around the world.

Thank you for helping us strengthen families through teaching them the Word of God!

story:
Hi there! I'm Sean Widup, a senior graphic designer based out of Los Angeles, California. Since I was 14 years old, my life has been consumed with art & design. I got a used beat up PC and a copy of Photoshop 6.0, and I was lost in my new obsession. I'd stay up all night learning from online tutorials and teaching myself from the ground up. Later on in high school I began working with friends and small businesses in my community producing designs in my spare time. I landed a small gig working for a local band designing t-shirts for an upcoming tour they were planning and instantly fell in love with my new job.

When I was 18 years old I went to a local concert and, for the first time in my life, I was able to point out shirts I had designed and say "I made that!" 10 years later, I've worked with over 300+ bands/record labels/clothing brands, opened my own online store, and worked for countless local and main stage acts. Through my hands on experiences, I've acquired the necessary knowledge and tools to help mold young graphic designers into experienced veterans with a solid work portfolio.

After 13+ years, I'm still obsessed, still eager to learn something that I didn't know yesterday. I believe in the knowledge I've acquired- if transferred onto paper, it would serve as a go-to guide for young designers who want to go venture out on their own and freelance for a living. I Made That will cover it all. From creating original concepts to marketing your portfolio to the masses, this book will be an all-inclusive how-to guide complete with tutorials, tips, tricks, do's, don'ts and everything else in between.

Some of the subjects that will be featured in I Made That include...

  • Harnessing your style
  • Managing your portfolio
  • Developing a system
  • Workflow
  • Managing clients
  • Critical thinking
  • Contracts
  • Designing for print
  • Brand identity
  • Knowing your ability
  • Product research
  • Targeting your audience
  • Creating a web presence
  • Marketing to potential clients
  • Screen printing
  • Social networking
  • Portfolio examples
  • Interviews with designers





Plain and simple, I can't do it alone! I've spent over 10 dedicated years accumulating knowledge and building experience, but unfortunately haven't found myself in a position to save towards this project. It's scary, terrifying actually. I've talked about it for several years and never got it off the ground.

Finally, I'm at a point in my career where I can say with confidence that I'm ready to take on this task and make my dream a reality! The funds raised on Indiegogo will allow me to complete, print and publish I Made That  into a full color/hardcover 8x10 book that can be enjoyed by everyone. With your help I can accomplish this!





Throughout my career, I've networked with some of the brightest and most versatile designers in the industry. Over the next six months, I'll conduct interviews with them as well as compile their portfolio pieces, covering graphic art designs across our worldwide music community. In this process, I hope to reflect multiple perspectives on how they approach a project, maintain a steady client base, and market themselves to the rest of the world.




I estimate it will take me 6 months to complete I Made That with an expected shipping date of January 6, 2015.





    I know not everyone can donate, but you can help me in other ways! Please repost and share with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and whatever else you can. Together we can make this project a reality, inspiring new artists to pursue their dreams and showcase the incredible opportunities that are available to them.


    Preorder the book on Defiant Youth Merch for $50

story:
PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS YOUR ONLY CHANCE TO BUY AN ADVANCE COPY PRIOR TO THE OFFICIAL LAUNCH IN OCT/NOV 2014
I’m Andrea Drew and I’m Australian.  What you may not know is that I’m an Australian Author and have been self-publishing titles on amazon since 2011.  My first non fiction title “Pro Resumes Made Easy” has been downloaded and/or purchased more than 40,000 times.  I followed this up with another title “Government Job Apps Made Easy”

Around a year ago I started thinking about writing fiction.  

Last year I wrote a piece for my son, Uprising, part of a series we called Camo Hunters.  I uploaded it to amazon and sold a couple of them but didn’t really put the time into promoting this that I had with my non fiction titles.  Why?  Well in retrospect now I’m glad I didn’t – the writing makes me cringe.

At the time of course I thought the writing was great.  I continued and wrote a couple of short stories, and a memoir which I may also publish in the future.  Then in February this year, I met up with a friend and we formed our own writers group, we met each week.  One week we got talking about story ideas, and I started talking about my fascination with psychic powers and the ability to talk to others without speaking.  From there, an idea came to me, what would a person do if they interrupted a murder, were attacked and left for dead. How would they report what they knew?  Would anyone believe them?

From here I started writing what I thought was a short story.  64,000 words later I had my first thriller suspense novel, Gyspy Hunted.  It is currently in the editing phase.  Here is the book trailer: 


EXCERPT
Below is an excerpt from Gypsy Hunted;

As I looked down the quiet residential street, lit softly by street lamps, I heard the rustling of wind in the trees and rattling of a rubbish bin in the dark alley to my left. It wasn’t bin night, so it must be cats fighting or someone getting rid of some junk.

Wishing I’d remembered my glasses, I squinted as a commotion rose from further down the black laneway. There was a large van parked at the end and I could make out a figure loading something into it.

In that instant, I felt a wave of energy, something steely hard and terrifying. I could almost see it, like a sheet of granite leading from the van directly to me. I’d learned the hard way not to deny my instinct, and so I took a quick detour into the alley. This wasn’t the first time I’d acted  in a mad rush of spontaneity There was always the pepper spray in my bag if things got ugly. Besides, as my Dad would say, no one would ever mug a woman like me; they’d wait for someone else who was a lot less trouble. I was never sure whether to take that as a compliment or an insult, but at that moment, I didn’t give a toss.

As I cautiously approached I became aware of the stillness. Not a soul in sight.. As I stood staring at the bin, wondering what to do next, it burst open with a crash.

 I jumped and whimpered as a black shape streaked across the alleyway. A loud wail followed the cat as it sped off into the night.  I waited for my heart to stop pounding in my ears, for my body to stop trembling.  And then, committed now, I continued walking to the end of the isolated laneway and the van waiting there.

I blew out a long breath, my legs wobbly on the cobblestones.  Thank god it was just a cat. 

As I walked further along the lane, I saw that what had earlier looked like a couple of rubbish bags lying beside the open van door, was actually a young woman lying on the ground. Long, golden-colored hair fell across her face, her wrists were tied, and through her mouth, gagged with duct tape, she was struggling to make some semblance of noise. Her long legs kicked the air like hell. Her eyes were saucers, reflecting with the terror rolling off her in huge swells.  

Something shifted in the blackness. As I tried to process what it was, it suddenly sprang from behind the van to offer me an up-close view. He stood so near that his stinking, loud breath assaulted my senses. He towered over me in a dark hoodie his chest thrust forward, elbows out. In the faint light of the streetlight before the alley, I could make out sandy hair. Other than that, his face was completely hidden by the hood. His body carried a strange, unidentifiable smell, acrid and bitter.

I was supposed to be terrified, but instead I felt shut off from reality, numb. I needed to grab the can of pepper spray from my bag but I was paralyzed, rooted to the spot. 

“Fuck off, bitch...” he spat as I grabbed for my bag.

He seized the girl, shoving her into the back of the van roughly. I threw myself forward to stop him, but he shoved me back with more force than I’d anticipated. I rocked back on my heels, hands flailing wildly, and I just managed to stay upright as he slammed the van door closed. I heard the girl pounding her feet on the inside of the van, pounding loudly.

My pulse was pumping madly, and the adrenaline had kicked in. I ground my teeth and jumped at the sound of the engine starting. I ran for the front driver’s window, which of course he had locked, and started bashing it with my fists, screeching. 

“Let her go! Let her go, you bastard!” I spoke through flattened lips, past my neck in which a vein was pulsing and engorged.

I stood in front of the vehicle, legs planted wide part and gazed down at the registration plates. If I could get his registration details, I could report him to the police who would track him down. I reached into my handbag for my mobile phone, realizing I should have done this earlier and made a damn call to the cops. 

He revved the crap out of the van, the engine growling so loud I felt it through my toes. But I stood my ground, even with nails biting into my palms, pulse speeding, and heartbeat pounding.  I’d get his details through to the police if it was the last thing I did.

I looked up to face him and the van launched at me. I dialed the emergency services number holding the phone to my ear with fingers so rigid they hurt. The van came at me and in a split second I I was hit, my body bouncing off the van.  My head taking the brunt of the blow as I struck the brick wall, landing on the ground like a rag doll unloved and discarded.  Strangely, nothing hurt, at least at this moment. I was sure that it should.  

Colors flashed: green, hot pink, and yellow.  Tires squealed, and I thought I heard frantic footsteps approaching.

Then it was lights out.

Why a crowd funding project?

A couple of weeks ago I decided to self publish primarily to retain control over my work and to eliminate the wait associated with traditional publishing of between one and two years prior to publication. I’ve received excellent feedback on it so far but there are quite a few costs involved.  Which is why I am asking for your help.

You can either:

a)  Make a donation of an amount of your choice

b)  Buy an advance copy of the book

c)  Give a bit more

Where Will the Money Go?

All funds will cover the following:

Cover design

Professional Editing 

Typesetting

Printing 

Launch

Publicity/Advertising

If you can't contribute I understand but would really appreciate you sharing this with your contacts in social media.

Thank you for reading my story at this exciting time!

story:
Paul Mullin, a nationally recognized playwright and poet, contributor to The Stranger, featured on NPR and in the New York Times, would love your help to publish his first memoir.


The Starting Gate

              Working,

                                                  Drinking,

                                                                                      Family,

                                                                                             Zen.

About Paul

Hi, I'm Paul Mullin. I'm a playwright, screenwriter, poet and teacher who was recognized by Seattle's The Stranger as a recipient of their annual Genius Award and, most recently, by the Frye Art Museum as part of their spotlight on Seattle artists. I'm a lucky guy. My plays have flourished in productions across the U.S., exploring subjects ranging from personal nuclear catastrophe to the uncelebrated underbelly of American History. My blog Just Wrought has all my work, if you'd like to learn more.

Today, I'm reaching out to the world in order to to help fund publication of my latest work, a memoir, The Starting Gate.


What's The Starting Gate About?

The Starting Gate is a smooth cocktail consisting of thirteen interconnected chapters, tracking my life from my first job as a stock boy at a Maryland country bar (called the Starting Gate) where my boss once shot a man dead for trying to rob the local drug store, to my days as the only white kid on an all-black labor crew at the National Archives. You'll learn what it's like to spend days cleaning the high-rise glass windows of Manhattan and the rules you need to know to enjoy a cocktail with the greatest living bartender, Murray Stenson.


The Plan

I'll publish The Starting Gate across three channels:
•  Hardcover
•  Electronic 
•  Audio
And, I’m almost there... I just need your help in the form of a contribution.
With it we can make The Starting Gate a success.

Use of Funds

•  copy editor
•  book designer
•  printing cost (500 high quality hard bound)
•  recording, editing and mastering the audio version
•  setting up an electronic version for easy download
•  setting up an easily ordered, on-demand paperback edition of the book
   (available by the end of 2016)



Use of Excess Funds

•  Marketing the book to a wider audience
•  A second printing of the hardcover edition
•  Underwriting a modest book tour to key cities throughout the country
to where my plays have been staged and I think I can stir up a market
for the book.

In exchange for your support, I promise I won’t leave you empty handed. In addition to my eternal gratitude, and depending on your level of support, you will receive one or more of many perks, such as:

• The first-edition hardback edition of the book.
• The audio version of the book, read by yours truly.
• An electronic copy of the book easily downloadable to your Kindle
  or other e-reader
• A visit to a venue of your choosing for a public reading
  of any chapter by the author, a.k.a. yours truly

So won’t you please consider supporting getting The Starting Gate started?

THANKS!

Paul Mullin


PS Here are what some amazing authors
are saying about The Starting Gate:

"Do you want to know how to behave in a bar? Do you want to know how to live? Maybe they're not so different. Paul Mullin finds a real honor and wisdom in the messy practice of a life, and he makes me wish I too had learned how to work as a kid at a little country tavern in Maryland called the Starting Gate—even on Taco Night. How am I suddenly nostalgic for a life that wasn't even my own?"

 – Tom Nissley, Jeopardy Champion and author
     of A Reader’s Book of Days


“Paul Mullin enters sacred territory in American Letters, the Temple of the Tavern wherein both grace and alcohol are dispensed. Like its successful predecessors, FALLING THROUGH THE EARTH, THE LIARS CLUB, and THE TENDER BAR. Mullin’s entertaining memoir is an attempt to reconcile the irreconcilable, to explain the mystery of the now with a Drunkard’s Walk through his past of hard manual labor, art, and Zen Buddhism. It’s funny and moving, and Mullin’s chapter on how to properly appreciate a bar should be required reading for all those coming of age.” 

– Robert Schenkkan, Tony Award-winning author of All the Way


"Playwright Paul Mullin deploys his gift for vivid storytelling in this lively memoir of work, play and apprentice barkeeping." 

– Richard Rhodes, Pulitzer Prize-Winning Author
    of The Making of the Atomic Bomb

story:
The Plan

After thirty years raising three children and teaching children ages three through thirty, I am taking a year-long sabbatical (a sort of gap year) to write my first novel.

I have been writing poetry, short fiction, and nonfiction for many years, but I have wanted for a long time to write a book to celebrate the beauty of life on planet Earth and its role in shaping the human experience.

This novel, which has a science fiction premise but a very realistic plot, will take us across the landscape of four regions of the American West, through four seasons, and through natural and human history, as it explores our relationship with the planet that gave us life but is struggling to sustain us now.

Preparation

I am building a camper-trailer and packing my camera, my laptop, and loading the rest of my things in the back of my 2002 Subaru to be ready to head west July 1.

A Preview

Get a sneak peak at the novel. Read excerpts from the first two chapters, including the premise of the story, here.

The Process

Along the journey, I will post chapters from the novel as I write them (about two each month) beginning July 1, 2016. Those who join me on this journey are invited to share their reactions and suggestions as the story unfolds. I am interested in meeting people and exploring places you recommend along the way. The novel may well be shaped by these encounters, and we can all learn from the experience.

The Product

The first draft of the complete novel will be completed by July 1, 2017, at which time I will begin the revision process, taking into consideration the input I have received from you along the way. We will regroup and set new goals at that time.

The Purpose

This novel asks and seeks to answer the question: Given what we have sown, what can we expect to reap?  But the goal of this journey and novel is not just to identify the issues caused by the way we have abused our planet, but also to discover solutions and alternatives that people or cultures can offer, either as traditions or as innovations. By visiting and speaking with these folks along the way, I hope we can learn about approaches to living on earth that do not prioritize immediate human gratification, but rather see the world as a web of interconnected manifestations of a common life force with equal and inherent value, and thus, possibly, provide hope.

A note on Eulogy

"Eulogy" means to speak good words. Its purpose is praise or commendation of a person or thing we love and value. Though we usually associate eulogy with death and funerals, it is not strictly limited to that purpose. It is not necessarily elegy . . .

story:
Meet the Poetry Witch!


The Poetry Witch is a friendly mischievous magical person who takes words and weaves them into fun poetry adventures for children and the young at heart.

Her words come from best selling poet Michele Brenton and the beautiful illustrations are the creations of Norwegian artist Kari-Anne Fehn.

This project is a full colour picture poetry book designed to be read to children between the ages of 5 and 10 and as a read alone for older readers and is intended to be released in paperback in time for Hallowe'en 2014.

You've read the intro now watch the 'making of' movie - it's magic!!!


Poetry Witch is Spooky! will be published by Endaxi Press  - a tiny independent publishing house started in 2009 by Michele and Andrew Brenton. Endaxi Press is a boutique press with a small but perfectly formed list of books to its credit including hardcover, paperback and ebooks.

Goodies and Fun!  Perks for Contributing.

£1 - 
name in book on thank you page. 
£5 - name in book on thank you page and a Poetry Witch postcard.

£15 - name in book on thank you page and a copy of the picture book Poetry Witch is Spooky! and a postcard. 

£20 - limited edition print. 

£50 - copy of picture book Poetry Witch is Spooky! name in book on thank you page, postcard and a limited edition print.

£150 - signed copy of book Poetry Witch is Spooky! signed by both Kari-Anne and Michele, two names in book on thank you page, postcard, limited edition print and original artwork associated with the Poetry Witch project.

£500 - signed copy of book Poetry Witch is Spooky! signed by both Kari-Anne and Michele and two names in the book on the thank you page and a limited edition print and a mounted signed copy of the original poem Haunted House and a framed original Poetry Witch painting or Haunted House painting - 1 of each only available.

Poetry Witch

OR Haunted House

Once you have contributed please email andrew@endaxipress.com to let him know how you'd like your name to appear on the thank you page.

Why support Poetry Witch is Spooky?

In 2009 I started a publishing venture with my husband Andrew.  On the one hand I wanted to publish my own poetry and on the other hand I knew people who had wonderful books that deserved to be published and they weren't getting them out there.  Andrew and I love good books and we love beautifully produced books.  Ebooks are fantastic, there is a place for ebooks but it felt as though actual hard copy, in the hand beautifully created paper books were becoming an elusive dream for many writers.
I cannot, embarrassingly enough for someone who is supposed to be a best selling poet (yes, publishing my own poetry turned out to be less disastrous than I'd expected) adequately describe the pleasure I experienced the first time I held in my hand a copy of a book we'd created for one of our Endaxi Press authors.  
Being part of bringing a book into the world, a book that will live on and continue to be enjoyed maybe generations after ours is a special and unique privilege.
I hope that this full colour paper picture book will be of a standard that it will live on, carrying the names of all the contributors who made it possible with it and carrying the love of books and poetry and the magical wonder of reading and imagination far into the future. I believe this is important and I believe being part of this is a gift to treasure. If you wish to accept it, it is your gift to treasure. And while you enjoy the gift of being part of this small sane act in a troubled chaotic world you will also be giving a gift to a better future by contributing to the existence of a little piece of art and poetry that a child can hold in their hands.
The words in this picture book were previously published in The Ghost House Review Magazine in October 2013 as a poem entitled The House.

    Risks & Challenges

    Risks: We might get killed by a meteor hurtling into the planet and landing on our house. That might slow things down.  We've managed to get books published on schedule before when our home caught fire and we had to find a new place to live - so I'm pretty sure we'll get this one out. Possibly it might not get out in time for Hallowe'en - if it doesn't it won't be because of anything we got wrong. Nothing is 100% certain in life. We'll do our best and we'll keep everyone posted on progress. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      • Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about Poetry Witch is Spooky!
      • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

      FAQs

      Q. Who is this book aimed at? What age group?

      Poetry Witch is Spooky! is intended to be read to 5-11s depending on their level of precocity but with every page having plenty of visual appeal so that a small child can happily turn the pages and have a lot to enjoy while they spot words here and there they recognise. Eventually they will be able to read it for themselves. It isn't an easy peasy read it is meant to encourage them to want to learn to read big words - but it is accessible.
      The poem in the book (the words) was previously published in a grown up literary magazine The Ghost House Review as The House and you can read it here:
      http://issuu.com/ghosthousereview/docs/final
      The book will be less spooky by the time you get to the end because the final reveal is quite cute.
      The whole flavour is a little bit like Doctor Who in that the child can get comfortably scared but it all ends happily. 

      Q. When will I get my perks?

      Poetry Witch is Spooky! should be on general release by 31st October 2014 as it is planned to be out in time for Hallowe'en. So we are hoping to have all the perks done and dusted and sent out ahead of that time so that our lovely contributors will not only have perks unavailable to anyone else they will also be the first people to have copies of the books in their hands.

      Q.  Can I find you on twitter?

      Michele Brenton is a long-established twitter user and once even got voted the most popular human poet in the Shorty Awards of 2011 - she's still trying to forget the fact a chihuahua won the overall most popular poet title that year!  You can find her as @banana_the_poet
      Kari-Anne Fehn can be found as @KayDrawsThings
      Andrew Brenton ( our techy/publishing guru and all round problem solver) is on twitter as @ABrentonPhoto but if you want to ask him anything about the campaign you'll get a quicker response by emailing him at andrew@endaxipress.com

story:
Get Clear. Get Results.

For the past decade or so, I've dedicated my life to helping people just like you to get clear. (Now I'm asking for your help in bringing clearing to the world!) "Get clear" means two things: 

  • CLARITY. What's what now, what really happened in the past, what you want, and what's the quickest way to get there. Sounds simple, but if you stop to think for a moment, can you think of at least one area of your life where you are uncertain? Yup, that's the part that could benefit from a heaping dose of clarity, like ASAP. 
  • CLEARING. As a master intuitive healer, I help you clear your crap, swiftly and permanently releasing the doubts, blocks, fears, and/or limiting beliefs that have kept you stuck.  When you get clear, you get results. Cue the heavens opening up and the "ahhhhhhhh" chorus. 
When you get CLEAR, then you get lasting results. Otherwise, it's all just a temporary fix. I've helped tens of thousands of people to get clear, and made a healthy living doing it (I don't mind tellin' ya.) Now it's time to give back and share with the world these same powerful tools and secrets that have helped my students and private clients to completely transform their lives, all by clearing the crap that was in their way. 
Hmmmm…what's the best/fastest way for me to share this prized training with as many people as possible? Publish a DIY clearing book and get it into lots of hands. 

You Want In?

I'm already a 2x bestselling author, so this ain't my first rodeo. (Translation: rest assured I'm a good writer and I know how to create and market a great book. Word.) But instead of just publishing this book myself, I figured it would be a lot more fun to build a community and share the rewards together. Besides, a like-minded community is exactly what you're gonna want as soon as you start messing around with these clearing tools (because it helps to have somebody to practice on. And I'm not sure how your boss or your neighbor would feel about past life clearings, or pendulums, or any of the other weird-yet-wildly-effective stuff we're going to play with together, so it helps to meet new people and start fresh, mmmkay?).   

  • I'm asking you to help chip in for the exact amount it will cost me to produce this book and bring it to the masses. Funds raised are to cover the costs of a professional copyeditor, proofreader, cover designer, interior layout designer, printing and publishing, distribution, ISBN #s, website, and promotion.   
  • You'll find some pretty snazzy perks here, including three brand-new, never-before-seen offerings from me, like a brand new top-secret Facebook mastermind community - which ALL contributors get access to. (So excited!!!!) Just to put things into perspective, it costs about $5000 to work with me personally. More than half of the perks packages include some type of one-on-one time with me. Can I get a hell yeah?
  • If by some strange stroke of suck, we don't reach our goal, I'm still producing the book, just without you, the party, the fun, and with my own funds. *she says with a sniffle and a saddened, lonely sigh.*  

The Impact of Clearing

Want peace? Joy? Love? Acceptance? Prosperity? Achievement? Work on getting CLEAR, because it's your ticket to everything you want (assuming you know what you want. Which, if you don't, that kind of proves my point, doesn't it?) 

  • As a planet, we are approaching a tipping point. The more people who get clear, the more peace we will experience as a global community. I don't like to throw around phrases like "peace" and "global community" because it has sort of a hippie-dippy feel to it, but you know that scene at the end of "Miss Congeniality" where Sandra Bullock is back to being an FBI agent, but now she's all gorgeous, and she gets the award from her fellow pageanters, and she suddenly gets choked up and says, "Ohmigod. I really DO want world peace!" Yeah, it's like that. 
  • Not everyone can afford to work with me directly or to take my courses, and I've been providing free and low-cost alternatives in one form or another since I got started, but nothing as comprehensive and step-by-step as this book. This book WILL make a difference in the lives of the people who read it. It's important, and your support is important to me, more than you could know. *end sentimental moment*
  • People know me as a leader and teacher who underpromises and over delivers. My promise it that the book will be clear, focused, and badass.  

Risks & Challenges. Say What?

Yes, everything in life has a risk, especially anything worth doing (I am OK with risk! I logged over 300 scuba dives before I had kids. Um, and about 4 since.)

  • Every participation level includes a copy of the book in one form or another. Your risk is that you could think the book sucks. In which case, we should probably clear some crap for you, hahahahaha. No, seriously. You might hate it, hate me, or just think it's all way too "out there" for you. That's a risk. Although if you've read this far, I'd say it's unlikely. If you were going to hate me, you'd have decided that before you even finished my video above. So that's a pretty low risk. 
  • There's virtually no risk that I won't finish the book because I love to write, I'm already working on it and I thrive on deadlines. I'm just weird like that. 
  • There is also a risk that you could buy one of the top perks packages, enter  your payment info, and then immediately get struck dead by lightning. However, as a skilled psychic I will tell you that is highly unlikely. IF you contribute today.

What? You gots zero funds?

I purposely made the first perk really, really, really low ($10) but if you just can't swing that then:

  • Consider that you may need the information in this book more than anyone else reading this right now
  • Would you please help us spread the word by using the share tools on social media, and reaching out to friends, enemies, family members who could help us create this ultimate win-win? Pretty pretty please?

Thank you for reading this entire thing. You must be tired now. Why not choose a perk package, make your contribution, and then go take a nap? It's what wonder kitty would do. 

Food for Thought: 

Weird is the new normal.

story:
My name is Jesus Maria Alvarez. I am a novelist, builder and baseball evangelist living in New Jersey. My debut novel, ESPERANZA FARM, is almost done, but another look by the editor is essential at this time.

Editing magic is being provided by the great A. Victoria Mixon. We have been working together on ESPERANZA FARM for a couple of years. Her insight, talent and generosity of spirit have transformed the manuscript.

ABOUT THE NOVEL:

ESPERANZA FARM is the story of Paco Serrano, a 13 year-old Cuban boy who loves baseball and is trying to live a normal, even ambitious, life after his world is turned upside down in post-Revolution Cuba.

On the day that Paco is born, his very pregnant mother is at the stadium rooting for the local team. In the bottom of the seventh inning she goes into labor and Paco arrives before the final out. Growing up, happiness and baseball are tied together. But Paco’s dream of playing for Cuba’s national team ends on a day in October of ’62 when missiles are discovered not far from his home.

The international crisis that follows has not yet subsided when Paco’s parents apply for a visa to the U.S. Whatever harassment and difficulty Paco faces while waiting to leave for America disappear each afternoon: that’s when the children of communists and counter-revolutionaries get together at the old ball field to play the game they love.

Paco’s story is about the pursuit of freedom and dignity and finding refuge wherever possible.

I can’t wait to share his story with the world. Please help me, by funding this next step on ESPERANZA FARM's road to publication.

You can read an excerpt of ESPERANZA FARM here.

story:
NEWS FLASH - WE HAVE A BOOK!

ORGANIC REVOLUTIONARY: A MEMOIR OF THE MOVEMENT FOR REAL FOOD, PLANETARY HEALING, AND HUMAN LIBERATION

is now available for purchase! We uploaded our file on February 1st to Lulu.com – a print-on-demand service that can fulfill orders worldwide. We will have our first shipment of print copies available in time for the NOFA-VT Winter Conference.

On Sunday, February 14th I will be presenting a workshop with Joey Klein & Jack Lazor entitled, “Whatever Happened to Organic?” followed by a book signing event. 


Sixteen years after first sitting down to tell this story, I'm excited to finally announce the publication of my latest book. At the time I had just left my job on the staff of USDA's National Organic Program, where I spent five years helping to develop the organic regulations. Before joining the staff at USDA I had been a leader in the organic movement, and had helped create national guidelines for organic certification. I had also been a market gardener here in northeastern Vermont, an author and an educator, teaching about soil management, organic gardening methods, and food system issues. 

The book tells the story of how a marginal social change movement grew into today's $39 billion dollar organic industry. Where did the ideas embedded in the true organic vision come from? My own story--recounting my intellectual influences and friendships, my life changes and my passions--is intertwined with the story of the work of defining 'organic' and attempting to unify a rather disparate bunch. Many of the philosophical and ideological controversies that divided the movement early on persisted as it entered the mainstream.

Today many consumers are confused by a proliferation of eco-labels and claims like "all natural." Passionate food system activists believe that 'organic' has lost its meaning, largely because the corporate-dominated USDA took it over and watered down the standards. By telling the story of my own journey towards the true organic vision, and what really happened at USDA, I hope to help everyone understand what this vision is really all about.

There is plenty of cause for hope. I recently had the honor to be the only North American to address the Regional Conference on Marketing & Innovation in Organic Farming in Goesan Province, South Korea. There I met farmers, researchers, and organizers from many parts of the Global South. They are the ones we need to lead the way to the 21st century organic revolution, working to realize the true organic vision of real food, planetary healing and human liberation in their own communities.

Please help get this message out to more people -- your support is deeply meaningful. Every contribution is deeply appreciated -- many thanks! 

What We Need & What You Get

I’ve had great help in the course of writing this book and preparing to self-publish—a huge undertaking, but very satisfying (and a little scary too). Up till now I’ve financed it myself, with a little help from my family, including hiring expert editorial and design support. My book designer and web/social media guru, Marie Hathaway, and indexing champ Andrea Chesman, are working hard to produce a book we’re sure to be proud of.  Now I’m reaching out to you to help us get our excellent final product out into the world, and find the readership it deserves. 

Meeting our goal of $7,700 will give us enough to:

* Pay our outstanding design and indexing team what they’re worth

* Produce the E-book

* Set up distribution for  print-on-demand

* Print a substantial initial run for advance orders, perks, review copies and book events

* Pay for publicity costs, including press releases to reviewers and advertising in organic-oriented publications

* Fund some travel expenses for a speaking/book tour 

Rewards for Your Support:

You will receive my personal thanks and appreciation if all you can do is to “Like” my Facebook page and share info about the campaign and the book with your Friends and other people too—whatever communications media you use. Make some noise! 

While money is nice, you don’t have to contribute financially to help! I will be happy to comp you a signed copy of this book or the e-book version if you help out by offering to publish a review, arrange an interview or speaking event. Just let me know what you can do.

And if you can, please do take advantage of one of the perks we are offering in return for your financial contribution.

What if we don’t make our goal?

This is my first effort at crowd funding and I am very much a social media novice…don’t have a smart phone either. But I do have a track record of writing books that people find helpful, and even some experience with self-publishing – back in pre-internet days, when Joe Smillie helped me revise my modest handbook, The Soul of Soil. Later picked up by Chelsea Green, the 4th edition is still in print and considered a classic.

I finished a complete first draft of Organic Revolutionary a year ago, and decided to wait to launch this campaign until I was sure the book would be done soon and done well.  Editing expert Cathy Donohue helped me make it flow well and avoid confusion. Rest assured that, even in the unlikely event that we don’t meet our funding goal, the book will be published and the folks who have been helping me make it excellent will be paid what they are worth. Anything extra will go toward more publicity and getting the book more widely distributed.

The book tells the story of how a marginal social change movement grew into today's $39 billion dollar organic industry. Where did the ideas embedded in the true organic vision come from? My own story--recounting my intellectual influences and friendships, my life changes and my passions--is intertwined with the story of the work of defining 'organic' and attempting to unify a rather disparate bunch. Many of the philosophical and ideological controversies that divided the movement early on persisted as it entered the mainstream.Today many consumers are confused by a proliferation of eco-labels and claims like "all natural." Passionate food system activists believe that 'organic' has lost its meaning, largely because the corporate-dominated USDA took it over and watered down the standards. By telling the
story of my own journey towards the true organic vision, and what really
happened at USDA, I hope to help everyone understand what this vision is really
all about.
There is plenty of cause for hope. I recently had the honor to be the only North American to address the Regional Conference on Marketing & Innovation in Organic Farming in Goesan Province, South Korea. There I met farmers, researchers, and organizers from many parts of the Global South. They are the ones we need to lead the way to the 21st century organic revolution, working to realize the true organic vision of real food, planetary healing and human liberation in their own communities.Please help get this message out to more people -- your support is deeply meaningful. Every contribution is deeply appreciated -- many thanks! 
What We Need & What You Get
I’ve had great help in the course of writing this book and
preparing to self-publish—a huge undertaking, but very satisfying (and a little
scary too). Up till now I’ve financed it myself, with a little help from my
family, including hiring expert editorial and design support. My book designer
and web/social media guru, Marie
Hathaway, and indexing champ Andrea
Chesman, are working hard to produce a book we’re sure to be proud of.  Now I’m reaching out to you to help us get our
excellent final product out into the world, and find the readership it
deserves.  
Meeting our goal of $7,700 will give us enough to:
* Pay our outstanding design and indexing team
what they’re worth
* Produce the E-book
* Set up distribution for  print-on-demand 
* Print a substantial initial run for advance
orders, perks, review copies and book events
* Pay for publicity costs, including press
releases to reviewers and advertising in organic-oriented publications
* Fund some travel expenses for a speaking/book
tour Rewards for Your Support:
You will receive my personal
thanks and appreciation if all you can do is to “Like” my Facebook page and
share info about the campaign and the book with your Friends and other people
too—whatever communications media you use. Make some noise! While money is nice, you don’t have to contribute financially to help! I will be
happy to comp you a signed copy of this book or the e-book version if you help out by offering to publish a review, arrange an interview or speaking event. Just let me know what you can do.And if you can, please do take advantage of one of the perks we are offering in return for your financial contribution.What if we don’t make our goal?
This is my first effort at crowd funding and I am very much
a social media novice…don’t have a smart phone either. But I do have a track
record of writing books that people find helpful, and even some experience with
self-publishing – back in pre-internet days, when Joe Smillie helped me revise
my modest handbook, The Soul of Soil.
Later picked up by Chelsea
Green, the 4th edition is still in print and considered a
classic.
I finished a complete first draft of Organic Revolutionary a year ago, and decided to wait to launch
this campaign until I was sure the book would be done soon and done well.  Editing expert Cathy Donohue helped me make it
flow well and avoid confusion. Rest assured that, even in the unlikely event
that we don’t meet our funding goal, the book will be published and the folks
who have been helping me make it excellent will be paid what they are worth.
Anything extra will go toward more publicity and getting the book more widely
distributed.

story:
UPDATE Nov. 9: £1,000 Matching donation!

With just 66 hours left to go, the generous folks at BiCon Continuity have just pledged to match the next £1,000 raised in the campaign! We're absolutely floored and delighted by their support! Help us make the match—and meet our goal! Update Nov. 10: MATCH REACHED! We raised £1,000 yesterday, so will be getting the extra donation from BiCon Continuity! This donation will help us do extra publicity to get the book into libraries and bookshops in the UK.

UPDATE Nov. 6: Referral contest!

The two top referrers to the campaign—the person who refers the most people, and the person who refers the greatest amount of funds—will each win a complete stack of Thorntree Press paperbacks: EIGHT books in all! More details on our campaign updates page.

Everything you need to know about being bi in the UK

Purple Prose: Bisexuality in Britain is just what it says on the tin: an accessible guide to UK bisexuality. It covers topics such as definitions of bisexuality (and why the dictionary definition isn't good enough), stereotypes and biphobia (including prejudice from within the gay and lesbian communities, sadly), being bi at work, teenage bisexuality and bisexuality through the years, the media’s approach to bisexual celebrities, and fictional bi characters.

We explore the various ways bisexuality intersects with other identities: disabled bisexuals, polyamorous bisexuals, trans and genderqueer bisexuals and bis of colour have all written about their experiences. There's a "problem page" chapter, a chapter on bi history, a chapter on activism and local bi groups, a glossary, an index, and a list of online resources. This is the book you’ll buy for your friend who’s just come out to you as bi-curious, or for your parents who think your bisexuality is weird or a phase, or for yourself, because you know you’re bi but you don’t know where to go or what to do about it.

NEW! We've just released a sneak peek at the table of contents:

1. The Basics
2. Coming Out (And Staying In)
3. Greedy, Confused and Invisible: Bi Myths and Legends
4. The Gender Agenda
5. Bisexuality and Non-Monogamy
6. Dating While Bi
7. Bisexual And Disabled
8. Bisexual Black and Minority Ethnic (BME) People
9. Lesser Spotted Attractions
10. Bisexuals and Faith
11. Bisexual Across The Years: Life Experiences
12. Bi In The Workplace
13. Fictional Bisexuality: Reviews and Reflections
14. Allies in the Bisexual Community
15. Let's Do Something About This


Who are we?

I’m Kate Harrad, a published fiction and non-fiction writer. I co-edited The Ladies' Loos: From Plumbing to Plucking, a Practical Guide for Girls (The Friday Project, 2006), and my novel All Lies and Jest was published by Ghostwoods Books in 2011. I have over a decade of experience working in business editorial/writing positions, and I've written for the Guardian, The F-Word and the Huffington Post. I have also been a bi activist for several years, and have co-organised numerous UK bi events.

Purple Prose chapter editors include Dr. Meg Barker (author of Rewriting the Rules: An Integrative Guide to Love, Sex and Relationships and co-author of The Bisexuality Report), Marcus Morgan (founder of bi activist group the Bisexual Index), Jacq Applebee (erotic writer and co-founder of Bis of Colour), Milena Popova (Guardian blogger), and Symon Hill (writer, activist, and associate director of the left-wing Christian think tank Ekklesia). This is a diversity of talent and expertise that brings together most of the major bi activists in the UK.



News and blog coverage

Over the last few weeks of the campaign, lots has been written about Purple Prose in LGBTQ news sources and on our contributors' blogs. Here are some of the highlights:

The F-Word: "A Guide to Bisexuality in Britain Can’t Come Soon Enough," by D.H. Kelly.

Diva magazine: "5 Frankly Weird Stereotypes About Bisexuals," by Katy Harrad.

Gay Star News: "The 7 Most Idiotic Things People Say to Bisexuals," by Katy Harrad.

The BiCast: Katy Harrad chats about the Purple Prose campaign.

Diva magazine: "Is Bisexuality Confusing?" by Katy Harrad.

Gay Star News: "You Won't Believe the Reaction of Some White Gay Guys to a Black Bisexual," by Jacq Applebee (with an extract from the book!).

Post on Jacq Applebee's Tumblr about why we need Purple Prose.

Post on Milena Popova's blog about why we need Purple Prose.


I'm working with Thorntree Press: an independent publishing company based in Portland, Oregon, USA. They specialize in non-fiction books on relationships, love and sexuality, with particular focus on non-traditional relationship models. They're also focused on rational, evidence-based approaches to sex and relationships, as well as sharing real-life stories.

Thorntree Press uses crowdfunding to fund production and marketing for all of its books, so they can maintain high production standards, take bigger risks on their titles, and give creators a bigger share of royalties. They've already completed hree successful crowdfunding campaigns, for More Than Two, their 2015 book list, and Ask Me About Polyamory: The Best of Kimchi Cuddles, with hundreds of happy backers!

The money raised in this campaign will go toward editing, layout, proofreading, and production and marketing costs. Our budget for the money raised looks like this:


The Rewards

In addition to the Purple Prose paperback and e-book, we're offering a wide range of rewards from book contributors and Thorntree Press.


Tikva Wolf, creator of the popular webcomic Kimchi Cuddles, has created a special "SuperBi" button and sticker!

Paperback and e-book copies of my novel, All Lies and Jest. A dark, sexy subculture romp, All Lies and Jest is a novel about belief, delusion, and the dangers of being so open-minded that your brain falls out. When the USA becomes a fundamentalist theocracy, one of its first actions is to round up all the queers, atheists, deviants, geeks, goths and other undesirables it can find, and throw them out. The UK welcomes more than its fair share. But Britain is no haven; the Christian United States wants the Old Country to follow in its footsteps, and the fundamentalist tides are rising. Elinor Rosewood is a habitual non-conformist. As British as tea and spanking, she flees her small-minded home town for the dubious joys of London. It’s only after she arrives that she discovers that the greatest isolation can come from being in the middle of a crowd of strangers.


SOLD OUT!
"Some People Are Bi, Get Over It" red T-shirts from Stonewall. Limit 12: We have three small, three medium, three large and three XL. You'll get your choice based on when you backed—so back early!


You can get a day pass for BiCon, the UK's biggest bisexual event, held the first weekend of August 2016 in Preston. Or you can spend an evening in a London pub or cafe with a group of Purple Prose writers and bi activists.


Your Personal Problem Page: Tell us your problem and we'll try to help. You'll get a personal email or letter from our team of writers, which includes former Diva agony aunt Ronete Cohen.


Do you have a sexuality-related event, publication etc that you want to promote? We will help you publicise it through our extensive network of contacts.

A paperback copy of Those Rosy Hours At Mazandaran by Marion Grace Wooley. A young woman confronts her own dark desires and finds her match in a masked conjurer-turned-assassin. Inspired by Gaston LeRoux's The Phantom of the Opera, Marion Grace Woolley takes us on forbidden adventures through a time that has been written out of history books.


One of each of Jacq Applebee's zines, including vegan cooking, gender questioning and polyamorous love poems.


A zine by Dr. Meg John Barker about social suffering, social mindfulness and how we might creatively engage with both.


Rewriting the Rules: An Integrative Guide to Love, Sex and Relationships by Dr. Meg John Barker is a book examining the complicated – and often contradictory – advice that is given about relationships. It is a friendly guide through attraction and sex, monogamy and conflict, break-up and commitment.


Books from Thorntree Press

We're making the entire Thorntree Press list available in print and e-book format!

Ask Me About Polyamory: The Best of Kimchi Cuddles
Tikva Wolf, 2016 (forthcoming)
Foreword by Sophie Labelle
A hilarious and touching comic about polyamory, queer, and genderqueer issues.

Lessons in Love and Life to My Younger Self: A Companion Guide to The Husband Swap (e-book only)
Louisa Leontiades, 2015
Illustrations by Tikva Wolf, foreword by Franklin Veaux
What does opening your relationship teach you about the nature of life, love and yourself?


The Husband Swap: A True Story of Unconventional Love
Louisa Leontiades, 2015
Foreword by Noël Lynne Figart

Four ordinary people challenge monogamy to pursue a utopia of limitless love.


Stories from the Polycule: Real Life in Polyamorous Families
Dr. Elisabeth Sheff, cover illustration by Tikva Wolf

An anthology of work from people living in polyamorous families of all configurations.

The Game Changer: A Memoir of Disruptive Love
Franklin Veaux, 2015
Foreword by A.V. Flox

Franklin and Celeste’s open marriage seemed perfectly safe—until the day Amber entered his life and showed them why the heart does not obey rules.

More Than Two: A Practical Guide to Ethical Polyamory
Franklin Veaux and Eve Rickert, 2014
Foreword by Janet W. Hardy

The long-awaited, wide-ranging resource exploring the often-complex world of living polyamorously.

Workshops and talks

Some of the book's contributors are offering workshops and talks for our top-level backers. Please note you must also pay their travel costs if you want to bring them to you.

Dr. Meg John Barker

Dr. Meg John Barker is a writer, therapist, and activist-academic specialising in sex and relationships. Meg-John is a senior lecturer in psychology at the Open University and a UKCP accredited therapist, and has over a decade of experience researching and publishing on these topics, including Rewriting the Rules. Meg-John provides training on a number of topics, primarily to counsellors, psychotherapists and other practitioners, but can also train on most of these topics to more general audiences (e.g. workplaces, medics, community groups) as well as providing interactive workshops for interested members of the general public. A full list of available topics is here.

Grant Denkinson

Grant has been closely involved with the bisexual and polyamory communities for a couple of decades. He started Polyday: a one day event to discuss non-monogamies and form community. He is happy to speak about bisexuality, polyamory etc. or to faciliate discussions around any aspect of sex, sexuality and relationships. He works promoting and supporting open access to academic research and also as a counsellor / psychotherapist. He is based in Leicester and is happy to travel.

Milena Popova

Milena is a PhD researcher in cultural studies, a judge for the erotica section of the Bisexual Book Awards, and a blogger and activist. She can discuss representations of sex and sexualities in popular culture, workplace issues, structures of oppression and forms of resistance.

Marcus Morgan

Since the early 1990s Marcus Morgan has been one of the UK's leading bisexual activists, delivering training about bisexuality and fighting for better bisexual inclusion. An entertaining and engaging speaker, he combines personal insight with over 20 years of speaking to thousands of bisexual people about their (and his) sexuality. He is the only member of the Institute of Diversity and Equality Practitioners who is also a member of the Magic Circle.

Queering Shakespeare drama workshop with Kaye McLelland

A practical drama workshop investigating and staging some bi or otherwise queer interpretations of passages from Shakespeare (and a bit of Marlowe). This session has been a huge success at numerous BiCons and in 2014 at Wadham College Queer Week (Oxford University). Kaye has a PhD from UCL on bi readings of Spenser and Shakespeare.

Questions?

Got a question about something not covered here? Send an email to press@thorntreepress.com.
