story:
Support this New IndieLove Magazine.

*My name is Sarah Gai and I am an Indie Author of The Curvies series, a set of novellas that I poured my heart and soul into. Aside from that I run www.sarahgai.com where I also make printables and run my two blogs.
WARNING!!! Before you read any further, I need to say this. I want you to get to know me, to know what I, Sarah Gai stand for. I'm a stay at home mother of three and a wife to a husband who works hard to provide for us. Instead of saying " Okay Sarah, you're doing a great job as a mum, but it's time to head back to work" my amazing other half said. " you know what, it's tight but we've managed this far on one wage, go do what you're good at, what you love and i'll support anyway I can". There is not a lot of people who are as blessed as I am to have found a true companion.
With God's help, I truly believe in this Magazine and I'll put 100% into it. But i'm going to tell you the truth. It's Hard.... Hard to know what your goal is and what you need. You Put your own money into it happily, but know that you're just a little too short. Raised to be independent and make it on your own. When a friend of mine suggested crowdfunding I was hesitant after a little convincing and, a lot adamant about wanting to put this statement in I agreed.
So there you have it, a bit about me, my goal, my fears and the faith i'm taking with me through this adventure. Please read on to see more of this project. But do not for one second feel obligated. I don't know how these are run and I refuse to copy another statement or pitch. Even a simple share is a blessing, to let someone know about IndieLove magazine coming this year.
Love
Sarah Gai :)
*The idea for IndieLove magazine came along after I interviewed one of the authors my blog hosted, when she mentioned that my life was filled with the signs of a true Indie, after she spotted my books, printables, photos, music etc. It was like a light bulb went on and I thought she's right. I love everything about the Indie culture. I wanted an online magazine platform that could, showcase Indie works of art from all over the world. All the things I loved. Books, etsy, crafters, Music, Photography, Poetry, Life style living. A place where people could showcase and advertise their work, content with tips for writing and starting handmade businesses etc. Advertising for all those brilliant minds for the world to see and browse. And the great thing about it, is the magazine could be shared through out social media. Visit   www.indielovemagazine.com to submit work or check out what I have begun. it's free to do so.
Not just that but people everywhere can purchase a copy and see what is out there. How far and wide Indie style extends, what passion people put into their dreams, their projects.

With your Help

I am looking to raise hopefully $2000 to make this a reality early in 2016. Anything above $2000 is an absolute blessing from above. It can help me take this to a higher level and create jobs by bringing more people on board which in turn reaches a more worldwide audience and creates more advertising to Indie makers. So please help in anyway you can :)
The funding of this project will cover the set up of the magazine, website, content, organisation of accounts, design, content writers, production, a new office, registrations etc and as thrifty as I am it should just cover the first Two issues. This Magazine will also be available in Print. Check out my video to see the office in progress. All progress will be put onto a page of www.indielovemagazine.com
My aim is to start with a small publication and grow it so I can add more people and products to showcase with links back to their own sites. I have been lucky to acquire Authors like Nashoda Rose and Mia Sheridan to feature, Along with Music Artists like Milky Chance and Holly Ann. Easy crafters and designers. Right now the magazine will be biannual, but with your help I can turn this dream into a monthly product and showcase more Indie Artists. I have a good amount of Indie Authors, artists, designers and publishers with feature stories ready to go. 

The truth is even if I don't reach my goal, I will strive on to make this happen :) . I am very passionate about the Indie community I am apart of and I want to make a difference, even if its just a small one.But with the help of amazing people that may be reading, IndieLove could be launched quicker and with a little pin here or Facebook share there word will spread.

Risks & Challenges

Although I have never run a campaign like this before, I am determined to succeed. Join the IndieLove updates at www.indielovemagazine.com and become part of my journey. I love ideas and correspondence with fans and listen, taking onboard unique comments. I want to share this dream of mine with you all. Check out my perks for the photowall, where I see your smiling faces everyday I go to work and remember that without you all I would not be here. So be sure to subscribe to newsletter at www.indielovemagazine.com

Check out my books and have a look at the quality of work I have put out, so far. Everything has been done by me and my little books have made me so excited to be out in the digital world and in print.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everybody can help contribute and that's okay :) Even One dollar can make a difference, but it's not just about money.Sharing this around or liking my indieLove Facebook page etc would make a world of difference. Please help me spread the word. The more people that know and want to feature their work, the quicker I can get this baby rolling

And that's all there is to it. Thank you taking the time to read through this pitch, I really appreciate it

God bless

Love

Sarah Gai
story_txt:
Support this New IndieLove Magazine.
*My name is Sarah Gai and I am an Indie Author of The Curvies series, a set of novellas that I poured my heart and soul into. Aside from that I run www.sarahgai.com where I also make printables and run my two blogs.
WARNING!!! Before you read any further, I need to say this. I want you to get to know me, to know what I, Sarah Gai stand for. I'm a stay at home mother of three and a wife to a husband who works hard to provide for us. Instead of saying " Okay Sarah, you're doing a great job as a mum, but it's time to head back to work" my amazing other half said. " you know what, it's tight but we've managed this far on one wage, go do what you're good at, what you love and i'll support anyway I can". There is not a lot of people who are as blessed as I am to have found a true companion.
With God's help, I truly believe in this Magazine and I'll put 100% into it. But i'm going to tell you the truth. It's Hard.... Hard to know what your goal is and what you need. You Put your own money into it happily, but know that you're just a little too short. Raised to be independent and make it on your own. When a friend of mine suggested crowdfunding I was hesitant after a little convincing and, a lot adamant about wanting to put this statement in I agreed.
So there you have it, a bit about me, my goal, my fears and the faith i'm taking with me through this adventure. Please read on to see more of this project. But do not for one second feel obligated. I don't know how these are run and I refuse to copy another statement or pitch. Even a simple share is a blessing, to let someone know about IndieLove magazine coming this year.
Love
Sarah Gai :)

story:
¿Qué?

La ambición del mago errante es una oda a la imaginación, en la que su autor ha buscado darle un nuevo giro de tuerca al género.

Durante siglos, la Hermandad de Hechicería ha sobrevivido en el interior del Refugio, santuario mágico aislado del mundo exterior por una inquebrantable barrera mágica. Bajo el liderazgo de los Ancianos y sus férreas Leyes, los hechiceros contienen a las bestias que surgen de la tierra corrompida del Desfiladero, mientras el paso del tiempo reduce su número y debilita su poder.

Kilheid es un joven aeromante con enormes ansias de conocimiento que, constantemente decepcionado y frustrado por las limitaciones impuestas a su poder, se abrirá camino lentamente en los secretos que ocultan el sentido de la prisión sin barrotes en la que generaciones de hechiceros han vivido y se han desvanecido.

El precio que Kilheid habrá de pagar por aferrarse a una verdad fragmentada e incierta difícilmente podrá ser otro que su total aniquilación. Mientras tanto, tras la inamovible Cúpula, el mundo de Lancria aguarda.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Juan Miguel Sánchez.

Nacido en Adra, Almería, en el verano de 1991, pasó buena parte de su infancia y su juventud cautivado por libros y videojuegos, siempre buscando historias que conocer y que vivir en la piel de esos personajes tan lejanos, pero a la vez tan próximos una vez comenzaba a saber de ellos.

Licenciado en Historia por la Universidad de Granada en 2014, su vocación literaria, latente desde los tiempos de su adolescencia, surgió con fuerza en sus años universitarios, durante los cuales escribió multitud de relatos cortos y varias novelas, tocando especialmente los géneros de la ciencia ficción, la fantasía y la novela negra y contemporánea.

Entusiasta lector de autor tan diversos como Isaac Asimov, Margaret Weis, Tracy Hickman y Gabriel García Márquez, intenta con sus trabajos transmitir la verdadera esencia de sus protagonistas, sus motivaciones vitales, sus pensamientos e ideas, enmarcando todo ello en historias amenas e interesantes y buscando siempre la innovación, tratando de aportar su pequeño granito de arena al desarrollo de sus géneros literarios favoritos.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La ambición del mago errante que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Juan Miguel Sánchez vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
La Brasserie du Bas-Canada, c'est quoi?

La Brasserie du Bas-Canada, c'est avant tout un projet de brasseurs. Nous avons pour mission de faire rayonner la bière artisanale dans la région et à l'échelle du Québec. Il n'y aura pas de compromis sur l'utilisation d'ingrédients et la qualité du produit, nous voulons simplement vous servir le meilleur.

La Brasserie du Bas-Canada, c'est un lieu pour tous les amateurs de bières, néophytes, beergeeks ou touristes. Non seulement nous avons la volonté de brasser la meilleure bière possible, mais nous voulons aussi être un endroit de rencontres et de partage. Nous allons brasser des bières collaboratives avec d'autres microbrasseries. Nous voulons encourager aussi le développement du brassage amateur, notamment par l'organisation de concours et d'ateliers sur le brassage.

La Brasserie du Bas-Canada, c'est aussi l'appropriation du territoire. Combien de fois a-t-on entendu qu'il n'y avait rien du côté de Gatineau? Notre projet s'inscrit dans la logique de développer une appartenance régionale. Nos racines sont ici. Nous voulons multiplier les liens dans notre communauté, travailler avec des entreprises et des projets de la région et prouver que nous ne sommes pas une simple banlieue d'Ottawa.

La Brasserie du Bas-Canada, les origines

Le projet de la Brasserie du Bas-Canada s'est façonné au fil de dégustations de bières, de sessions de brassage, de milliers d'heures de remue-méninges et de plusieurs périples au Québec, en Ontario, dans l'Ouest canadien et dans le Nord-Est des États-Unis. C'est la rencontre de deux entrepreneurs passionnés de bières et de produits du terroir.

Marc-André Cordeiro Lima est un vétéran du monde de la restauration et des bars avec près de quinze années d'expérience dans le domaine. Également, il a fait un passage chez Labatt et au Gainsbourg. Traducteur de formation, il n'a pas la langue dans sa poche. C'est un brasseur passionné et il aime le contact humain. Vous l'avez sûrement déjà aperçu une bière à la main entrain de convertir les foules aux vertus de la bière artisanale.

Gabriel Girard Bernier est un produit de la restauration et du monde du vin. Sommelier de profession, il a côtoyé, dans sa jeunesse, les fermenteurs de la défunte microbrasserie Brassemonde à St-André-Avellin. Il a travaillé notamment au Gainsbourg et à Soif-Bar à Vin avec Véronique Rivest. Ses aventures dans le monde du vin l'ont amené dans l'Ouest canadien mais surtout au monde de la bière. Brasseur passionné, ce n'est pas le plus bruyant du duo, mais il peut vous parler d'une technique brassicole ou d'une souche de levure pendant des heures.

Votre contribution sert à quoi?

En bref, nous voulons 17 500$ pour acheter davantage d'équipements brassicoles, notamment un fermenteur supplémentaire. S'équiper en équipement brassicole, c'est très dispendieux. 

Si nous atteignons l'objectif fixé, ce fermenteur supplémentaire que nous avons baptisé Fermenteur du peuple servira à des brassins collaboratifs et des brassins interactifs. C'est-à-dire que nous ne voulons pas seulement acheter de l'équipement grâce à cette campagne de sociofinancement mais aussi créer avec vous un lien unique et durable.

En pratique, ce fermenteur servira à produire au moins deux brassins interactifs annuellement. Le type de bière, les paramètres de la recette et le nom de la bière seront élaborés avec vous via les médias sociaux. Des brassins collaboratifs avec d'autres brasseries, des brasseurs amateurs, et des partenaires régionaux seront aussi produits grâce à votre aide!

Nous vous proposons des contreparties diverses et franchement intéressantes. Elles sont réalistes, originales et vous permettent de mettre la main sur des produits exclusifs. Les dates de livraisons sont basées sur des prévisions pessimistes, ainsi nous voulons garantir que les contreparties seront disponibles dans les délais.

À quelle étape est rendu le projet de la Brasserie du Bas-Canada?

-Nous avons sécurisé notre local au 455, boulevard de la Gappe (vous pouvez l'admirer dans la vidéo).

-Une demande pour modifier le zonage a été déposée à la Ville de Gatineau en juillet dernier. Nous avons travaillé avec le comité d'urbanisme et le processus est bien enclenché.

-En juin, nous avons brassé et commercialisé une première bière, La P'tite Wit, qui a été définitivement un succès. Brassée dans les installations de la microbrasserie Loup Rouge à Sorel, notre bière a été disponible dans différents bars et restaurants de la région. D'ailleurs, une nouvelle bière sera disponible sous peu et des bières collaboratives seront produites dans les prochains mois.

-Les plans du local et de la salle de brassage sont prêts.

-Nous avons l'appui d'acteurs économiques importants de la région dont le CLD de Gatineau.

-Nous avons des lettres d'intention d'achats de la part de plusieurs entreprises de la région et d'ailleurs au Québec.

-Le montage financier du projet est en processus de finalisation.

-Nous avons des investisseurs sérieux derrière le projet.

Bref, il reste encore beaucoup de travail à faire, mais nous sommes près du but.

Quel impact la Brasserie du Bas-Canada aura sur la région ?

Évidemment, un projet comme la Brasserie Bas-Canada va créer des emplois, un sentiment de fierté pour la région et un endroit agréable pour se rencontrer autour d'une bière. Une brasserie artisanale, c'est bien plus que ça.

Le milieu brassicole québécois est en pleine effervescence. On voit apparaître des brasseries artisanales aux quatre coins du Québec, des brasseries de quartiers, des fermes brassicoles. Ces nouvelles entreprise ont plus que la bière en commun, elles s'approprient le territoire et tissent des liens avec des agriculteurs, des entreprises, et d'autres initiatives régionales. En plus, les brasseries deviennent des lieux pour faire rayonner des produits du terroirs et la culture régionale. La région de l'Outaouais, et Gatineau en particulier, a besoin de projets dynamiques et innovateurs. La Brasserie du Bas-Canada s'inscrit dans ce renouveau pour la région.

D'autres façons d'aider

Nous comprenons que certaines d'entre-vous ne peuvent pas nous aider financièrement,  vous pouvez nous aidez autrement :

-Passez le mot et publicisez le projet de la Brasserie du Bas-Canada sur les médias sociaux, Facebook, par exemple  Vous pouvez aussi utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

-Parlez-en à votre famille, vos amis, vos collègues de travail !

*Vous devez avoir 18 ans et plus pour contribuer*

Nous comprenons que certaines d'entre-vous ne peuvent pas nous aider financièrement,  vous pouvez nous aidez autrement :
-Passez le mot et publicisez le projet de la Brasserie du Bas-Canada sur les médias sociaux, Facebook, par exemple  Vous pouvez aussi utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !
-Parlez-en à votre famille, vos amis, vos collègues de travail !
*Vous devez avoir 18 ans et plus pour contribuer*

*Please note that Boring Donkey Songs will only be published in January 2017, all pre-ordered books will be sent out during that time. 

 

About the book 

Boring Donkey songs is a collection of poems and writings by Singapore Cultural Medallion recipient and winner of the Joseph Balestier Award for the Freedom of Art 2016, Lee Wen.

While not considering himself a writer by profession, Lee Wen updates his Facebook page daily with his thoughts and feelings on occurrences around him, be it his individual political philosophies or his own struggles with Parkinson’s disease. The book also provides crucial records and accounts of Singaporean art history. Lee frequently alludes to vital, unforgettable moments in our short history, such as the controversial 10-year ban of performance art and forum theatre, artists and professionals who have left an indelible mark on our artistic developments such as Josef Ng, Helina Chan and Juliana Yasin, and recounts of his own struggles experienced as an artist in Singapore. Donkey Songs therefore serves as a record of his frustrations and triumphs portrayed in an almost anti-poem sense, where his writings emulate the sense of a poem, but without its traditional elements.  Chapters are divided by year starting from 2013, and are organised in chronological sequence by month and date of material.

 

What We Need 

Through this crowdfunding initiative, we hope to raise enough money to cover the publishing costs of printing Donkey Songs. The rest of the proceeds will go towards Lee Wen’s medical expenses and assisted care as he continues to tackle Parkinson’s disease. Grey Projects will not be profiting from the publication of this book.

story:
Soccer and Societal Development in Africa is a project that will profile charitable organizations that use soccer as a tool for societal development in Africa. This will be done by conducting interviews with as many people as possible who are directly involved in these types of projects as possible. Not just the administrators and coaches either, but the African people will be actively sought out to discuss their feelings.

I have already begun work on this project while still here in North America, this is being collected on my blog as I continue to work. Signing up for my updates will allow you to read along as this unfolds, and you can even be mentioned on the blog if you contribute to certain perk levels on the right. The end goal is a published book where you can again be mentioned in print.

The project itself will be 3 phase:

1) I will conduct interviews with volunteers in Africa teaching children, and adults in need, soccer through such organizations as: Projects Abroad, International Volunteer HQ, Grassroot Soccer, Cross Cultural Solutions, African Impact, and a number of others. This will be an opportunity to have a series of articles that show how we, ordinary citizens of the world, can positively affect the world around us.

2) I will examine how a local African soccer league operates its own charitable projects. I have chosen Premier Soccer League (PSL) as my focus. I will foucs on Ajax Cape Town’s Community Scheme, where players and coaches participate with children in their area. I wish to see how these groups interact twith the same grassroots organzations that are not part of a charitable organization.

3) The last phase will incorporate the Africa Cup of Nations, which will be held in South Africa January 19 - February 10 2013. This will be a great opportunity to show what the pinnacle of soccer in Africa can do for its people. The purpose of this phase will be to link together everything from the children learning soccer in the playground, to the professional clubs interacting with those same children, to the international stars representing their country. I wish to show the connection from dusty African playgrounds staffed by volunteers, to the premier stadiums of World soccer.

I have developed a number of contacts across North America and Africa who are itching to get in on this project once it is fully realized. You too can be part of it, by contributing you are getting me closer to being in Africa to conduct this reasearch and write this book. All funding will go towards my travel and living expenses while in Africa, you will be given the chance to live in Africa along side me as I share my stories through my blog.

I currently write soccer related articles for Vancouver Whitecpas FC. My work with local soccer supporters, and seeing the effect that soccer has on their life, further solidified my interest in pursuing this project. There are no other fans in the world like soccer fans, they are the most passionate, knowledgable, and dedicated group you will find.

Depending on the funding I raise I will be in Africa from September or October of 2012 to the conclusion of the Africa Cup of Nations in February of 2013. My focus will only be on the completion of this book, and that is what your contribution will go towards: the successful execution of my Soccer and Societal Development in Africa project, which has the ultimate goal of further breaking down the imagined barriers in the world.

story:
Together We Can Make The Change Happen

We all depend on nature. Especially our oceans. Without a healthy eco system we can not survive. We have to remember the importance of it and take actions to make the change happen. When we learn as children how to care, for ourselves, for our community and for nature we will keep the habits forever. The more children we reach with this sweet story, the more light we can spread.

 

We Need Your Support, You Will Be Part Of The Solution

The idea is to get NGO's involved  - you help fund the book with a special price and you can sell it with your merchandise to raise funds for your association. Like this, we can help each other and help nature in a sustainable way.

  • The book will be printed in the most eco and green way. We will make sure to be as transparent and coherent in this topic as we can be.
  • We want to pay our people well, Artists often work for a salary which doesn't honor the creative content as well as the hard work. We want to be fair to everybody who is involved.
  • We believe it is important to get Kio's message out into the world, the more we raise the more we can spread her word.

The Positive Impact

We all depend on the oceans. We all depend on nature. We depend on a healthy environment, internal and external. When we don't educate our children, how can they create a new world in which the plastic pollution and other environmental issues are not destroying it? How can we make sure the young generations are prepared for this changes? When we educate them in a loving way.We believe in co-creation and that helping each other, being fair, spread the love and have fun while doing it, is really cool and absolutely the magic of our time.

  • With purchasing the book its easy and simple to have a positive impact
  • Fund a larger amount of books and sell it, will help you fund your amazing project, which will help the world
  • We are in this together

Challenges On The Way

We will bring this book out. No matter what challenges might occur on the way. We will do our best to keep the transparency about the progress of the project and its development.

  • We are persistent and passionate, we will face obstacles with courage and we will solve them asap.
  • When you are on a heartfelt mission, nothing can stop you.

Get Involved

We love to co-create and to build up communities. Please get in touch with us if you want to be involved in any form.

  • We need you to spread the campaign and help to get Kio's beautiful message as far as it can get!!
  •  

Love, like, and share! <3

story:
My background: I’m a graduate of life sciences who crossed over into the domain of psychology, psychiatry and social work - assisting substance misusers, young people, mental health survivors and refugees for 8 years (where this project began).  Later I switched to IT and Web site management as a day job whilst continuing to develop work on a thesis whenever possible. Currently promoting online the biodiversity of wild bee species.
My Campaign: I would like to fund the final stages of an important work that accounts for, amongst other things, how relationships between neurones in the brain manifest the units or expressed elements of psychology (knowledge, understanding, behaviour, language, consciousness, faith, purpose, meaning etc.).

To note (before reading the rest of my presentation): the account below presents the logical process showing that it is rooted in established science (not simply a work of imagination or fiction) plucked out of thin air. The book will be written in a simple step-by-step argued style, so that anyone who has studied the basics of biology at school will be able to follow. 

The work's logic has been achieved by exploring, mapping and formulating the information organisation pattern omnipresent in biology - the Gene - and comparing it with the organisational pattern of information at the human brain level (the unit of Understanding).  Having done so, over 20 similarities between the two domains of expression emerge, as if the two systems are analogous. I have called this information organisation pattern, the Appreciative State, where essentially environmental information is rationally represented and matched with internal structures to create a response capacity. The Appreciative State appears to be the biological version of a physical property, but is one that provides a counter response to the forces of entropy, however enabling life not only to act to protect itself, but to react to it through expression and thrive in its given environment.

Could the human brain really be using the same Appreciative State information organisation pattern as the cell? Amongst the 20 similarities, is that the brain focuses through time on a survival horizon; it expresses itself to thrive in, and dominate its respective environment; it is characterised by what it appreciates and amongst other things is not beyond being cultured. So it’s not implausible that evolution hit upon the same fundamental outside-inside organisation as the cell. It is also curious that we use the word ‘expression’ to talk about the outcomes of both genetic and human brain activity. 

The evolution of this capacity to generate Appreciative States in our brains, in quantity, could thus have been the key event that gave us our evolutionary advantage – the missing link that anthropologists have been searching for.

When we look at the detail and formulate the constants of shared Appreciative State construction (between the Gene/cell and Understanding/brain)  - constants which are ‘fulfilled’ by variables of the level - we also start to see an organisational resonance at other levels; with other internal-external systems: in physiology, in social identity, in technology, in institutions, in law and policy, to nation states and higher. In that resonance, we also can see that failure to attain or maintain higher Appreciative States can result in collapses and ensuing power struggles between the higher and lower respective levels. The most prominent examples of this are disease, mental illness, social oppression, revolution and international conflicts.

As a form of supportive evidence for the existence of Appreciative States (and our prior ignorance of them), we find ourselves observing a sort of domino effect.  With solutions to a significant number of debates tumbling in sequence. This constitutes a form of proof for the work and its core idea. This, plus the realisation that we can now see a substructure or pattern to human expression with the potential to put in order (realign) a number human domains that don't function correctly (see list), enables us to pull together the pieces of the historically difficult human nature and activity puzzle. The Appreciate State provides us with a common framework or surface upon which we can reliably compare and fit together domain edges, effectively giving us a bigger picture and a unifying theory of human expression.

The parts of the puzzle that the full work will impact on - either directly seen, implied by debates or even political correctness - are as follows: 
  • The neural correlates of consciousness (a mechanism);
  • A theory of Intelligence (and AI);
  • The Nature v Nurture debate (the solution);
  • Why Homo sapiens are drawn to use Art, Philosophy, Science and/or Religion to create, stabilise and maintain understanding;
  • How Mental Health struggles develop, persist and can be reversed - the total framework promises sharper tools in human assistance fields;
  • The syntax in the construction of Language and why there are 6 constant questions in our language (who, what, when, where, why, how) whose answers are important in the formulation of ‘information’ and its assembly;
  • The transmission process that is Education and that of Culture (definitions);
  • The formation of social Identity (definition);
  • Oppression theory (clarity of the constituent elements involved in the '-isms');
  • Why certain phenomena are very important in our social fabric such as Respect, Free Speech, social justice and democratic process;
  • A new framework theory for science in Politics;
  • A workable framework, to measure and compare the political health of a nation.
    With all its promise, the work needs to be out in the public domain and examined. So my campaign is to get assistance to finalise this important work and publish it as a book.

    The magnitude of what contributors will help achieve

    As the implications of the work are simply enormous, since the start of the project 21 years ago I have always believed that there are hundreds or thousands of people whose paths I haven’t been able to cross and engage with, but who know precisely the importance it holds at the heart of it.  People that would readily offer support to the project (or person behind it); professionals or individuals who would benefit in their lives, and conscious, concerned citizens who want our political systems to have real rational policy integrity. An integrity that would abstract us, and function independently from the ideologies and political personality.

    If you are one of those people, you probably know that since the Renaissance period, it has been the aim of leading thinkers to bring together a coherent description of the relationship between the arts, sciences and humanities; to comprehend how social justice can be an integral part of political and rational economic aims. This relationship has however eluded us; and remained mysteriously hidden out of sight but continued to be a grail of for many wider-thinking academics.  If you are one of these people, this work is for you. Please help me with the means to achieve the final phase of the work, so I can then bring together the ends.

    On a personal note, enabling me to finish the work will set me free on so many levels. The ‘Eureka moment’ occurred in May of 1993 when I was in my early twenties. Bitten by something terrifyingly huge that I could not at all ignore or escape from, I knew it would take time, but couldn’t foresee how many times on my path I would put career possibilities, ambitions of having a family and material gains aside.

    I had hoped with each funding application or letter to people that could help with it (see attempts list below), something would give. Now in my mid-forties, 21 years on, I believe I have to stick my neck out, be more visible and ask for your indulgence. Crowd-source funding is the perfect and final opportunity to accomplish my aims.

    What is Needed

    I need uninterrupted time to finish the work; to cover basic living expenses for 6 months. The period will allow me to distil around 160,000 words that I have at present down to a draft that I can get a professional editor to work on in the end/spring of 2015.  I work with wild solitary bee populations (especially the culture of mason bees), so when my first draft is being examined spring activities will step in to provide me with living expenses for the final editing phase. I aim to have an e-book ready for distribution to my Indiegogo supporters and interested parties in May 2015 – the 22nd anniversary of the discovery.

    The advantages of helping me: at risk of sounding pompous, any sharers or supporter of this project will be able to say that they were part of a key moment; being present to assist the birth of this very important work. Those that contribute the sum whose perk covers the e-book will get the inside track to a probable shift in the way we regard human activity. It is entirely possible, though there is no guarantee, that being the first among your family, friends and colleagues to clearly comprehend this, could bring personal and professional advantages.

    Where the funds will go if I don't reach my goal: All funds will contribute to finishing the work and the e-books will be delivered to contributors whether on deadline or just after. A Twitter account (@AStateBook) is also set up to broadcast updates on developments. Anyone exceeding the e-book perk investment will automatically receive a copy.

    The Impact

    You may believe or think my game-changing claims are impossible, but also want to be proven wrong. Know that - like all big ideas - there will be an inherent simplicity and beauty in what I am about to publish and you will certainly see this when you read the chapter dealing with Political level phenomena, even if at this point it is not that evident. Your contribution whether buying an ebook or telling your friends or colleagues to ‘check out this project where this bloke is making a massive set of claims on Indiegogo’, will be very much appreciated.

      Risks & Challenges

      Let me first state that I have not had one single contradiction to the core Appreciative State thesis on all the years I have been working on it. I have constantly rechecked my assumptions, worked and compared it in the real world for alignment with surface behaviour and language, and constant confirmation reassures me of its accuracy and inherent beauty.

      1. I may be overwhelmed by the scale of the task: Conscious of the enormity of the work, on a handful occasions I have been overwhelmed by what I often referred to ‘the hot and hairy monster’.  Too hot to get close to and too hairy (read scary) to contemplate.  I have taken unconscious breaks from the work usually because of such fears. However I am tenacious, if nothing else, and have kept coming back to it. There’s also been sometimes the ‘Who am I to be in possession of such a hugely important piece of work?’ question, but I am reminded that I made a relatively rare move from life sciences to the psychological and social arenas and that this cross-domain perspective, combined with my courage to pose some fundamental questions is what has gifted me this precious revelation. Support from a large number of people might initially also overwhelm me, but this positive experience would rapidly serve to bolster my concentrating and courage.
      2. Someone will ‘publish’ before I do. This is a risk I have to take, but I have been living with this for years.  I have a long history of notes, documents and letters that show my involvement in the inception, history and vision. I just have to trust in providence and people’s decency to give me credit where it is due.

      Past Challenges

      The best way to demonstrate my conviction and commitment would be to offer more information about my CV, the timeline and of my efforts to bring the work to the public domain. 

        • 1991: BSc. in Biochemistry, King’s College London
        • 1992 to 1998: Various social support work and counselling roles within alcohol & substance misuse, mental health, youth work and asylum seeker fields.
        • May 1993: inspiration for project whilst comparing the rigour of life sciences with psychological social work interventions.
        • 1995: PhD proposal drawn up - conversations with former tutors and peers suggested subject was was too cross disciplinary to find a department to mentor and support it.
        • Jan 1998: Nuffield Foundation funding application.
        • 1998: 4 months of full-time compilation of 5 years of notes - 1500 points of inspiration, 90,000 words.
        • Nov 1999: National Endowment for Science Technology and Arts (NESTA).
        • Spring 2001: 11 Literary Agents approached from short-listed from Writers & Artists Handbook.
        • Aug 2002: BBC Horizon Team contacted after they made a documentary on the Nature v Nature debate.
        • Aug 2002: reached out to a well-known, geneticist & broadcaster.
        • Nov 2002: 12 months, full-time development.
        • Jan 2002: Amnesty International – contacted policy development unit for mentoring assistance on the political level of the work..
        • June 2003: M.A in Philosophy application at KCL, suggested by department members, not possible.
        • Dec 2004: reached out to Royal Institution via their Chairperson who spoke on television about wanting to find the neural correlates of consciousness.
        • Jul 2004: Open Society Institute.
        • 2005: approached 14 Publishers in popular science arena including Time Warner, Vintage, Macmillan, Penguin, HarperCollins, Oxford University Press & Bloomsbury.
        • Feb 2006: The Royal Society, to publish e-paper with them.
        • 2006 to present – remain expatriated in France,
        • May 2010 & 14: reached out several times to the author of Consilience.
      Lessons learned: The cross-domain nature of the work has been the core obstacle to getting access to funding. The fact that I have been working in public and private sectors in minor, but sometimes managerial roles also doesn’t give me any profile on the academic radar. This was an issue in approaching leading thinkers, agents or publishers who mostly offered standard letters or ignored me. None of the above 'failures' to obtain assistance contained any substantive comments, reviews or opinions on the validity of the thesis.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you have got this far and think this is an important project, or important to people you know (perhaps working to assist those in difficulty), please share the page on your timelines or by pasting the page link in your emails. Thank you.

      There are buttons below that will make this process easier.

      been the key event that gave us our evolutionary advantage – the missing
      link that anthropologists have been searching for. When we look at
      the detail and formulate the constants of shared Appreciative State
      construction (between the Gene/cell and Understanding/brain)  - constants which are ‘fulfilled’ by variables of the level -
      we also start to see an organisational resonance at other levels; with
      other internal-external systems: in physiology, in social identity, in
      technology, in institutions, in law and policy, to nation states and
      higher. In that resonance, we also can see that failure to attain or
      maintain higher Appreciative States can result in collapses and ensuing
      power struggles between the higher and lower respective levels. The most prominent examples of this are
      disease, mental illness, social oppression, revolution and international
      conflicts. As a form of supportive evidence
      for the existence of Appreciative States (and our prior ignorance of
      them), we find ourselves observing a sort of domino effect.  With solutions
      to a significant number of debates tumbling in sequence. This constitutes a form of proof for the work and its core idea. This, plus the realisation that we can
      now see a substructure or pattern to human expression with the potential to put in order (realign) a number
      human domains that don't function correctly (see list), enables us to pull together the pieces of the
      historically difficult human nature and activity puzzle. The Appreciate
      State provides us with a common framework or surface upon which we can
      reliably compare and fit together domain edges, effectively giving us
      a bigger picture and a unifying theory of human expression. 

The parts of the puzzle that the full work will impact
on - either directly seen, implied by debates or even political correctness - are
as follows: 
The neural correlates of consciousness (a mechanism);
A theory of Intelligence (and AI);
The Nature v Nurture debate (the solution);

Why Homo sapiens are drawn to use Art, Philosophy, Science and/or Religion to create, stabilise and maintain understanding;
How Mental Health struggles develop, persist and can be reversed - the total framework promises sharper tools in human assistance fields;
The syntax in the construction of Language and why there are 6 constant questions in our language (who, what, when, where, why, how) whose answers are important in the formulation of ‘information’ and its assembly; 
The transmission process that is Education and that of Culture (definitions); 

The formation of social Identity (definition);

Oppression theory (clarity of the constituent elements involved in the '-isms');

Why certain phenomena are very important in our social fabric such as Respect, Free Speech, social justice and democratic process; 
A new framework theory for science in Politics; 
A workable framework, to measure and compare the political health of a nation. 




With all its promise, the work needs to be out in the public domain and examined. So my campaign is to get assistance to finalise this important work and publish it as a book.
  The magnitude of what contributors will help
achieve
As the implications of the work are
      simply enormous, since the start of the project 21 years ago I have
      always believed that there are hundreds or thousands of people whose
      paths I haven’t been able to cross and engage with,
      but who know precisely the importance it holds at the heart of it.  People that would readily offer
      support to the project (or person behind it); professionals or
      individuals who would benefit in their lives, and conscious, concerned citizens who want our
      political systems to have real rational policy integrity. An integrity that would abstract us,
      and function independently from the ideologies and political personality. 
If you are one of
      those people, you probably know that since the Renaissance period, it has
      been the aim of leading thinkers to bring together a coherent description
      of the relationship between the arts, sciences and humanities; to
      comprehend how social justice can be an integral part of political and
      rational economic aims. This
      relationship has however eluded us; and remained mysteriously hidden out
      of sight but continued to be a grail of for many wider-thinking academics.  If you are one of these people,
      this work is for you. Please help me with the means to achieve the final phase
      of the work, so I can then
      bring together the ends. 
On a personal note, enabling
      me to finish the work will set me free on so many levels. The ‘Eureka
      moment’ occurred in May of 1993 when I was in my early twenties. Bitten
      by something terrifyingly huge that I could not at all ignore or escape
      from, I knew it would take time, but couldn’t foresee how many times on
      my path I would put career possibilities, ambitions of having a family
      and material gains aside. 
I had hoped with each funding
      application or letter to people that could help with it (see attempts
      list below), something would give. Now in my mid-forties, 21 years on, I
      believe I have to stick my neck out, be more visible and ask for your
      indulgence. Crowd-source funding is the perfect and final opportunity to
      accomplish my aims.


What is Needed 
I need uninterrupted time to finish
      the work; to cover basic living expenses for 6 months. The period will
      allow me to distil around 160,000 words that I have at present down to a
      draft that I can get a professional editor to work on in the end/spring
      of 2015.  I work with wild
      solitary bee populations (especially the culture of mason bees), so when
      my first draft is being examined spring activities will step in to
      provide me with living expenses for the final editing phase. I aim to
      have an e-book ready for distribution to my Indiegogo supporters and
      interested parties in May 2015 – the 22nd anniversary of the
      discovery.

The advantages of helping me: at risk of sounding pompous, any sharers or supporter of this project will be
able to say that they were part of a key moment; being present to assist the
birth of this very important work. Those that contribute the sum whose perk
covers the e-book will get the inside track to a probable shift in the way we
regard human activity. It is entirely possible, though there is no guarantee,
that being the first among your family, friends and colleagues to clearly
comprehend this, could bring personal and professional advantages.Where the funds will go if I don't reach my goal: All funds will contribute to
      finishing the work and the e-books will be delivered to contributors
      whether on deadline or just after. A Twitter account (@AStateBook) is also set up to
      broadcast updates on developments. 

Anyone exceeding the e-book perk investment will automatically receive a copy. 
  The ImpactYou may believe or think my
      game-changing claims are impossible, but also want to be proven wrong.
      Know that - like all big ideas - there will be an inherent simplicity and
      beauty in what I am about to publish and you will certainly see this when you read the chapter dealing with Political level phenomena, even if at this point it is not
      that evident. Your contribution whether buying an ebook or telling your
      friends or colleagues to ‘check out this project where this bloke is
      making a massive set of claims on Indiegogo’, will be very much
      appreciated.


  Risks & ChallengesLet me first state that I have not had one single
      contradiction to the core Appreciative State thesis on all the years I have been working on it. I have constantly rechecked my
      assumptions, worked and compared it in the real world for alignment with
      surface behaviour and language, and constant confirmation reassures me of
      its accuracy and inherent beauty.

I may be overwhelmed by the
      scale of the task: Conscious of the enormity of the work, on a
      handful occasions I have been overwhelmed by what I often referred to
      ‘the hot and hairy monster’.  Too
      hot to get close to and too hairy (read scary) to contemplate.  I have taken unconscious breaks from
      the work usually because of such fears. However I am tenacious, if
      nothing else, and have kept coming back to it. There’s also been
      sometimes the ‘Who am I to be in possession of such a hugely important
      piece of work?’ question, but I am reminded that I made a relatively rare
      move from life sciences to the psychological and social arenas and that
      this cross-domain perspective, combined with my courage to pose some
      fundamental questions is what has gifted me this precious revelation.
      Support from a large number of people might initially also overwhelm me,
      but this positive experience would rapidly serve to bolster my
      concentrating and courage.

Someone will ‘publish’ before I
      do. This is a risk I have to take, but I have been living with this for years.  I have a long history of notes, documents
      and letters that show my involvement in the inception, history and
      vision. I just have to trust in providence and people’s decency to give
      me credit where it is due.



  Past Challenges
The best way to demonstrate my
      conviction and commitment would be to offer more information about my CV,
      the timeline and of my efforts to bring the work to the public
      domain.  



1991: BSc. in Biochemistry, King’s College
      London
1992 to 1998: Various social support work and
      counselling roles within alcohol & substance misuse, mental health,
      youth work and asylum seeker fields. 
May 1993: inspiration for project whilst
      comparing the rigour of life sciences with psychological social work
      interventions.
1995: PhD proposal drawn up - conversations
      with former tutors and peers suggested subject was was too cross
      disciplinary to find a department to mentor and support it. 
Jan 1998: Nuffield Foundation funding
      application. 
1998: 4 months of full-time compilation of
      5 years of notes - 1500 points of inspiration, 90,000 words.
Nov 1999: National Endowment for Science
      Technology and Arts (NESTA).
Spring 2001: 11 Literary Agents approached
      from short-listed from Writers & Artists Handbook.
Aug 2002: BBC Horizon Team contacted after
      they made a documentary on the Nature v Nature debate. 
Aug 2002: reached out to a well-known,
      geneticist & broadcaster.
Nov 2002: 12 months, full-time development.
Jan 2002: Amnesty International – contacted
      policy development unit for mentoring assistance on the political level
      of the work.. 
June 2003: M.A in Philosophy application at
      KCL, suggested by department members, not possible.
Dec 2004: reached out to Royal Institution
      via their Chairperson who spoke on television about wanting to find the neural
      correlates of consciousness. 
Jul 2004: Open Society Institute. 
2005: approached 14 Publishers in
      popular science arena including Time Warner, Vintage, Macmillan, Penguin,
      HarperCollins, Oxford University Press & Bloomsbury.
Feb 2006: The Royal Society, to publish
      e-paper with them. 
2006 to present – remain expatriated in France,
May 2010 & 14: reached out several times to the author of Consilience. 

Lessons learned: The
      cross-domain nature of the work has been the core obstacle to getting
      access to funding. The fact that I have been working in public and
      private sectors in minor, but sometimes managerial roles also doesn’t give me
      any profile on the academic radar. This was an issue in approaching leading
      thinkers, agents or publishers who mostly offered standard letters or ignored me. None of the above 'failures' to obtain assistance contained any substantive comments, reviews or opinions on the validity of
      the thesis.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you have got this far and think this is an important project, or
important to people you know (perhaps working to assist those in difficulty), please
share the page on your timelines or by pasting the page link in your emails. Thank you.
 There are buttons below that will make this
process easier.

story:
Short Summary

I have been daring myself to write a book since I was a child. In fact, it is on my bucket list. But I’ve been perplexed about what style of book to write since I admire many genres. My mind works in extremely imaginative ways, so fiction always seemed to be my best bet. Who would be my audience? What kind of story should I tell, realistic or fantasy? Although I pondered these questions, I was never able to determine their answers. When I began writing my blog for Pink Pantie Confessions, I tended toward anecdotes, insights, and poetry. After much consideration, I have decided this is as good a place as any to start my literary journey. In fact, this book will include some of my blog and Facebook status posts.  But most importantly I want to include you the fan into this book. From your writing to simply acknowledging your support. It's not just about me. I'm letting you know you are important to me.  This book is about US! You can change someone's life by how you treat them I want to tell the story about you, the everyday person that change the world one small act at a time.  

It is my hope that you and I will link together on this journey. My belief is that we are all, every one of us, interconnected through energy exchange. I feel your presence as I write these words. It should be overwhelming but it is not. I choose to perceive your laughter, tears and understanding.  I discern love and companionship in this intimate conversation.  So help me bring the "hot pink" back into blue.


What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise $10,000 to publish and promote the book .  You contributions will go toward the following:

I expect to ship rewards to backers by the last week of November 2015. Here's the estimated timeline...

Early-September: Finish writing final draft.

Early-September - Book cover design

Late-September: Editing and typesetting of manuscript finished, sent to printer

Early-October: Backer names published on website thank-you page (optional)

Late-October: Digital editions sent to backers

Mid - November: Printing done; start shipping signed-copies

Late-November: Meet and Greet backers at book Launch VIP PARTY

Early-November: Copyright and Trademarks secured for Pink Panty Brand

If I don't reach the entire goal, here's what will happen at different levels of funding:

$6001-$9000: Costs to Publish Pink Panty Confessions Book and cover legal and filing fees for trademarking the Pink Panty Confessions Brand for product development

$3001-$6000: Costs to cover book production on editing, typesetting, proofing, and cover design in order to publish Pink Panty Confessions

$2500- $3000: Costs to cover my time dedicated solely to writing Pink Panty Confessions

$500-$1000: In this unlikely event, I’ll keep the campaign running for a longer period, until one of the above funding brackets is reached.

Why Write A Book

I want to inspire, enlighten, and relate to my fans and supporters by creating a product line that will begin with this book.  This is a movement to me, not just a singular project. Together we can change the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you really can't contribute, you can still help:

Help me get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for your support!

Cynda

story:
Story of My Book

Sanctuary is a collection of poetry about healing and reflection that focuses on how trauma shapes perspective, whether it be of love, religion, sex, and other themes.

My name is Shayla Herron and I am the author of Sanctuary. This book is a testament that I am not defined by my traumatic experiences, and that sharing these experiences is not only critical to my healing process but everyone who reads this book and is healing. Writing this book helped me from harboring my pain and my thoughts, transcending my perspective of life from being to end. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what you may need to reflect on within your life, whether it has to do with healing or simply making a decision.

I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with your traumas, your self-identity, how the world truly affects you; escaping from the rat race to learn from the experiences and perspectives I share about the importance of healing and reflecting so, you may move forward with whatever you need to. This book is interactive and will feature a page at the end of each section to reflect on what was read.


In this book, you’ll join me in exploring the intersections between Trauma and Expression, Religion and Resentment, Loss and Healing, and more, all prompting reflection through poems like:

“When I Learned About Gender” — This piece depicts the revelation of gender and its roles as a traumatic experience that shaped my views on sexuality and would later bring me to a moment of healing and reflection, which is the premise of this book.

“Sorry Will Never Be Enough” — This piece is a reflection on the pain we may cause other people that eventually causes us to empathize with their healing process.

“Intercourse Is” — This piece expels religious beliefs of sexual purity and gives homage to the natural beauty and importance of intercourse.

You will love this book if you firstly, love reading poetry. Secondly, if you feel the themes of this book, such as healing, love, reflection, religion, or trauma intrigue you. Lastly, if you assistance in moving forward to tell your stories.

Sanctuary speaks to young adults and anyone who want to grapple with Perspective and Trauma in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Sanctuary inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

What are my traumas and how do they affect my perspective of the world around me?

Has my reaction to my traumas ever affected how I communicate with my coworkers, family or friends?

Are there enough resources on social media that would help someone realize their traumas and move them to choose to heal and become a better individual for themselves?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing healing,perspective, reflection, and trauma will change us all for the better.

The Book - Sanctuary

Aside from the author’s note, which gives a brief description of my journey as a growing writer; the book is written in 10 parts.

Part 1, entitled "At the Altar" contains poems about the emotional, mental, and physical traumas I encountered that caused me the most pain, held me back in relationships and disabled me from doing any reflecting.

Part 2, entitled "Like A Lotus" can be read as one part with Part 3, entitled "Love Is..." and Part 4, entitled "Letting Go?". These parts can be read as one because they focus on how I experienced love and heartbreak after overcoming the mental barriers of my traumas.

Part 5, entitled "Un(de)r (Press)ure" focuses on the theme of depression and trauma, and can be read as one with Part 6, entitled "Point of View", which contains poems on various topics such as how the gentrification of my hometown affected me, the LBGTQ+ community and its influence on me, why it is essential to take breaks from social media, sins or what is perceived as such, and much more.

Part 7, entitled "religion reMASTERed" can be read as one with Part 8, "The Purge", and Part 9, "The F Word", pays homage to what helped me the most during my healing process, religion and therapy; accompanied by what I discovered and the recollection of memories I found it hard to remember that shaped who I was. This is all about how I learned to be strong, believing in the power of forgiveness.

Part 10, entitled "The Benediction" contains poems about all the things I want to remember after overcoming the themes in the aforementioned parts. These are lessons I have learned and I  describe how I should live moving forward.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor and I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Shayla Herron is an undergraduate senior at Bowie State University. Upon graduation, she will be attending graduate school to study counseling in hopes to heal people in the same way she believes this book will do so.

She believes that poetry should communicate experiences in way that could provide clarity and personal salvation.

In her spare time, Shayla loves to sing, paint, watch anime, and spend time with her family. One hobby that she hopes to take on in the future is beekeeping. She wants to learn about the healing properties of honey by closely studying bees herself and eventually start a business and market it as a “healing honey”.

For more information, you can connect with Shayla Herron at ShaylaHerron99@gmail.com and @missshaylanicole on Instagram and Shayla Herron on Facebook and LinkedIn.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #PoeticSanctuary and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Shayla Herron

story:
Campaign extended at:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/making-your-...

Story of My Book

Making Your Path is about approaching the professional world from a philosophical lens. I’ve spoken to a variety of path blazers and opportunity creators and discovered what truly drives them, in order to determine how we can apply these same truths on our professional paths.

My name is Jacob Mass and I am the author of Making Your Path. I wrote this book because I’m a young professional entering the workforce, and I wasn’t satisfied with the existing professional content. So much of it is focused purely on success and ambition. I wanted to understand the heart of it, the driving philosophies behind these great professionals.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover new ways to think about your career and the way that you approach it, no matter what stage you’re in. I’ve boiled down many of the overarching truths that different professionals have come across and how these truths have impacted their drive for happiness. Ultimately, I want you to gain this wisdom that I’ve documented by speaking to these various professionals and use it as a tool to steer your own path more deliberately, and shape your professional life how you want.

In this book, you'll learn about some of the key forces behind the minds of great makers, including the Pursuit of Knowledge and Uniqueness. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Bob Greenberg, one of the first 11 Microsoft employees, who only stayed for a few years before taking off on his own professional path full of ups and downs.
  • Ralph Baer, the Father of Video Games, who was originally an electrical engineer at a defense company before he took his own initiative of heading an entirely new project that would become the first video game console.
  • John Park, a professional maker and content creator whose career has incorporated dozens of different skill sets over multiple decades, with each new opportunity being built from the last one’s experience.

You will love this book if you value taking a deeper look at how you’re crafting your life, and in particular, your career. You will love this book if you want to better understand yourself and the world around you through the ideals of great makers. You will love this book if you’re someone who enjoys your profession and wants to dive even deeper from a place of meaning.

Making Your Path is a nonfiction book that speaks to current and future makers, innovators, inventors, entrepreneurs, engineers, designers, and many more who want to learn to harness the driving philosophies of the professional world.

The Book - Making Your Path

The book is written in 3 parts:

Part 1 focuses on framing the book and discussing relevant concepts to approaching this book such as reassigning meaning to buzzwords and cliches.

Part 2 serves as the main bulk of the book in which each chapter features an overall driving philosophy and how it has played a role in the lives of different makers. Examples of these driving philosophies are the Pursuit of Knowledge and Uniqueness.

Part 3 revisits each driving philosophy and how you can harness them in your own career. It discusses how to move forward in making your path.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Jacob Mass is an undergraduate student at the University of Florida. He is pursuing a degree in Digital Arts and Sciences, as well as a minor in Percussion Performance and a certificate in Graphic Design. He also works with the UF Engineering Innovation Institute.

As a young professional preparing to enter the workforce, Jacob became curious about the human, personal side of the professional world. He didn’t see enough of a focus on it, so he decided to research it himself, speaking with dozens of professionals from different backgrounds. He hopes to share the insights he gained from this journey with others.

Jacob was originally born in Montville, New Jersey and now lives in Parkland, Florida with his family and Lucy the puppy. He enjoys gardening and the occasional Zumba class. He’s slowly learning to cook, and he looks forward to long car rides so he can loudly sing along to his music.

For more information, you can connect with Jacob at jjmass721@gmail.com and on Instagram (@jacobmasscreative), Facebook, and LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #MakingYourPath and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jacob Mass

story:
Raising the Minimum Wage

15 Now is a nationwide movement to raise the minimum wage for all workers. Seattle won $15 this past summer, San Francisco is voting to raise their minimum wage to $15 this November, and fast food workers around the country are engaging in strikes and walkouts to demand $15/hr from the multi-billion dollar companies they work for. 

The need for a $15 minimum wage is just as vital in Oregon as it is elsewhere. Inflation in Oregon was almost 3% during 2013, double the national rate. Last year Portland saw the cost of rent increase by 4.5%, and the cost of eating out at restaurants increased by over 6%. According to studies by both the National Low Income Housing Coalition and the Alliance for a Just Society a living wage for a single worker in Oregon, enough to pay their bills and plan ahead for emergencies, is around $16/hr.  Meanwhile, almost 90% of the income gains in Oregon since 1979 have gone to the top 1%. But it doesn't have to be that way.

The only reason companies make money is because workers produce things that people buy. It is the labor of the working class produces the trillions of dollars that make up our country's Gross Domestic Product. If we took all the workers out of McDonald's restaurants how much money would the company make? None. Big business can afford to pay a living wage. It is time workers in Oregon got their fair share of the wealth they create!

What We Need

This is our first big fundraising effort! In order to effectively run a campaign to raise the minimum wage throughout Oregon we need resources! In order to keep this a grassroots working class fight, we need raise money from working people to help win better material conditions for the working class. In Seattle, 15 Now spent over $150,000 to wind a $15 minimum wage. It will take even more to win for the whole state of Oregon.

A portion of the money raised here will go to the 15 Now national organization to help build the movement to raise the minimum wage across the country. Most of the money will be used here on the ground in Oregon. Banners, signs, printing flyers, food and space for meetings, phone calls and texts, brochures, travel and materials to help build new 15 Now chapters throughout the state, and many, many hours for canvassing and making follow up phone calls all cost money and time. Much of this money has been coming out of the pockets of dedicated volunteers. And as we're currently growing exponentially as we form new 15 Now chapters across the state of Oregon, our costs are growing exponentially as well!

Your donation will allow us to spend more time in the field running community trainings and gathering stories from workers. It will allow us to provide "Raise the Minimum Wage" t-shirts to folks who can't afford them.  It will allow us to send workers to 15 Now national trainings and workshops to meet other involved low-wage workers. It will allow us to blanket our cities with 15 Now signs, posters, banners, and stickers! It will expand our ability to provide consistent meeting spaces and remain in contact with workers and volunteers across the state via more sophisticated means of communication. 

    Risks & Challenges

    We face many obstacles in our work to raise the standard of living for Oregon's working class. In Seattle, Big Business fought tooth and nail trying to prevent a $15 minimum wage. Those who make their money off the labor of others are willing to use their unlimited political clout and unimaginable monetary resources they have to lobby our public officials and beat back any attempt by working class people to fight for higher wages. As we grow, we know they'll spend hundreds of thousands of dollars to send lobbyists to influence our public officials, run radio ads and put up billboards to promulgate ugly myths about the effects of raising wages.

    In addition, working people have been systematically disenfranchised and disempowered for decades. It takes time, energy, and dedication to prepare people to fight back against managers and business owners who use intimidation and discouragement to prevent workers from fighting for better wages and working conditions. But working people have pressing financial commitments and time limitations to navigate as they engage in political struggle. Political movements are not instantaneous-- they take training, empowerment and dedication from everyone involved.  

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We are trying to fight poverty, so of course we understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute money to the Fight for $15 in Oregon. But contributing time and energy is just as important, maybe even more so!

      Other ways you can help win a $15 minimum wage in Oregon include

      • Come to our 15 Now PDX planning meetings and events.
      • Volunteer to help us canvass, table, or phone bank.
      • Sign our statewide petition! http://petitions.moveon.org/sign/raise-oregons-minimum.fb50?source=s.fb&r_by=1135365
      • Help start a 15 Now chapter or action group in your town, at your school, or in your place workplace. We currently have chapters beginning to form in Beaverton, The Dalles, Medford, Eugene, and Clark County, and we need many more all over the state to win $15 for all Oregon workers.
      • Share our fundraising campaign on twitter, facebook, or write an email to your family and friends.
      Email info@15nowpdx.org to get plugged in and involved.
