story:
Our Story

Six years ago I was once just another blind person walking through the days in complete darkness. The darkness was my unconscious way of being. I had no direction in a life that I felt would ever make me truly happy. I was alone with my thoughts and my thoughts were full of negative judgments on the world around me.

One day I ended up meeting my son, he was 6 at the time and we talked for about 20 minutes. At that time, if you would have told me that in 7 months I would run into him again and that would be the beginning of my new family, I would have laughed, but it’s funny how life plays out. Was I ready to become a parent? Whoever is? Did I know what I was getting myself into? Not a clue. I was unaware of the preconceived ideas that were placed on step-parents. Correction, I knew of them, but I didn’t know that they were just that, preconceived concepts. I took them for reality. The thoughts of “my kids will never love me, I will never be a real parent, I am not worthy, my kids will hate me no matter what” ran rampant in my daily life. Those thoughts kept me in a box of unconscious thinking until one day, by pure chance; I stumbled out of that box and into a light.

With the number of stepfamilies rising to about half of the US families, it is pertinent that we make sure that all involved have the tools and understanding they need to be the most successful parent possible. This also means understanding yourself as well.

The book entitled “To Raise a Stepfather” was finished and then edited this year. The book is a compelling journey of a man that finds the path to enlightenment and awareness in the most unlikely place, the role of stepfather. It’s a guide to becoming the healer for not only others, but yourself as well through teachings that parallel the direction of some of the world’s top spiritual leaders. You will learn to save worlds as you are escorted to the path of finding your inner light, the path to your true self.

https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/To-Raise-A-St...

The next step for the book is to publish it. A division of Hay House Publishing has offered to bring me into their self-publishing section as a first time author. For almost all first time authors, self-publishing is the only way to get their book out to the audience. I am looking to raise the money for the publishing package that has been offered by the company.

The dream is to have the book “To Raise a Stepfather” out to the world so it can help everyone, whether involved in stepfamilies or not. After publishing, I plan to start workshops that surround enlightened parenting, finding true self, overcoming egoic thinking, and how to change the world for the better with everyday actions.


The Impact

Today, 1 out of 2 marriages ends in divorce. 60% of second marriages fail, according to the U.S. Census Bureau, and according to Stepfamily Foundation statistics, 66% of mariages and living together situations end in break up when children are actively involved. About 50% of children in the U.S. end up going through a divorce before they are 18 and it is estimated that more Americans are living in stepfamilies than in nuclear families.

With the number of stepfamilies rising it is pertinent that we make sure that all involved have the tools and understanding they need to not only be the most successful parent possible, but to also be the most enlightened people they can be so as to make clear and untainted choices in their parenting.

The truth be told, I wish I had someone there to walk me through all of the emotions I didn’t foresee. I wish there was a guild from the start to get through all the negative and preconceived ideas surrounding step-parenting so I could have seen the reality of things. It would have made it much smoother on me and my family.

I feel, as well as many others who have had a chance to read through it, that this book will help usher in a new wave of enlightened parenting. We NEED to start creating stepfamilies that heal the world instead of making it harder on the children involved. That is the goal of the book.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise the money to properly self-publish and market “To Raise a Stepfather”. The amount for the publishing package is $7999.00. This pays for the complete publishing of the book which includes exterior and interior design work, final formating, final editing, printing, distribution to 25,000 retailers worldwide, E-book formatting and distribution, sold on Amazon.com and Barnes&Noble.com as well as in Barnes & Noble stores, Author website setup, marketing tools and help, and much, much more.

Anything raised above that price will go straight toward marketing the book. If all the funds are NOT raised then I will start the process anyways to get the ball rolling with the publishing. I can break down the products offered by the publishing company and pay for them individually as I go. The cost of it is higher when done that way.

This is not a call for donations - everyone who contributes over $20 will get a copy of the E-book in PDF form as soon as it's published. For $50, I'll send a paper back copy to you, wherever you are in the world. For $80, it will be a signed paper back copy. And anyone who pledges over $100 will get a signed hard cover copy and have their name included in the honors list on the book/author website. Pledges over $250 will not only get the signed hard cover copy and have their name included in the honors list on the website, but they will also receive 4 free passes to attend as VIPs at any workshops put on by the author.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am grateful for any help you can give us in spreading the word about the book.

story_txt:
Our Story
Six years ago I was once just another blind person walking through the days in complete darkness. The darkness was my unconscious way of being. I had no direction in a life that I felt would ever make me truly happy. I was alone with my thoughts and my thoughts were full of negative judgments on the world around me.
One day I ended up meeting my son, he was 6 at the time and we talked for about 20 minutes. At that time, if you would have told me that in 7 months I would run into him again and that would be the beginning of my new family, I would have laughed, but it’s funny how life plays out. Was I ready to become a parent? Whoever is? Did I know what I was getting myself into? Not a clue. I was unaware of the preconceived ideas that were placed on step-parents. Correction, I knew of them, but I didn’t know that they were just that, preconceived concepts. I took them for reality. The thoughts of “my kids will never love me, I will never be a real parent, I am not worthy, my kids will hate me no matter what” ran rampant in my daily life. Those thoughts kept me in a box of unconscious thinking until one day, by pure chance; I stumbled out of that box and into a light. 
With the number of stepfamilies rising to about half of the US families, it is pertinent that we make sure that all involved have the tools and understanding they need to be the most successful parent possible. This also means understanding yourself as well.
The book entitled “To Raise a Stepfather” was finished and then edited this year. The book is a compelling journey of a man that finds the path to enlightenment and awareness in the most unlikely place, the role of stepfather. It’s a guide to becoming the healer for not only others, but yourself as well through teachings that parallel the direction of some of the world’s top spiritual leaders. You will learn to save worlds as you are escorted to the path of finding your inner light, the path to your true self. 
https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/To-Raise-A-St... 
The next step for the book is to publish it. A division of Hay House Publishing has offered to bring me into their self-publishing section as a first time author. For almost all first time authors, self-publishing is the only way to get their book out to the audience. I am looking to raise the money for the publishing package that has been offered by the company.
The dream is to have the book “To Raise a Stepfather” out to the world so it can help everyone, whether involved in stepfamilies or not. After publishing, I plan to start workshops that surround enlightened parenting, finding true self, overcoming egoic thinking, and how to change the world for the better with everyday actions.



The Impact
Today, 1 out of 2 marriages ends in divorce. 60% of second marriages fail, according to the U.S. Census Bureau, and according to Stepfamily Foundation statistics, 66% of mariages and living together situations end in break up when children are actively involved. About 50% of children in the U.S. end up going through a divorce before they are 18 and it is estimated that more Americans are living in stepfamilies than in nuclear families.
With the number of stepfamilies rising it is pertinent that we make sure that all involved have the tools and understanding they need to not only be the most successful parent possible, but to also be the most enlightened people they can be so as to make clear and untainted choices in their parenting. 
The truth be told, I wish I had someone there to walk me through all of the emotions I didn’t foresee. I wish there was a guild from the start to get through all the negative and preconceived ideas surrounding step-parenting so I could have seen the reality of things. It would have made it much smoother on me and my family. 
I feel, as well as many others who have had a chance to read through it, that this book will help usher in a new wave of enlightened parenting. We NEED to start creating stepfamilies that heal the world instead of making it harder on the children involved. That is the goal of the book.


What We Need & What You Get
I need to raise the money to properly self-publish and market “To Raise a Stepfather”. The amount for the publishing package is $7999.00. This pays for the complete publishing of the book which includes exterior and interior design work, final formating, final editing, printing, distribution to 25,000 retailers worldwide, E-book formatting and distribution, sold on Amazon.com and Barnes&Noble.com as well as in Barnes & Noble stores, Author website setup, marketing tools and help, and much, much more.
Anything raised above that price will go straight toward marketing the book. If all the funds are NOT raised then I will start the process anyways to get the ball rolling with the publishing. I can break down the products offered by the publishing company and pay for them individually as I go. The cost of it is higher when done that way.
This is not a call for donations - everyone who contributes over $20 will get a copy of the E-book in PDF form as soon as it's published. For $50, I'll send a paper back copy to you, wherever you are in the world. For $80, it will be a signed paper back copy. And anyone who pledges over $100 will get a signed hard cover copy and have their name included in the honors list on the book/author website. Pledges over $250 will not only get the signed hard cover copy and have their name included in the honors list on the website, but they will also receive 4 free passes to attend as VIPs at any workshops put on by the author.
 
 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
I am grateful for any help you can give us in spreading the word about the book.
Here are some suggestions, in case they are relevant:

Post a link to this page on your Facebook or Twitter; the more this gets posted the better the chances of the book being fully published.
Go to https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/To-Raise-A-St... and like the Books Page  
Write a post about the book “To Raise a Stepfather” on your blog;
Give us a mention in your organization’s newsletter.

I am also available for interviews about the book and the project. You can contact me (about that or anything else) by posting a message here, or by emailing enlightened-parenting@comcast.net

story:
"It is in truth not for glory, nor riches, nor honours that we are fighting, but for freedom – for that alone, which no honest man gives up but with life itself.​"

The History

The Declaration of Arbroath, also known as the Declaration of Scottish Independence, was a diplomatic letter from the Scots to the Pope in 1320, calling for Scotland to be recognised as an independent kingdom against English claims of overlordship.  It is thought to be one of the earliest written arguments for popular sovereignty and one of the most significant statements of nationhood in Europe.

The Declaration is one of the primary foundation stones of Scottish identity, but its influence is international - the text is believed, for example, to be one of the inspirations behind America's own Declaration of Independence. In 2016 the Declaration was also awarded 'Memory of the World' status by UNESCO World Heritage.

The Book

The Illustrated Declaration of Arbroath will offer a unique, artistic and visually striking interpretation of this 700-year-old artefact in a way which is fit for the 21st century. It will bring the artefact to life, highlighting its cultural significance as well as its contemporary relevance. It will examine ideas of community and people-power, and ask what 'freedom' means in today's world.

The book will be published by the Saltire Society, one of Scotland's leading cultural bodies. The finished product will be a well-designed hardback book mixing text and illustrations.

 

The Money

I'm looking to raise funds to contribute towards the following:

  • Materials and labour for the creative work (paper, ink, time spent on writing and drawing)
  • Occasional research trips to Arbroath (meeting partners, studying library archives)
  • The cost of printing the final book
  • Promotional materials to raise awareness (leaflets, posters)
  • Short promotional film (for use on social media and for screening at events)

Supporters who donate £20 can claim a finished book from the 'perks'. Please note the £20 is part of the fundraising drive and the final book may eventually be on sale for less.

Supporters who donate £50 can 'Sign the Declaration', meaning their names will be printed in the final book's acknowledgements. As well as being thanked in print these supporters will also receive a signed copy of the book.

The Legacy

The intention of the project is to establish a broader understanding of the Declaration of Arbroath outside of academia. The book and corresponding artwork will expose aspects of Scottish history which I hope people will find new and interesting. This project has an educational and awareness-raising element rather than being solely artistic. It will demonstrate how the early ideas and principals of the Declaration shaped Scotland, and why it still matters in the modern world.

About the Artist

My name is Andrew Redmond Barr and I'm a writer and illustrator with an interest in Scottish history and literature. I have experience in producing books, promoting Scottish culture and creating illustrated exhibitions.

  • In 2011 I was one of the co-founders of the arts campaign National Collective.
  • In 2016 I released my first book, Summer of Independence: Stories from a Nation in the Making (Word Power Books), a grassroots account of the 2014 independence referendum which featured in The Scottish Review of Books’ Picks of 2016.
  • In 2018 I held a solo art exhibition, ‘Pith & Power’, at the Saltire Society in Edinburgh exploring Robert Burns’ relationship with politics and power.

"The writer has a keen sense of power dynamics, history and literature, but more importantly he has imagination and talent. We can have faith in Scotland’s future with young writers like this." – Meaghan Delahunt

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to support this project but can't donate, I'd appreciate your help in getting the word out. Please consider sharing the link with your networks, and follow me on social media for updates:

Facebook: Barr's Books & Pictures

Twitter: @AndrewRBarr

Website: AndrewRBarr.com

Contact me: AndrewRBarr.com/Contact

story:
Our Story

Based in Ypsilanti, Toronto, Brooklyn, Champaign-Urbana and Dallas-Fort Worth, The Cultural Gutter was founded in 2003 by writer, filmmaker and game designer Jim Munroe and comics critic and artist Guy Leshinski to provide clear-eyed, thoughtful writing on disreputable art. Since then, we've had twelve editors in two countries and eight cities write on comics, genre films, Indian b-movies, tv, science fiction, fantasy, horror, romance and video games. In all that time we paid our writers, both our editors and guest stars. Then we lost our funding grant, but a small, rag-tag band of donors joined forces with the Gutter to keep us online and help us keep our commitment to paying writers for their work. Thus, the Gutterthon was born. And thanks to our readers like you, the Cultural Gutter has been sustained without ads, subscriptions or a paywall.

At the Gutter we like to think we offer something special and we're kind of proud of it. The Gutter features thoughtful, well-written articles on topics like: American Sci Fi Folk horror; Bollywood villain lairs; Doom Patrol and what it means to save the world; letting something you love reboot; romance and the belief that people can change; Janelle Monáe as the American cool; Ancient Egypt in Indian film; Candyman and "thesis goggles"; "Tilda Swinton: Secret Scottish Samurai"; Duran Duran & William S. Burroughs' Wild Boys; and so much Adventure Time. So please click "Back It" and keep the Gutter flowing with the writing you love. Even if you can only throw in a buck, we will thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

We are asking for $1700 and it breaks down to $250/year/writer or about $20/article; $250/year for the Evil Overlord for publishing, promoting, and updating the site, finding new writers, day-to-day site management, making sure the perks are shipped out, and continuing work on The Cultural Gutter Must Be Destroyed, a collection of essays from the Gutter's current line-up. Approximately $200 will go towards website hosting and domain registration. The remaining funds will go toward perks, shipping, promotional materials, Indiegogo and Paypal fees, and paying guest writers.

In return, you get our undying and eternal thanks and your choice of some sweet perks. And, hopefully, writing that entertains and interests you.

Perks Include:

This year mystery is afoot! Carry your knitting, cozy mysteries and a thermos full of hot tea in your Murder at the Gutterthon tote featuring this year's art designed by Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Company! Pull out your magnifiying glass and carefully examine the crime scene and gathered suspects in this year's 12 x 18" / 30.5 x 46 cm Murder at the Gutterthon poster! Enjoy a hot toddy in your Murder at the Gutterthon mug as you recount the chilling events to renowned detective Hercule Squalo!

A Cultural Gutter Membership package including a numbered and dated CG Membership Card and a decryption key for decoding the CG Secret Messages posted at the top of the Sponsors Page. Or use the code to write other Guttersnipes your own secret message.

A print copy of Cocktails & Capers: Cult Films, Crime, Cocktails and Cool by the Gutter's own Keith Allison! "Explore a world populated by masked marvels and murderous maniacs, venomous vamps and gentleman thieves, swingin' spies and cantankerous crooners. Cocktails & Capers collects essays covering cinematic, pop culture, true crime, and cocktail history, including: Sweet Smell of Success and the nightclubs of Swing Street; A.J. Raffles, gentleman thief; Louis Feuillade's Fantomas and Les Vampires; the history of the Martini; Diabolik, Kriminal, and the skeleton suit-clad maniacs of Italy and Turkey; James Bond, amari, negronis, and how Ian Fleming and Lucky Luciano saved the Allied invasion of Sicily; the history of masked Mexican wrestlers and the partnership of El Santo and Blue Demon; and the weird, wild world of the Rat Pack in the 1960s and how the grim, violent Matt Helm novels became slapstick spy spoofs starring Dean Martin. These are tales of mobsters, movie stars, masked men, torch singers, crooners, and hustlers--with dozens of cocktail recipes and music suggestions that pair perfectly."

Our friends at Fox Spirit Books have donated digital copies of two titles to Murder at the Gutterthon:

These Foolish & Harmful Delights by the British Fantasy Award-nominated author Cate Gardner is a collection of dark tales sure to delight your evil little heart! "A Punch and Judy escape from a hell of discarded body parts and captive puppets. A girl escapes her birdcage through a mirror where a Perfume Thief lies waiting. A boy with a lost heart, a girl with a stopped heart, and Ghoate, the man who collects hearts."

Hire Idiots by Professor I. M. Nemo concerns murder most foul... or  murder most inconvenient... at a prestigious university. "'This is a work of fiction. Any resemblance to the living or the dead is purely coincidental and ought to make you ashamed at the comparison.’

PROMINENT PROFESSOR STABBED TO DEATH AT KINGSLEY COLLEGE. 

Unfortunately, the murder may get lost in the confusion of new vice presidents, marketers, focus groups, assessors and protestors as the administration tries to make education profitable. There’s no time for mystery! Professor Clarence Van Dyke finds himself bewildered by the changes, but determined to get to the bottom of the killing. He wants his friend to rest in peace--or perhaps he just wants to spend more time with the attractive Detective Riordan. But isn’t he the primary suspect?"

A Medusa Moleskine handprinted by the Gutter's own Carol! A light brown 3.5 x 5.5" pocket Moleskine with a light green Medusa handprinted on the cover. Guaranteed 100% non-petrifying! Declared "quality items. KWALITAY" by author Chlöe Yates!

NEW PERK: Suss out the suspects and weapons AND carry around your books or groceries in this 15.75 x 15.25" / 40 x 38.7 cm "Suspects and Weapons" natural canvas tote bag! OR suss them out on a mug full of hot cider, tea, cocoa or a restorative Irish coffee! Both feature art by Brian Kirby of Shelflife Clothing Co.

NEW PERK: Musician, scholar, raconteur and friend of the Gutter Kate Laity will create a custom theremin song just for you! Provide her with a few adjectives as prompts and soon you theremin ringtone/alarm/just something nice to listen to dreams will come true!

NEW PERK: Squalo-Ade Essentials! Our friends at MPZ Cosmetics salute renowned detective Hercule Squalo with a set of 3 cherry lemonade-scented essentials:  a  2 oz hand sanitizer, 1 oz spray lotion and a 4g lip balm. The lip balm does contain beeswax. The hand sanitizer smells nice and has a nice consistency. This perk is available in the continental US only because of US postal restrictions on shipping products like hand sanitizer.

SOLD OUT: Purple fingerless mittens with cranberry trim made and donated by Huge Shark. Keep your hands warm while getting up to any one of the hundreds of shenanigans that require your fingers. One pair is available, size large. Modeled on medium adult hands. They are 100% merino wool, pre-washed. Machine wash and lay flat to dry. Made in a house with cats.

SOLD OUT: Huge Shark has also made and donated a "3D” textured purple and grey hat and fingerless mittens set. 100% wool. The hat is stretchy and will fit small to large size. The mitts fit small-medium hands. Items are washed before sending, but created in a house with cats. Hand wash, lay flat to dry. They look kind of like a cool dungeon wall to us.

SOLD OUT: A 5-pack of "Monsterland, Ogasawara Island" postcards designed by friend of the Gutter Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Company! Let loved ones know you wish they were there as you tour "The Bonin Islands, also known as the Ogasawara Islands...an archipelago of over 30 subtropical and tropical islands some 520 mi directly south of Tokyo, Japan. Since 1999, all of the Earth's monsters have been collected and confined there in an area known as Monsterland."

SOLD OUT: Friend of the Gutter Mark D. White has donated a signed copy of his book, Batman & Ethics! Explore the ethical code of the world's greatest detective, Batman! And maybe learn something about philosophy. "Batman and Ethics goes behind the mask to shed new light on the complexities and contradictions of the Dark Knight’s moral code. From the logic behind his aversion to killing to the moral status of vigilantism and his use of torture in pursuit of justice (or perhaps revenge), Batman’s ethical precepts are compelling but often inconsistent and controversial. Philosopher and pop culture expert Mark D. White uses the tools of moral philosophy to track Batman’s most striking ethical dilemmas and decisions across his most prominent storylines from the early 1970s through the launch of the New 52, and suggests how understanding the mercurial moral character of the caped crusader might help us reconcile our own."

SOLD OUT: Hey, is that Bruce?! Is that Signor Squalo from L'Ultimo Squalo himself? Regardless, you can be the forever home for this 6 in / 15.24 cm needle-felted great white shark made by friend of the Gutter, Kerry Fristoe!

SOLD OUT: A swank Cinema Detroit t-shirts from our friends at Cinema Detroit. Show your support for the only truly independent movie theater in the metro Detroit area and look good doing it! Only one shirt available and shipping is US only. Sizes are: Women’s/Curvy M-XXL and Unisex M-XXXL

SOLD OUT: A digital copy of Dracula In Istanbul, aka, "Turkish Dracula," edited by Neon Harbor's Ed Glaser. "For the first time in English comes a remarkable literary discovery. In 1928, Turkish author Ali Rıza Seyfioğlu pirated Bram Stoker’s Dracula, rewriting it with new material, patriotic overtones, and Islam. A rare example of a 'bootleg' novel, it’s also the first adaptation to plainly identify Dracula as the historical warlord Vlad the Impaler."

SOLD OUT: Have a noggin filled with spooky thoughts? Proud of your endoskeletal cranium? Show off either or both this with a black wool beanie / watch cap with a skull pattern in light green or a grey wool beanie with a yellow skull pattern made and donated by Huge Shark! They are alpaca with merino wool skulls. Made in a house co-habited by cats, but washed before shipping. They'll fit a small to medium adult head.

We will be unlocking more perks as the campaign continues, but even $1 gets our Undying Thanks! (Really, a buck does make a difference).

If we don't reach our goal, we'll use the funds to print and ship your perks and see how much we can pay each editor. If we exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to print promotional materials or hire more guest writers. If we significantly exceed our goal, we will use our funds to give the writers some extra money.

 

The Impact

We like to think that the Gutter offers something special: Clear-eyed, thoughtful and thought-provoking writing on disreputable art. If you donate or support our campaign by sharing it, you will help keep the Gutter online and running; support our particular take on disreputable art; and help support paying writers for their work.

We ran a successful last fundraiser year, and, thanks to everyone's help, we kept the Gutter going and have been working on making the new Gutter as good as can be. The Cultural Gutter's survival depends on Gutterthon and on you. We know it's a bad time for creators of all kinds, that platforms are valued more than content, but we believe with your help we can keep the Gutter flowing with thoughtful writing on disreputable art. 

We know that it's a hard and stressful time for everyone. But even a retweet or sharing our campaign on Facebook helps us out. Indiegogo has tools that make it easy. Please consider using them even if you can't contribute. Anything you do to help is appreciated.

Thank you from all of us at The Cultural Gutter!

Our friends at MPZ Cosmetics salute renowned detective Hercule Squalo with a set of 3 cherry lemonade-scented essentials:  a  2 oz hand sanitizer, 1 oz spray lotion and a 4g lip balm. The lip balm does contain beeswax. The hand sanitizer smells nice and has a nice consistency. This perk is available in the continental US only because of US postal restrictions on shipping products like hand sanitizer.
SOLD OUT: Purple fingerless mittens with cranberry trim made and donated by Huge Shark. Keep your hands warm while getting up to any one of the hundreds of shenanigans that require your fingers. One pair is available, size large. Modeled on medium adult hands. They are 100% merino wool, pre-washed. Machine wash and lay flat to dry. Made in a house with cats.
SOLD OUT: Huge Shark has also made and donated a "3D” textured purple and grey hat and fingerless mittens set. 100% wool. The hat is stretchy and will fit small to large size. The mitts fit small-medium hands. Items are washed before sending, but created in a house with cats. Hand wash, lay flat to dry. They look kind of like a cool dungeon wall to us.
SOLD OUT: A 5-pack of "Monsterland, Ogasawara Island" postcards designed by friend of the Gutter Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Company! Let loved ones know you wish they were there as you tour "The Bonin Islands, also known as the Ogasawara Islands...an archipelago of over 30 subtropical and tropical islands some 520 mi directly south of Tokyo, Japan. Since 1999, all of the Earth's monsters have been collected and confined there in an area known as Monsterland."
SOLD OUT: Friend of the Gutter Mark D. White has donated a signed copy of his book, Batman & Ethics! Explore the ethical code of the world's greatest detective, Batman! And maybe learn something about philosophy. "Batman and Ethics goes behind the mask to shed new light on the complexities and contradictions of the Dark Knight’s moral code. From the logic behind his aversion to killing to the moral status of vigilantism and his use of torture in pursuit of justice (or perhaps revenge), Batman’s ethical precepts are compelling but often inconsistent and controversial. Philosopher and pop culture expert Mark D. White uses the tools of moral philosophy to track Batman’s most striking ethical dilemmas and decisions across his most prominent storylines from the early 1970s through the launch of the New 52, and suggests how understanding the mercurial moral character of the caped crusader might help us reconcile our own."
SOLD OUT: Hey, is that Bruce?! Is that Signor Squalo from L'Ultimo Squalo himself? Regardless, you can be the forever home for this 6 in / 15.24 cm needle-felted great white shark made by friend of the Gutter, Kerry Fristoe!
SOLD OUT: A swank Cinema Detroit t-shirts from our friends at Cinema Detroit. Show your support for the only truly independent movie theater in the metro Detroit area and look good doing it! Only one shirt available and shipping is US only. Sizes are: Women’s/Curvy M-XXL and Unisex M-XXXL
SOLD OUT: A digital copy of Dracula In Istanbul, aka, "Turkish Dracula," edited by Neon Harbor's Ed Glaser. "For the first time in English comes a remarkable literary discovery. In 1928, Turkish author Ali Rıza Seyfioğlu pirated Bram Stoker’s Dracula, rewriting it with new material, patriotic overtones, and Islam. A rare example of a 'bootleg' novel, it’s also the first adaptation to plainly identify Dracula as the historical warlord Vlad the Impaler."
SOLD OUT: Have a noggin filled with spooky thoughts? Proud of your endoskeletal cranium? Show off either or both this with a black wool beanie / watch cap with a skull pattern in light green or a grey wool beanie with a yellow skull pattern made and donated by Huge Shark! They are alpaca with merino wool skulls. Made in a house co-habited by cats, but washed before shipping. They'll fit a small to medium adult head.
We will be unlocking more perks as the campaign continues, but even $1 gets our Undying Thanks! (Really, a buck does make a difference).
If we don't reach our goal, we'll use the funds to print and ship your perks and see how much we can pay each editor. If we exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to print promotional materials or hire more guest writers. If we significantly exceed our goal, we will use our funds to give the writers some extra money.
 

The Impact
We like to think that the Gutter offers something special: Clear-eyed, thoughtful and thought-provoking writing on disreputable art. If you donate or support our campaign by sharing it, you will help keep the Gutter online and running; support our particular take on disreputable art; and help support paying writers for their work.
We ran a successful last fundraiser year, and, thanks to everyone's help, we kept the Gutter going and have been working on making the new Gutter as good as can be. The Cultural Gutter's survival depends on Gutterthon and on you. We know it's a bad time for creators of all kinds, that platforms are valued more than content, but we believe with your help we can keep the Gutter flowing with thoughtful writing on disreputable art. 
We know that it's a hard and stressful time for everyone. But even a retweet or sharing our campaign on Facebook helps us out. Indiegogo has tools that make it easy. Please consider using them even if you can't contribute. Anything you do to help is appreciated.
Thank you from all of us at The Cultural Gutter!

story:
Short Summary

1963. President Kennedy’s double is assassinated. Alive and well, JFK tries to figure out why they wanted him eliminated and what to do to protect himself against the possibility of a second assassination attempt.
 
The book is an historical novel filled with facts that are intermingled with unparalleled fiction. As in such films as Titanic and Forrest Gump, all of the events presented are not only real but verifiable. You can Google any event in this book and see that it did indeed happen, only in this case, fiction has rewritten the story to the point where it becomes impossible to separate fact from fantasy.

Back Cover

On November 22, 1963, the entire world would learn that President John F. Kennedy was assassinated in Dallas, Texas. At the same moment, the closest and most influential members of the White House Staff rush to the Situation Room where they find Robert F. Kennedy, Martin Luther King Jr. and ... President John F. Kennedy who is shocked to learn that his security stand-in has just been assassinated before the live television audience, to the grief of the entire world.

For security reasons, it is impossible to admit that it was Kennedy’s double who was killed and that the President was not even in Dallas. Since his arrival in Texas, his lookalike had given speeches, met with officials and given interviews, all of which was far above the role of a security stand-in during a presidential tour.

Moreover, as the President was still in Washington, it was inevitable that people would wonder if this was the first time he had acted in this way and, if not, under what circumstances this situation had previously occurred. How long had the President been duping the public? In the minutes that follow the assassination, John Kennedy understood that his presidency was over and that the only option open to him was how to become part of history, either in disgrace or in honor.

All of the assassination theories to date lead to Chicago and point to members of the mafia. And yet it seems that most of the plotting in this affair happened much further south. Kennedy, who was still alive, would thereafter have a single goal: to find out not only who assassinated him but, more importantly, to understand why they wanted to eliminate him. He would now have to do everything in his power to protect himself against a possible second assassination attempt.

Literary niche

Kennedy’s assassination still fascinates us more than 50 years after the event. It has fostered the publication of innumerable books trying to explain what really happened on that fateful Friday in November, 1963 with a wide variety of theories that range from the plausible to the outlandish.

The Kennedys created a book market in spite of themselves. Every time a new work is published, it quickly racks up enviable sales figures in bookstores and on line. In this light, Stephen King’s last novel, 11/22/63, proves that the interest in everything that surrounds John F. Kennedy is as strong as ever. King’s novel traces the history of a voyager in time who travels back to the day of the infamous event desperately trying to destroy Lee Harvey Oswald before he shoots the President. Hardly had this book been published than it shot up on the New York Times’ Best Seller list, and the film rights were subsequently acquired for a production scheduled to begin this fall.

Other Ways You Can Help

Let me know which cover you prefer. From left to right, 1 to 4.

Tell your friends, tell your family.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please  use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks !

story:
Thank you!!!

Wow - Crowdfunding for Authors  has passed Stretch Goal #2! I will be working hard on the workbook.

 

I'm grateful for the support of many writers, friends, and family during the month of May. Thank you!!! 

-Bethany

Writers! You can crowdfund your book.

I've helped authors beat the odds. Most crowdfunding campaigns fail - especially by authors (introverts, anyone?) - but my clients have had a 97% success rate. I wrote Crowdfunding for Authors so that you can crowdfund your book, too.

 

Crowdfunding for Authors is the step-by-step guide to crowdfunding your book, available for preorder here as an eBook. If you have a crowdfunding need that is not listed, please email me through the "Contact" link right below the video at the top so that we can chat, or visit my blog on TheArtistsPartner.com.
 

Crowdfunding works for your genre and format.

I've had the pleasure of working with writers of all kinds. From children's picture books to gritty memoir, crowdfunding has made the publication of the following titles possible.

 

The funds raised have gone to more than just eBook publication, too. The projects above represent audiobooks, multi-media iBooks, graphic novels, hard covers, and paperbacks, in addition to versions for the Kindle and other e-readers. Crowdfunding for Authors contains case studies and lessons learned from these campaigns that will help your book's crowdfunding campaign succeed.
 

Crowdfunding takes a plan.

It's easy to open a crowdfunding account - all you need is an email address. But it's really hard to meet your funding target. About two thirds of crowdfunding campaigns fail - and for writers, the figures are even worse. Over 70% of book campaigns fail to meet their goals.

 

Crowdfunding for Authors to the rescue! Over 97% of my clients succeed. (This percentage takes into account both campaign tally and size - they ranged from $1,000-$16,000.) Specifically, my book is tailored to the 91% of writers looking to raise up to $20,000 for their book. If you are planning on raising six - or even seven - figures, this may not be the right resource for you.

 

The book is organized chronologically, working from your campaign launch date backwards through the preparation stage, typically 3 months to a year. With checklists, templates, and case studies, each step is covered in detail. This includes all of the essentials, like:
  • How much time you'll need to prepare
  • How to set a good launch date
  • How to calculate your likely funds raised
  • How to use the marketing principle of "Effective Frequency" to make sure your campaign gets off to a strong start
  • How to use crowd psychology and the "Bandwagon Effect" to your advantage
  • How to create an enticing mix of backer rewards, and what is important at each tier
  • How to create and use effective campaign visuals

and much, much more! The current draft is about 38,000 words - lots of great material to guide you from concept to completion.

 

Crowdfunding Crowdfunding for Authors

It's a bit meta, I know - crowdfunding for a crowdfunding book. Although I've helped many authors, shepherding over $70,000 towards publication along the way, I hadn't experienced it on a project of my own. Guess what? I had more to learn. There have been delays. I have been afraid. I've hit dead ends, and brick walls. Before crowdfunding Crowdfunding for Authors, I knew what it looked like fund a book this way successfully. But I realize (sorry, my dear authors who worked with me before now) that I didn't know what it felt like. Not until today, when it's my book on the line.

I'm raising money here for professional cover design - like it or not, authors, people do judge a book by its cover. I've spent $500 on the draft for the eBook cover, which you can see here. To wrap this cover around the paperback takes about another $1,000.  But more importantly, I'm putting myself directly in your shoes. This will make Crowdfunding for Authors a better book for you.

And a little more about me: I'm Bethany Joy Carlson, CFA. I spent a couple decades in international finance, which is experience I love to share with authors. My background is in applied math and I've done research with NASA. Now I am thrilled to call Charlottesville home, where I split my time between crowdfunding consulting with The Artist's Partner, teaching math and physics at the Renaissance School, and training my Jack Russell / Blue Heeler.

Risks & Challenges

Pretty or plain, Crowdfunding for Authors will be in your hands. The book is written - so even if it is just a .pdf, you will receive a copy. This campaign is providing for professional packaging, but the professional content is complete. One way or another, I can't wait to send you Crowdfunding for Authors!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not everyone needs to buy this book. But perhaps you know someone who does! I'd really appreciate it if you would please:

  • Email the link to this campaign to your writer friends: https://igg.me/at/fundyourbook
  • Use the share tools to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, and beyond
  • Sign up for my blog at TheArtistsPartner.com
  • And wish me luck! I'm grateful!

Thank you so much for visiting and sending me your well wishes. It means more than you know!

Also, a special thank-you to Bensound.com for providing the music for the video for this campaign.

All my best,

Bethany

 

PS - Meet the Crowdfunding for Authors Authors!

I was the coach, but these are the brave men and women who did the hard work - some of them for over a year - to make their crowdfunding campaigns a success. Together, they raised over $70,000 for their books, using both Kickstarter and Indiegogo. Check out their campaigns. Better yet, check out their books!
 

Zack Bonnie* / Indiegogo - Dead, Insane, or In Jail: Overwritten
Marc Boston* / Kickstarter - The Girl Who Carried Too Much Stuff
Ramgiri Braun / Indiegogo - HeartSourcing
Lizzy Duncan, Brian Cunningham, and Giles Jackson / Kickstarter - Camila's Lemonade Stand
Jenny Edmondson* / Kickstarter- GroomsDay 
Mary Buford Hitz* / Kickstarter - Riding to Camille
Peter Kalifornsky and Katherine McNamara / Indiegogo- From the First Beginning, When the Animals Were Talking
Priya Mahadevan* / Kickstarter - Princesses Only Wear Putta-Puttas
Belinda Miller* / Did not fund - published anyway! - Above the Stars
Carolyn O'Neal* / Kickstarter - Kingsley
Bob Perry and Stefan Bechtel* / Kickstarter - Redemption Alley (originally funded as Bowling for the Mob, before signing a major contract with Rodale Press)

*These authors are kindly made their books available for the $25 signed book perk. (The other books are either electronic only, or the author is overseas.)

 

PPS...

Still reading? Thank you! Crowdfunding for Authors is the focus of this Indiegogo campaign, but through my consulting business, The Artist's Partner, I've helped artists of many kinds raise a quarter of a million dollars for their creative projects. I enjoy working with creative people.

So, if you have a creative project that is something other than a book, I would love to hear from you. Please fill out my questionnaire, and we'll schedule a time to chat - an hour to discuss your project is always free!
 

PPPS...

Don't take my word for it! Here is some of the feedback from my clients who raised funds for their projects using the same steps detailed in Crowdfunding for Authors.
 

Again, many thanks for your time! I'd love to send you a copy of Crowdfunding for Authors. The campaign deadline is midnight 5/31 - please order your copy today.

All my best,

Bethany

story:
The Five Unnecessaries...

was written by Laura Campbell, who is a stay at home mom, writer, coffee-aficionado, and crazy dreamer.  This story began as notes on paper and random documents years in the making, but leaped on the page within 6 months. 

The story delves into a world of incredible circumstances that require a bravery I only hope I could produce.  Here's the official synopsis:

Every year, 26 girls are chosen to be Protectors, a group of teenage girls who infiltrate the oppressive Republic and rescue those who the Republic labels "Unnecessaries": any imperfect, unplanned member of their society, or the pregnant women carrying them. 

Although the High Counselor can choose a 27th, it has only happened eight times in two centuries.  They remain legend because of their accomplishments and special abilities.  Never in her lifetime did Aislyn think she would see a 27th Protector chosen…or that it would be her. 

Even as she begins to doubt herself under the rigor of her training in espionage, medicine, and physical drills, Aislyn begins to challenge obsessive peers, question a rigid social system, and uncover her trainer Collin’s confusing emotional whiplash. 

And while she still is uncertain, she begins to fight for the chance that she was meant for this, and the chance to rescue a child who only has one hope for survival: Her.

Awesome, right?

The truth is that this book raises great questions about how we live our lives.  Our website is going to be focused on taking the emotions you read as she rescues these children and infants and focus them on making a difference in our world through partnering organizations such as CURE and Compassion International.  

So, big dreams, big book, big impact...but no clout.  Since I'm a new author, self- publishing is the best way to go.  Self-Publishing campaigns can be very successful, and I've already made some connections with a Messiah College Senior who is going to edit my book at a discounted price than normal for the credit of editor in the novel, and we've already made a great cover.  We just need some extra money to get this off the ground!  Luckily, Dan (my awesome husband) has perfected the html to make this an eBook, so we are all set for Kindle!  What we need is the resources to get the first few in print, and then the profit from that will cycle back to Create Space to print more books, until eventually we'll have enough to go to Creation Festival East, where we really hope to break through to our target audience, and we can also begin to advertise on blogs as well!

What We Need

Here's the breakdown:

$200 Cover (we need to cover what we spent on the cover)

$200 Proofreading and Editing  (we need to fix those typo)

$250 First 50 Copies in print  (Create Space rocks!)

$ 50 Merchandise (stickers with hashtag #nounnecessaries)


What if we don't make our goal?

We will continue to sell on Google Play and the edited book will be on Kindle mid January.  We will use that money to fund these items.  If you give what you can give, you can get us there faster or even get us advertising sooner!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Spread the word!!!  The readers of this book so far have loved it!  We have a website and we are on FB! 
    https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-27th-Protector-Series/311471472379405
    http://the27thprotector.wix.com/thefiveunnecessaries

    There's also perks for giving: check them out!

    Thank you!  Thank you in advance!  Thank you for believing in the dreamers, like Aislyn, like so many other characters of this book, and like me, who are fighting for a chance to change the world with a story!  God Bless, and have a great new year!

she still is uncertain, she begins to fight for the chance that she was meant
for this, and the chance to rescue a child who only has one hope for survival:
Her.
Awesome, right?
The truth is that this book raises great questions about how we live our lives.  Our website is going to be focused on taking the emotions you read as she rescues these children and infants and focus them on making a difference in our world through partnering organizations such as CURE and Compassion International.  
So, big dreams, big book, big impact...but no clout.  Since I'm a new author, self- publishing is the best way to go.  Self-Publishing campaigns can be very successful, and I've already made some connections with a Messiah College Senior who is going to edit my book at a discounted price than normal for the credit of editor in the novel, and we've already made a great cover.  We just need some extra money to get this off the ground!  Luckily, Dan (my awesome husband) has perfected the html to make this an eBook, so we are all set for Kindle!  What we need is the resources to get the first few in print, and then the profit from that will cycle back to Create Space to print more books, until eventually we'll have enough to go to Creation Festival East, where we really hope to break through to our target audience, and we can also begin to advertise on blogs as well!   What We Need 
Here's the breakdown:
$200 Cover (we need to cover what we spent on the cover)
$200 Proofreading and Editing  (we need to fix those typo)
$250 First 50 Copies in print  (Create Space rocks!)
$ 50 Merchandise (stickers with hashtag #nounnecessaries)
  What if we don't make our goal?  We will continue to sell on Google Play and the edited book will be on Kindle mid January.  We will use that money to fund these items.  If you give what you can give, you can get us there faster or even get us advertising sooner!    Other Ways You Can HelpSpread the word!!!  The readers of this book so far have loved it!  We have a website and we are on FB!  https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-27th-Protector-Series/311471472379405http://the27thprotector.wix.com/thefiveunnecessariesThere's also perks for giving: check them out!Thank you!  Thank you in advance!  Thank you for believing in the dreamers, like Aislyn, like so many other characters of this book, and like me, who are fighting for a chance to change the world with a story!  God Bless, and have a great new year!

story:
Who Am I?

  • My name is Orlando Montoya.  I started my radio career in Central Florida in 1995.  I have been producing radio stories on the Georgia coast since 1998.  My professional awards include 13 from the Georgia Associated Press Broadcast Association and two from the Society of Professional Journalists.  I have interviewed literally thousands of people across a wide range of interests and locations in Southeast Georgia.  I continue doing so through at SavannahPodcast.com.

What Is Savannah Podcast?

  • Savannah Podcast is a multimedia storytelling enterprise that highlights creativity, passion and change in the Coastal Empire.  It is published online at SavannahPodcast.com and iTunes.  It is broadcast as a one-hour weekly radio show at 2pm on Fridays on WHCJ 90.3 FM Savannah State University.  It is published as a print story in Connect Savannah.
  • It's broadly focused because that's the way my mind works.  I cannot limit myself to business and politics, like most of the media does, because I would get bored very easily and I think that our world is a lot richer and fuller than that.  Everyone is creative and passionate.  Everyone changes.  I believe that everyone has a story.  
  • It's broadcast quality because I'm not going to lower my standards.  I believe in a polished product, well researched, recorded on good equipment and produced over a period of days, not hours.  And all of this takes time.
  • It's in depth because I have grown tired of soundbytes and headlines.  I'd rather learn more about fewer things than skim the top of many things.
  • That's why I believe in being in conversation.  The interview format takes longer but is more personal and conveys more context.  It is an old broadcast format that sadly has fallen into disfavor.  I admired people like Dick Cavett on TV and Leonard Lopate on the radio.

Why Is This Campaign Important?

  • I cannot continue to tell stories like this without your financial contributions.  I do not work for a large media corporation.  I work for myself.  That means that no one tells me what types of stories to produce or how to produce them.  But it also means that I must rely on people like you to help me make a living.
  • Your contributions help important stories get out there into the world.  Many are touched by my stories online, on the radio and in print.  I believe that telling stories is a way that we connect ourselves to other people.  By listening deeply to one another, we make the world a better place.

How Does This Fundraiser Work?

  • When you pledge to this campaign, you are paying for the time that it takes me to research, record, write, edit, produce, distribute and publicize my stories.  There are many steps that require time that isn't paid for unless you step forward and say that it is worth something.
  • You earn various rewards at various levels of support.  I have chosen "Thank You" gifts that focus on connecting you with great experiences in Savannah and beyond -- art, music, food and history.  The real gift is sharing stories -- like none other -- in ways like none other.

story:
Spirit QC part one manuscript has been written but I need your help!

My name is Lawrey and I love to write. Spirit QC is my first ever novel and it has been a massive learning experience. My interest in writing started as a teenager and magnified as my writing ability was recognised by a short screenplay initiative.

Having written several screenplays and seen the fruition of the stories produced into film, I found that character development was some what limited, hence why I started writing Spirit QC which offered freedom to explore multiple characters and delve into a heavy and complex storyline.

To date, I've started writing the second book of Spirit QC but have issues bringing the original idea into the spotlight.

If reading doesn't interest you and you are not familiar with story writing, there are many stages from conception of the idea to the finality of the published print.

A hurdle that causes doubt in many emerging writers is that to get published you need an agent but it's a hurdle to get an agent if you're not published. Understand the frustration!!!

But Spirit QC isn't ready to be published quiet yet. The manuscript has been through multiple edits and has improved but would benefit the most by passing through the hands of a highly qualified manuscript editor. I've picked a local editor from a mess of many in Queensland and with her experience and qualifications comes a hefty price tag. When you read the paragraph below keep in mind that the Spirit QC manuscript has a word count of 115379.

Editor’s In-Depth Report + Editorial Mark-Up for Budding Writers: $550
For up to 50,000 words, with a further $10.10 per 1,000 words over 50,000.
For work under 50,000 words, $10.10 per 1,000 words.
This 7-12 page report cites global issues, eg., character,structure, plot, to finer points of paragraphs and sentences.
Editorial comments are provided as a manuscript mark-up.

I know what you're thinking ... that's a hefty sum!

But well worth it as a push in the right direction to get Spirit QC published :D

I hear you asking, 'What is Spirit QC about?'

Well I'm glad you finally asked!!

Synopsis:

In a feat to help suicide victims, Dr. Goldman, a past-life psychologist, tunes into a girl named Carla who unlike others in group therapy, has manipulative privileges that break between the bonds of the dead into the realm of the living.
Through therapy, the group find themselves involved with Kate, the daughter of a murdered police officer who investigates the suspicious circumstances surrounding her fathers death.

Target audience:

Spirit QC is a literary fiction novel and targets late adolescence and adult readers. The story reflects on those who have suffered due to mental health issues, as well as a relevance to Australia’s history regarding corruption within Government agencies and organised crime syndicates. The explicit content in the varying chapters along with confronting descriptions and tension of surprise require a degree of maturity to piece together issues in our developed society, attempts to break from conformity as well as the possibilities surrounding the afterlife.

The story is set in the city of Brisbane and surrounding suburbs.

Interested?

Did I mention I'm a student of psychological science? Delving deep into the human psyche is a trait of my writing.

Spirit QC involves a very complex storyline that will likely be more than a trilogy given that corruption in society along with the intricacies of human beings lends a lot of material to ponder upon.

The focus of the story is of course on the victims. Like you and me, people are fragile no matter how much they deny it and I'm sure either yourself, someone you know, or someone you've lost has had a battle that has affected you in someway. This is why Spirit QC focuses on the life stories of suicide victims.
With the money raised, I plan to donate 10% to BeyondBlue on behalf of all the contributors - that means YOU.

Now you're thinking - you won't have enough to get the professional edit!
Don't worry about it. We'll be so much closer to the target than we were before funding and plus, I'd rather be short 10% of the funding knowing we have contributed to a worthy cause.

If you haven't figured it out yet, the QC stands for Queen's Council.
The Spirit QC are honored judges that fight for the justice that the typical law system fails on a constant basis. Ever been angered by an undeniably guilty individual who gets off a manslaughter charge by either a clever lawyer, a loophole or double jeopardy?
Well, the Spirit QC won't stand for this!

Please support this book series in its next stage of development - the highly qualified professionals critique and edit.
